loans.name: Bibiana Raquel

texts.es:
Bibiana is a hard working woman. Since she was a young girl she helped her family business which was selling food. Now that she is older, she realized that there wasn’t an economical place to eat in her neighborhood so she decided to open up her own kitchen in order to help her family with the household expenses and provide herself with the items she needs. Thanks to the good service and delicious food that they serve she has been successful with her business.

Now she needs a loan for US$250, which will be repaid in 3 months, to buy supplies, and therefore offer her clients greater variety in the menu and dishes that she prepares. With your help Bibi will succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Bibiana es una mujer emprendedora, desde muy pequeña ayudaba en el negocio familiar el cual es la venta de comida, ahora que ya es mayor, al darse cuenta que por su colonia no había ninguna cocina económica decidió poner su propia cocina, para así poder ayudar a su familia con los gastos de la cas, y costear ella misma sus necesidades. Gracias al buen servicio y la deliciosa comida que sirven ha tenido éxito con su negocio.

Ahora necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar insumos, y así ofrecerle a sus clientes más variedad en el menú de platillos que prepara. Con tu apoyo Bibi saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Comprar insumos

loans.name: Jesus Martin

texts.es:
Martín learned the bricklaying trade as a child thanks to his father. Now he is 21 years old and wishes to become independent and work for himself in order to obtain greater income and support his family with their expenses.

He needs a loan for US $250, which will be repaid in 3 months, to buy materials and his own set of tools for work in order to be able to offer his services. Let’s help Martín build his business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Martín desde muy pequeño aprendió el oficio de albañilería gracias a las enseñanzas de su papa, pero ahora que ya tienen 21 años, el desea independizarse y dedicarse a este oficio por si solo, para así poder obtener mejores ingresos y apoyar a su familia con los gastos familiares.

El necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar materiales y sus propias herramientas de trabajo, para así poder ofrecer su servicio. Ayudemos a Martin a construir su negocio.

loans.use: Buy tools for work

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela works in distributing lunches to construction workers. She became interested in preparing and distributing food when her husband, who is a construction foreman, was put in charge of a site and he asked her if she would bring food for him and his colleagues. So that was how, once that job was finished, she began to offer food to her friends and now she delivers 20 meals at the site where her brother-in-law works in Chorillos. With the loans she has received, Graciela has purchased pots, spoons, candles, buckets, and has fixed her gas cooking stove.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Graciela labora en la repartición de almuerzos a obreros de construcción. Ella se animó a preparar y repartir comida cuando su esposo, quien es maestro de obras, se hizo cargo de una construcción y le pidió que llevara comida para él y sus compañeros. Fue así como, una vez terminada la obra, ella pasó a ofrecer comida a sus amistades y ahora entrega 20 almuerzos en la constructora donde trabaja su cuñado, ubicada en Chorrillos. Con los préstamos que ha adquirido, Graciela ha comprado ollas, cucharones, táperes, baldes y ha arreglado las hornillas de su cocina a gas.

loans.use: Purchase pots and fix her kitchen

loans.name: Rissikatou

texts.fr: Born on 22 January 1986 in Lomé, Mrs. Rissikatou Y.

loans.use: To buy soap, milk, and a big container of cooking oil to sell individually at a higher profit margin.

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es:
Jackeline is 20 years old with two young children. She has been selling prepared foods for more than two years. In the winter, she goes out with her cart to sell hot broth or mazamorra (a sweet dessert made of corn). In the summer, she offers ceviche ( raw seafood marinated in lemon juice and spices) and chicha morada (a sweet soft drink made of purple corn and cinnamon). Jackeline says that her clients look for her every night. With the loan she has requested, she will buy ingredients with which to prepare her food products.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Jackeline tiene 29 años y dos hijos pequeños. Ella viene trabajando más de dos años en la venta de comida. Dependiendo si es invierno, ella sale con su carreta a vender caldo o mazamorra. Pero si es verano, ofrece cebiche y chicha morada. Jackeline dice que su clientela todas las noches la buscan. Con los préstamos que ha pedido, ella ha comprado ingredientes para elaborar sus comidas.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make the prepared foods she offers

loans.name: Essomededou

texts.fr:
Mr. Essomededou K. was born on 31 December 1983 in Assoukoko in the Prefecture of Blitta. He is married and has one child. He began a butcher shop in the Agoè neighbourhood in Lomé. His knowledge and way of greeting his customers leads to good sales. His plan is to buy 8 pigs in order to maintain his clientele ; it is for this reason he is asking for a loan of 300,000CFA.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur K. Essomededou est né le 31 décembre 1983 à Assoukoko dans la préfecture de Blitta. Il est marié et père d’un enfant. Il a crée une charcuterie dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Son savoir faire et sa façon d’accueillir les clients lui permettent de bien vendre. Son projet est d’acheter 8 porcs afin de pouvoir maintenir sa clientèle ; c’est ainsi qu’il sollicite un crédit de 300.000FCFA.

loans.use: To buy pork to cook and sell to local workers.

loans.name: Aku

texts.fr:
Mrs. Aku A. was born on 3 August 1968 in Aholukopé in the Prefecture of Zio. She is married to Mr. Etsè DOSSOU, who is a taxi driver. Mrs. Aku A. helps her husband a lot in meeting the family expenses. She is a retailer of palm oil in the Adidoadin area of Lomé. She makes her purchases in the areas of Notsè and Tsévié. In this time of surplus, she is asking for a loan of 200,000FCFA to buy 10 cans and 25 litres of red palm oil.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Aku est née le 03 août 1968 à Aholukopé dans la préfecture de Zio. Elle s’est mariée à Monsieur DOSSOU Etsè qui est un chauffeur de taxi. Madame A. Aku aide beaucoup son mari dans les dépenses familiales. Elle est revendeuse de l’huile de palme dans le quartier adidoadin à Lomé. Elle fait ses achats dans les localités de Notsè et de Tsévié. En ce temps d’abondance, elle sollicite un crédit de 200.000FCFA pour l’achat de 10 bidons de 25 litres d’huile rouge.

loans.use: To buy red palm oil, a very popular cooking oil used to make many delicious dishes in West Africa

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul began his business because he needed to increase his income to care for his 4 children, ages 3, 6, 8 and 10. He learned the crafts business when he was young, inheriting it from his father. The village is known for its pottery, and Raul's father wanted him to continue with this tradition. Raul has always been an enterprising person with a knack for sales. He is requesting a loan, which he will repay in 6 months, to grow his business, increase his sales and his income. Your help will make this possible.

Raúl inició el negocio para incrementar los ingresos familiares debido a que tiene 4 hijos, que cuentan con 3, 6, 8 y10 años de edad, desde pequeño conoce el negocio, ya que es herencia de su padre y todo el pueblo se dedica a la alfarería, desde niño es el oficio que se le inculco, porque e su padre deseaba que continuara con esto. Comenzó hace 10 años debido a la situación familiar y con el deseo de brindar apoyo económico a sus hijos y a su esposa, así como lograr tener independencia económica ya que iniciaba una familia, además de que siempre ha sido una persona emprendedora y tiene el gusto por las ventas.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para seguir ampliando su negocio y de esta manera poder incrementar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. Con tu apoyo esto será posible.

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HIS POTTERY BUSINESS, INCREASE HIS INCOME FROM SALES, AND CONTINUE TO SUPPORT HIS WIFE AND 4 CHILDREN.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita sells soft drinks and beer wholesale and retail. Her store is located in her house, and has been operational for 6 years. She says that her best selling product is beer.

With this loan, she will be able to continue investing in her store and will restock it well with beverages. She will also acquire a refrigerator. With the earnings from her sales, she helps her children.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Margarita se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y cervezas al por mayor y menor. Su tienda está ubicada en su misma casa y ya tiene funcionando 6 años. Ella dice que la cerveza es lo que más vende.

Con los préstamos que ha obtenido ha podido seguir invirtiendo en su tienda y comprar más bebidas. Además, pudo adquirir una heladera. Con las ganancias de sus ventas, ella ayuda a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy more beverages and acquire a refrigerator.

loans.name: Karin

texts.es:
Karin is a teacher's aide, but she had to leave that work when she became pregnant. For that reason, she evaluated alternative vocations that would allow her to be at home with her baby . That's how, with the help of her mother in law Flor, she came to run an internet café, located in her own home.

The business boasts 5 computers and has been up and running for 7 months. During this time, she has lost a CD reader and a hard disk to robbery by bad clients. With the loans that she has requested, she has maintained the computers and replaced the stolen accessories.

Karin would like to add 4 additional computers and expand her business with a photocopy machine and a phone booth, eventually.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Karin es auxiliar de educación, pero tuvo que dejar esta labor debido a que salió embarazada. Por este motivo, evaluó nuevas alternativas de trabajo que le permitan estar en casa para cuidar a su bebe. Fue así que, con la ayuda de su suegra Flor, ella ahora administra una cabina de Internet, ubicada en su misma casa.

El negocio consta de 5 computadoras y ya viene funcionando 6 meses. En este tiempo, ya han sufrido robos de disquetera y lector de CD por parte de malos clientes. Con los préstamos que ha pedido, ella ha dado mantenimiento a las computadoras y ha repuesto los accesorios robados.

Karin quisiera aumentar 4 computadoras más y ampliar su negocio con fotocopiadora y locutorio.

loans.use: For the maintenance of the computers and the purchase of accessories

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
Flor sells food dishes. She began by selling food out of her home, but she wasn't getting enough clients. She later decided to sell food from her mom's house. She has been there for the past year and she now has 15 solid clients and counting.

Flor is now helping her sister-in-law open up internet stations(cubicles). Flor came up with the money and this is how this business got started. Her sister-in-law takes care of it, but Flor would like to expand it by offering copier services and a telephone booth, and one day solely concentrate on this and stop selling food dishes.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer.

Flor se dedica a la venta de comida. Ella comenzó el negocio en su casa, pero la clientela disminuyó, por lo que tuvo que mudarse de lugar y se fue a vender sus menúes en la casa de su mamá. Ya va a cumplir un año allí y dice que le va bien. Tiene 15 pensionistas fijos, y aparte, vende al público en general. Flor ha ayudado a su nuera Karin a poner su negocio de cabinas de Internet. Ella dispuso del capital, fue así que el negocio surgió. Ahora su nuera está a cargo de las cabinas, pero a Flor le gustaría ampliar este negocio con fotocopiadora y locutorio, así, dar de baja su negocio de venta de comida.

loans.use: To help her sister-in-law with a new venture

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana sells cotton t-shirts from town to town. A friend of hers makes this polo t-shirts with a namebrand Chesster. This is how she started to sell these t-shirts to friends and family in Chincha, located 2 hours from Lima.

Juana used to have a restaurant, but had to leave it behind because her doctor recommended that cooking wasn't good for her health. She goes to Chincha every 2 weeks to sell the t-shirts and then every friday she collects money from people who haven't paid for their t-shirts.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer.

Juana vende y reparte polos de algodón a provincia. Una amiga de ella confecciona polos marca Chesster, fue así que ella empezó a ofrecerlos entre sus familiares y amigos que viven en Chincha, una ciudad a 2 horas y media de Lima. Antes, Juana vendía comida en su restaurante, pero tuvo que abandonar este negocio debido a que el médico le prohibió cocinar. Cada quincena, Juana lleva a Chincha medio ciento, y todos los viernes va a cobrar por los polos vendidos.

loans.use: To purchase t-shirts to later sell them around the city

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa sells delicious food dishes. Her clients are the drivers in the area that have known her for the past 5 years. She used to work in a nearby restaurant in front of her house. She later had the opportunity to open up her own and began to sell her food dishes to drivers in the area.

Luisa would like to run her restaurant from home so that she won't have to lease anywhere else and be close to her children. In order to do this, she must renovate her house to make room for a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer.

Luisa se dedica a la venta de comida. Sus clientes son los choferes de la zona que ya la conocen desde hace 5 años. Ella antes trabajaba en un restaurante al frente de su casa, pero luego tuvo la oportunidad de poner su propio negocio, y empezó a dar pensión de comida a los choferes de la zona. Luisa quisiera mudar su restaurante a su casa, para así no pagar alquiler y estar cerca de sus hijos. Sin embargo, para poder lograr esto, primero tiene que ampliar su casa y adecuarla para su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase basic ingredients to prepare food dishes

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.es:
Raymunda sells different American products and vitamins with the namebrand FOREVER. This is a namebrand with products such as pills, vitamins, lotions and beauty products. The selling is done through catalogs. A friend told Raymunda about this business, and this is how she began to attend meetings to learn how to sell these products.

Raymundo has been a FOREVER distributor for the past 3 years and says that she makes pretty good commissions. She also takes care of ill people since she's also a geriatric nurse. With the previous loans, Raymunda has been able to buy products to sell to friends. She would one day like to open up a phone booth in Manchay but still sell her FOREVER products.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer.

Raymunda se dedica a la venta de productos y vitaminas americanas FOREVER. Esta marca consta de una gama de productos como pastillas, vitaminas, cremas, nutrientes e hidratantes de belleza. La venta es por catálogo. Ella conoció sobre este negocio por medio de una amiga, y fue así que empezó a participar de las reuniones donde se difunde esta línea de productos importados. Raymunda ya tiene tres años como distribuidora de FOREVER y dice que le ha ido bien con las comisiones de venta que ella gana. Además, ella se ayuda económicamente cuidando enfermos, ya que es enfermera geriátrica. Con los préstamos que ha pedido, Raymunda ha comprado productos para ofrecer a sus amistades. A ella le gustaría abrir un locutorio en Manchay, pero sin descuidar las ventas de productos FOREVER.

loans.use: To purchase more FOREVER products

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria has a stall in the market where she sells coffee and snacks. She started the business 5 years ago. Gloria borrowed to invest in her husband's cellular phone and watch business. She's managed to build her house and adapt a room to set up a shop. Her goal is to furnish the shop and stock it with merchandise. Gloria wants to keep her market stall and leave her daughters in charge of the shop at her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Gloria tiene un puesto de especias secas para dulcería y café en el mercado. Ella empezó a vender desde hace 5 años. Gloria ha pedido préstamos para invertir en el negocio de su esposo, quien vende teléfonos celulares y relojes. Ahora, ella ha podido construir su casa y ha adecuado un ambiente para poner una tienda. Su meta es poder amoblar y surtir la tienda con mercadería. Gloria desea seguir con el puesto en el mercado, y dejar a sus hijas encargadas de la tienda en su casa.

loans.use: Invest in her husband's business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is a multi-tasker. She sells breakfast, snacks, beer, refreshments, clothes and knits sweaters. She begans her day at 4:00 in the morning to prepare the breakfast meals she will then sell which consists of different oats and soya (some type of oatmeal) and then on Saturdays she prepares chanfainita (spicy pork and potato dish) with caldo de mote (wheatberry soup). At about 6:30 am she sets her food cart in front of her house and sets up her food stand where she sells her food dishes/snacks beer and refreshments.

She stops selling breakfast between 10:00 & 10:30 am but continues to sell snacks/refreshments throughout the day. She has been doing this for about 6 years. Nonetheless, she remembers working since she was about 18 years old at the local supermarket selling breakfast and yogurt. With her previous loans, she has been able to purchase tables and canopies and ingredients to prepare breakfast. With her earnings she supports her nephews who are orphans. She would like to move to a different area in Lima and open up a clothing store and sell at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa es una mujer multifacética. Ella vende desayunos, golosinas, cerveza, gaseosas, ropa a pedidos y teje chompas. Ella se levanta a las 4 de la mañana ha preparar los desayunos que consisten en quinua, soya, maca o quaker. Los sábados ofrece chanfainita y caldo de mote. Rosa a las 6 y 30 de la mañana saca su carreta en la puerta de su casa e improvisa su cochera como comedor. Ahí coloca las mesas para sus comensales. A las 10 y 30 la jornada ha terminado, pero ella sigue vendiendo golosinas durante el día. Ella ya lleva 6 años vendiendo de esta manera en su casa. Sin embargo, Rosa recuerda que desde hace 18 ella trabajaba en el mercado vendiendo desayunos y yogurt. Con los préstamos que ha pedido, ha comprado mesas, toldos e ingredientes para preparar sus desayunos. Con el dinero obtenido, Rosa apoya a sus sobrinos huérfanos. A ella le gustaría mudarse a otra zona de Lima y poner un negocio de ropa al por mayor.

loans.use: To buy more tables and canopies

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma has sold beer and soft drinks for 9 years. She supplies them to neighbors for parties and birthdays. Norma doesn't stop working at a set time and her beer is available for sale 24 hours a day. Her husband encouraged her to set up the business and she has no regrets. She remembers that her first order was for 40 cases of beer. That still motivates her. Now, she gets her supplies from a distributor who leaves the drinks at her house. In the future, Norma might want to set up a business selling gas cylinders because she's realized that there's no similar business in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Norma desde hace 9 años vende cerveza y gaseosas. Ella abastece de estas bebidas a sus vecinos cuando hay fiestas y cumpleaños. Norma no repara en la hora, la venta de cerveza está disponible las 24 horas del día. Fue su esposo quien le motivó a montar este negocio y no se arrepiente. Norma recuerda que la primera vez vendió 40 cajas de cerveza. Eso la motivó aún más. Ahora, una distribuidora la abastece y le deja en su casa las bebidas. Norma quisiera para el futuro poner un negocio de balones de gas, ya que se ha dado cuenta que este rubro de venta no existe por su zona.

loans.use: Buy beer for resale.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome L., 69, is married and has four children.  She has three years' experience operating a retail shop, where she sells goods six days a week to passersby. Her husband helps her operate this business. Salome has taken out and repaid two loans from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $83. SPBD loans are Salome’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. Part of this loan will be used to improve her house.

loans.use: To buy a cash box and a scale

loans.name: Moe

texts.en: Moe A., 56, is married and has 10 children.  She has four years of experience running a retail shop, and sells her goods to the people of her community at the public market six days per week. Her husband works with her. In the past, she has taken out seven loans from SPBD, and she now expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $500. SPBD loans are Moe’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used to improve and repair her house; the balance will go toward restocking her business.

loans.use: To buy new inventory for her shop

loans.name: Lilieni

texts.en: Lilieni T., 19, is married with one child.  She has worked as a vegetable gardener for the last two years, and six days a week sells her produce to the public and the people of her village at the main market in town. She has taken out one previous loan from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $291.  SPBD loans are Lilieni’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from a traditional bank. Part of the loan will be used to expand her house, or for repairs. Her husband helps her operate her business on Friday and Saturday and works at the local gas station from Monday to Thursday.

loans.use: Purchase cucumber, cabbage, tomato and pumpkin seeds, along with beans and fertilizer.

loans.name: Olipa

texts.en: Olipa C., 32, is married and has six children.  She has three years of experience in the business of making puddings, which she sells six days a week to school children and the public at the main market in her town. She has taken out and repaid two previous loans from SPBD.  She expects the weekly net cash flow from her business to be about $291. SPBD loans are Oripa’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. She will use part of the loan for house repairs and to educate her children. Her husband works at the area's fishery department, but also helps Olipa out with her business when he is free.

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn flour, a gas cooker, an empty gas bottle, a pot for deep frying and aluminum bowls for baking.

loans.name: Faaotaota

texts.en: Faaotaota P., 42, is married and has eight children. For more than two years, she has made a living selling cooked banana chips to school children, residents of her village and the public. She does this six days a week. In the past, she took out one loan from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $250.  SPBD loans are Faaotaota’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with a traditional bank. Part of her loan will be used to expand and repair her house. Her husband is employed at a nearby company, Funway Rental.

loans.use: Purchase a bundle of bananas, a gallon of oil, a pan for deep frying, a gas cooker and plastic bags.

loans.name: Sivai

texts.en:
Sivai T., 54, is married and has eight children. She has been in the business of selling taro products for the last four years. She sells to the general public and to people in her village two days per week. Her husband and children help her out with her business.

Sivai has had five prior loans from SPBD, and expects to earn a weekly net cash flow of $166. SPBD loans are Sivai’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. She will use part of her loan to increase her earnings by building a copra dryer, which people in this part of the world use to process coconuts.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for her plantation and materials to build a copra dryer.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer T., 28, is single and has no children but lives with and supports her parents.  For the past year, she has worked as a seamstress, making sarongs and dresses. Two days a week, she sells her goods to relatives, friends and villagers. She has  taken out and repaid previous loans from SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be $75. SPBD loans are Jennifer’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric dyes

loans.name: Marco Martin

texts.es:
Currently the client lives in a single room that he shares with his wife and daughter. He gives private tennis lessons. He will use the loan to buy a piece of land since in the future he wants to have his own house and be able to provide his family with a better home.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

EL cliente actualmente vive en una habitación que comparte con su esposa e hija, trabaja dando clases particulares de ténis, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de un lote de terreno ya que en el fututo desea tener su casa propia y poderle brindar mejores condiciones de vivienda a su familia.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 49146

loans.name: Soselina

texts.en: Soselina L., 53, is married, the mother of five children and loves gardening. Her husband works in security for a local bank. For the last two years, L. has run a flower shop. She sells to the general public and to people from nearby villages for two days each week. She has no previous loans from SPBD, but projects a weekly net cash flow of about $50.  SPBD loans are Soselina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. She plans to use this loan to add a small room to her house from which she can sell her flowers.

loans.use: To build a small room from which to sell flowers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To replenish a small women's clothing store and increase her income.

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en: Lusia A., 51, is widowed and has six children.  She has four years of experience selling products made with bananas and taro. She sells to the general public and to villagers three days per week, and has taken out four previous loans from SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow from her business to be $187. SPBD loans are Lusia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from a traditional bank. Part of her loan will be used for her children's education.

loans.use: To expand her business and buy more cooking utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To increase her inventory and add tablecloths and curtains

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa M., 26, is married and has four children. Currently, her husband does contract work and contributes money to the family every fortnight. Luisa has been in the business of making pancakes for the last year, and sells her cooking to locals who stop by her food stall on the road near her village six days a week. She has no previous loans from SPBD, but does bring in a weekly net cash flow of about $125. SPBD loans are Luisa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy a gas oven, wok, bags of flour, a bag of sugar and oil

loans.name: Gafa

texts.en: Gafa L., 64, is married and has five children.  She has three years of experience in the business of cooking taro and banana, and sells her cooking to villagers and the general public six days a week. She has  received three previous loans from SPBD and expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $208. SPBD loans are Gafa’s only access to capital because she is unable to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.  Gafa's business is stable and she plans to use this loan for home improvement and her children`s education.

loans.use: To pay for her children`s education and for home improvement

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start a small business of selling fresh meat.

loans.name: Upuia

texts.en: Upuia F., 45, is married and has four children.  She has three years' experience in the business of cooking taro and bananas, and sells to villagers and the general public six days a week. She has had two previous loans from SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $208. SPBD loans are Upuia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used for home improvement.  Upuia is a hard working mother and has created her business to help care for her family.

loans.use: To buy machetes, pesticides, a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, flavorings and oil

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria T., 36, is married with three children and has been in the fishing business for the last two years. She sells her catch to villagers and the general public five days a week. She has had one previous loan from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $145. SPBD loans are Maria’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. The loan will allow her to use more of her earnings to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy a fishing net, a spear, fishing shoes and a pair of goggles.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food and to improve her business conditions.

loans.name: Itagia

texts.en: Itagia F., 69, is married has nine children.  She has many years of experience raising beans, cabbages and tomatoes, and sells her produce to villagers and the public three days a week. She has taken out and repaid three previous loans from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $145.  SPBD loans are Itagia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. She will use the loan solely to buy equipment and materials for her farming business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, equipment and seeds

loans.name: Seepa

texts.en: Seepa T. is 58 years old, married and has seven children.  She has many years of experience in the lawn-mowing business, which she does three days a week. In the past, she took out and repaid two loans from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be $104. SPBD loans are Seepa’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for loans from traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy a lawn mower

loans.name: Afaiva

texts.en: Afaiva S., 33, is married with 5 children.  She has 2 year(s) of experience in the vegetable business.She will use part of her loan to buy equipment to improve her business.   She sells to the villagers/public 1 days per week. She has 1 previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Afaiva’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase tomatoes, cucumbers, pumpkin and round cabbages seeds

loans.name: Ferila

texts.en: Ferila A., 22, is married with 1 children.  She has 3 year(s) of experience in the Ice cake (Ice cream) / popcorn business. She sells to the villagers and public. 2 days per week. She has no previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD).  SPBD loans are Ferila’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used strictly to operate the business.

loans.use: Purchase plastic cups, concentration, plastic papers and sugar.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa T., 23, is married and has two children.  She has many years' experience driving a taxi, which she does for a living six days a week. Her husband also works as a taxi driver. Teresa has applied for her first loan from SPBD for about WST$750 to repair her vehicle because she was unable to secure a loan to do this from traditional banks.

loans.use: To repair her taxi

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun Y., 51, and her husband have been married for over thirty years. They have four children. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. Their youngest daughter is a silk weaver. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Saroeun has been a silk weaver since she was young. It’s a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.

Now, Mrs. Saroeun is requesting a loan of $250 to finish her daughter’s house (she is shown in the photo with her). Her daughter, Mrs. Sreykhouch Ty, is in the process of building a house in front of her parents’ house. Sreykhouch is a silk weaver and her husband is a village doctor.

loans.use: To finish her daughter’s house

loans.name: Sotheany

texts.en:
Mrs. Sotheany U., 23, and her husband Mr. Sam-At Sok were married in 2005. They have one daughter. The couple lives with Sotheany’s parents on an Island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sotheany has been a silk weaver for eight years. It’s a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who will take them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a silk weaver as well, and now he is creating another business - planting mushrooms to sell. Mushrooms are a very important staple vegetable in Cambodian food.

So, Sotheany is requesting a loan of $700 to build a room for her husband for planting mushrooms.

loans.use: To build a room for planting mushrooms

loans.name: Bunlong

texts.en:
Mr. Bunlong T., 30, and his wife Mrs. Fatiny Kob were married in 2004. They have one daughter and one son. The couple lives with their parents along National Road number six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Bunlong and his wife have been farming since they were married. They grow many kinds of vegetables in their own farm, which is a bit far from their house. Now they are requesting a loan of $100 to purchase pump material for a water pumping machine to aid in farming.

loans.use: To purchase pump material for a water pumping machine to aid in farming.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mr. Sophal B., 35, and his wife Mrs. Mom Srey were married in 2005. They have one son. The couple lives with their parents along National Road number six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Sophal has been a mason for seventeen years. His wife stays at home and takes care of their little son. She wants to start selling coffee in the near future. The couple is in the process of building their own house, but they are short of money to finish it. Mr. Sophal is requesting a loan of $1,000 to build his house.

loans.use: To increase his savings to build his house.

loans.name: Solat

texts.en:
Mrs. Solat S. and her husband Mr. Sam-At Kong were married in 1979. They have six children; three sons and three daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home. The other four farm with their parents. The family is about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Solat and her husband have been farming since they were married. They plant bananas, flowers, and other crops, which they sell at the market in Phnom Penh. Mrs. Solat is now requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, and to pay the fee for plowing.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, and to pay the plowing fee.

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mrs. Mach C. and her husband, Mr. Vichet Saroeyn were married in 2006. They have one daughter. The couple lives with their parents about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Mach and her husband work for a company. Besides their full time work, both husband and wife also raise pigs at home. Now Mrs. Mach is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase piglets and feed for raising pigs.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed for raising pigs.

loans.name: Sokhum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhum H. (pictured here with one of her daughters), age 50, has been married since 1979 and has two daughters who are weave silk at home. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Her husband is a mason and boat repairer.  

Mrs. Sokhum has worked as a vegetable seller for many years, but has now decided to change jobs and begin helping her daughters with their weaving. She is requesting  a loan of $250 to buy silk for herself and her daughters to weave.

loans.use: To purchase silk for weaving

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Đỗ Thị M., 44 years old, participates in TYM fund since 2004. In the region where she lives, there's not much job opportunity apart from farming and raising livestock. She used her loans to raise pigs which yielded good profit so she continues to do so in later rounds of loans. Her husband, Mr M., works as a laborer and he helps her taking care of the weekly payment. The revenue from the pig business is sufficient to provide education for their children: their eldest son has graduated and the other 3 are still in high school and primary school. Her monthly income from the pig business is 100 USD. She is seeking 375 USD to buy pigs to breed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đỗ Thị M., 44 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 2004. Trên địa bàn chị sống ít nghề phụ, công việc chủ yếu của người dân là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Sau những vòng vốn đầu chị M. đầu tư chăn nuôi thấy hiệu quả nên các vòng vốn sau chị tiếp tục vay vốn phát triển dự án này. Hàng ngày chồng chị M. đi làm thuê và hỗ trợ chị trong việc hoàn trả nên việc tham gia Quỹ của chị rất thuận lợi. Nguồn thu từ chăn nuôi giúp chị có điều kiện cho các con đi học tốt hơn, cháu lớn nhà chị đã ra trường, 3 cháu còn lại đang học trung cấp và phổ thông. Thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng từ chăn nuôi của chị M. khoảng 100USD. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị vay 375USD để mua thêm lợn nái về nuôi.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Đỗ Thị Nghĩa is 55 years old. She lives in Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa with her family. They were very poor before joining TYM fund. At first, she contracted a very small loan to make it easy on the payment. After a year, things went well for her: it was easy to make the weekly payment and her family income has increased. So Mrs Nghĩa started to take out bigger loans. After 3 years, she has been able to buy all the basic goods for her household and also a motorcycle. Her family income from the fishing business is 100-130 USD a month. She also exploits her rice paddle and raises livestock to increase her income. This time she is seeking 375 USD to buy fishing net and tools.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đỗ Thị Nghĩa, 55 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và các con tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Khi mới tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị rất nghèo, vòng vốn đầu chị chỉ xin vay mức vốn thấp để tiện hoàn trả. Sau một năm, cảm thấy việc hoàn trả tuần thuận tiện cho mình và gia đình cộng với việc kinh tế phát triển hơn trước, chị Nghĩa đã mạnh dạn vay các mức vốn cao hơn. Sau hơn 3 năm tham gia Quỹ, chị Nghĩa đã sắm thêm được nhiều tiện nghi trong gia đình và một chiếc xe máy mới. Thu nhập hàng tháng từ việc đánh bắt cá từ 100-130USD. Ngoài ra chị Nghĩa còn làm ruộng và chăn nuôi để tăng thêm thu nhập. Vòng vốn này chị Nghĩa đề nghị xin vay 375USD để mua lưới và dụng cụ đánh bắt mới.

loans.use: Buy fishing net and tools

loans.name: Doi Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Doi Thi L., 50 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2005. Her family has 5 members: the parents and 3 grown-up children. Before, her main activities were working on the field and breeding animals. Mr. Thiem, her husband, bought the pigs and sold the pork to retailers. Three years ago, Mrs. L. borrowed money so that her husband could buy more pigs and sold pork to not only food shops but also local people. Mrs.L. ‘s pork is very popular and therefore, her income increases. Currently, her average income is 200 USD/ month from selling pork. This time, she wants to borrow 575 USD to buy more pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đới Thị Lịch, 50 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 2005. Gia đình chị Lịch gồm 2 vợ chồng và 3 con đã trưởng thành. Trước đây, công việc chủ yếu của chị là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Anh Thiêm, chồng chị mua lợn về giết thịt và nhập cho các quán bán lẻ. Cách đây 3 năm, chị Lịch vay vốn cho chồng mua thêm lợn sau đó, một phần anh nhập cho các quán, một phần chị bán cho người dân có nhu cầu. Giá bán lẻ thường cao hơn giá nhập cho các cửa hàng, hơn nữa cũng giúp chị Lịch có việc làm, tận dụng được khoảng thời gian nhàn rỗi. Hàng của chị Lịch bán rất đắt khách nên thu nhập cũng tăng hơn trước nhiều. Hiện nay, bình quân một tháng gia đình chị thu khoảng 200USD từ việc buôn bán lợn. Vòng vốn này chị Lịch làm đơn xin vay 575USD để mua lợn bán.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoang Thi D., 33 years old, has been a member of TYM Fund since 2003. Even though she already had 1 hectare of field, she wanted to buy more land for sedge cultivation. She decided to borrow 375 USD to buy land to plant sedge. She calculated, after harvest, her average profit from the sedge is 120 USD. The profit is high, and she also has good material for weaving sedge mats. Currently, the main activity for Mrs. D. and her husband is to weave sedge mats. Their average income is 150 USD/month. Besides being able to send the children to schools, she was able to buy a new TV and a closet last year.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị Diện, 33 tuổi, là thành viên tham gia Quỹ năm 2003. Tuy đã có trên 1 mẫu cói, nhưng chị Diện vẫn muốn có thêm đất để canh tác. Nếu mua cói khô thì đắt hơn từ 2 đến 3 lần so với cói tươi, trong khi đó nhiều gia đình không có đủ nhân công để làm nên muốn bán đất trồng. Sau khi bàn với chồng chị Diện quyết định vay 375USD để mua thêm 3 sào cói. Chị tính khi thu hoạch, trừ chị phí thì bình quân mỗi sào cũng lãi khoảng 120USD. Lợi nhuận mang lại cũng khá cao, lại có nguyên liệu tốt để dệt chiếu. Hiện nay công việc chính của 2 vợ chồng chị Diện là dệt chiếu, thu nhập hàng tháng khoảng 150USD. Ngoài việc cho 3 con ăn học đầy đủ, năm ngoái chị Diện mua thêm được một chiếc tivi và một chiếc tủ mới.

loans.use: Buy land to plant sedge

loans.name: Lam Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lam Thi D. is 25 years old, and her husband is 27 years old. They have a son who is 2 years old. Although at such a young age, the couple works very hard to build their future. Mrs. D.'s husband is a mason, and Mrs. D. is a farmer. On average, their family income is around 130 USD a month. In 2007, Mrs. D. became a member of TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) to borrow some money to breed animals . Her husband also helps her with the biweekly repayment. In an auction recently, Mrs. D. and her husband just won a contract to breed fish in their village's fish pond. This loan term, she wants to borrow 700 USD to buy fish and fishfood.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lâm Thị Diệu năm nay 25 tuổi còn chồng chị 27 tuổi. Hai anh chị có một con trai 2 tuổi. Tuy còn trẻ nhưng hai vợ chồng chị Diệu rất chịu khó làm kinh tế. Anh đi làm thợ nề, chị ở nhà làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình khoảng 130USD. Năm 2007 chị Diệu tham gia vay vốn của Quỹ Tình thương về chăn nuôi. Sau một năm tham gia, chị cảm thấy ngày càng yêu thích với cách vay vốn lớn hoàn trả nhỏ của Quỹ. Chồng chị lại làm có tiền công hàng ngày, có thể hỗ trợ vợ nên việc hoàn trả rất thuận tiện. Vừa qua gia đình chị Diệu đã trúng thầu khu ao thả cá của thôn. Vòng vốn này chị Diệu xin vay 700USD để mua cá về thả cùng thức ăn cho chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Buy fishes and food for them

loans.name: Lam Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lam Thi H., 36 years old, is the fourth-year member of TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam). Her husband is an officer working for the village council; her two children are in middle school. She is seemingly the only one who takes care of everything in the house. Mrs. H.'s main job is to raise pigs. She is very hard-working and clever, and her pigs grow up quickly and healthy. For each liter of pigs, Mrs. H. earns 500-700 USD. Her husband also helps her with the repayments; everything goes accordingly with the plan. Her family income increases significantly after each loan cycle. This time Mrs. H. would like to borrow 575 USD to buy pigs and food for her animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lâm Thị H., 36 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương. Chồng là cán bộ xã, hai con đang học phổ thông, việc gia đình một mình chị H. gánh vác. Công việc hàng ngày của chị là chăn nuôi lợn. Là một người chịu khó lại mát tay, đàn lợn chị nuôi rất nhanh lớn. Mỗi lứa lợn bán ra thu lãi 500-700USD. Nguồn hoàn trả hàng tuần do chồng chị H. hỗ trợ nên công việc diễn ra rất thuận lợi. Qua các vòng vốn, kinh tế gia đình được nâng lên rõ rệt. Vòng vốn này chị H. tiếp tục xin vay 575USD để mua lợn và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy pigs and food for them

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Le Thi S., 43 years old, lives with her husband and their 4 children in Quang Xuong, Thanh Hoa (Vietnam). All of their children are still going to school. Since they live near the sea, Mrs. S.'s husband ís a fisherman, and she is selling the fish at the market. This is the main way to earn income for their family. This job, however, requires not only time and efforts but also money to buy the nets and other fishing equipment. Since Mrs. S. joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam), she has more money to buy new equipment, and they are able to catch more fish. She uses the profit from her business to buy furniture for their house and pay for her children to go to school. Mrs. S.'s family income is about 200 USD per month. This time she wants to borrow 375 USD to buy nets, preparing fr the coming seaS..

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Sơn, 43 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 4 người con tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Cả 4 người con chị đều đang đi học. Gia đình ở gần biển, anh đi biển, chị bán cá, đây cũng là nguồn thu chính của gia đình. Công việc này ngoài thời gian, công sức còn cần vốn để mua lưới, dụng cụ đánh bắt. Từ khi tham gia Quỹ, chị Sơn có thêm tiền sắm được nhiều đồ nghề mới, việc đánh bắt thuận tiện hơn. Lợi nhuận từ mỗi vòng vốn chị đề dành mua sắm tiện nghi trong gia đình và chi phí cho các con ăn học. Thu nhập bình quân hiện nay của gia đình khoảng 200USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị Sơn xin vay 375USD để mua lưới, chuẩn bị cho mùa đánh bắt sứa sắp tới.

loans.use: Buy fishing-net

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 43 years old, has been a member of TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) for five years. Among her three children, two of them are still at school age. H. and her husband plant sedges. After each harvest, they sold the short and not-quite good sedges, and keep the good ones to make sedge mats. Good materials and Mrs. H.'s cleverness bring beautiful mats, and all of the mats made are sold very quickly at good prices. After joining TYM Fund, Mrs. H. has more money, so she is able to make more sedge mats. Each day she makes 4 to 5 sedge mats. Her income is about 6 USD per day, which is a huge improvement compared to what she earned before joining TYM Fund. Mrs. H. was able to buy a closet, a T.V. and other furniture for her house. This time she applies for a loan of 575 USD to buy sedge to make sedge mats.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hải, 43 tuổi, là thành viên tham gia năm thứ 5 của Quỹ Tình thương. 2 trong số 3 người con của chị hiện đang trong độ tuổi đến trường. Nhà trồng cói, sau mỗi vụ gặt về chị thường bán đi số cói ngắn và xấu, thêm tiền đầu tư mua cói tốt về làm. Nguyên liệu tốt cộng với sự khéo tay nên chiếu gia đình chị làm ra đều được tiêu thụ ngay và rất được giá. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ, có thêm nguồn vốn nên số lượng sản phẩm làm ra tăng lên đáng kể. Mỗi ngày làm ra từ 4-5 chiếc chiếu, thu nhập trên dưới 6USD, kinh tế gia đình chị Hải phát triển rõ rệt. Chị đã mua được tủ, tivi cùng nhiều vật dụng có giá trị khác. Vòng vốn này chị Hải làm đơn xin vay 575USD mua thêm cói dệt chiếu.

loans.use: Buy sedge to make sedge mat

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Nguyen Thi M., 47 years old, lives with her mother and her child who is still of school age. Before, her house was empty; there wasn't a singe valuable item in the house. She only had a limited amount of fund to do her business, so she uses all the money she earned from making sedge mats to buy food for her family. Since Ms. M. joined TYM Fund (KIva Partner in Vietnam), she has more fund to buy materials. Thus, she is able to make more mats and the profit also increases accordingly. After 4 years, Ms. M. is able to rebuild her house. Each month her income is about 130 USD. Ms. M. told us what she thinks about TYM Fund and microcredit: "I was able to borrow money, give back the repayments, improve my income, and above all, my child is able to go to school and get a better life." This time she wants to borrow 450 USD to buy more sedges and to invest on breeding poultry. WIth more sedges, Ms. M. is certain that she would get more profit from selling sedge mats.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị M., 47 tuổi, sống cùng mẹ già và một người con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Trước đây gia đình chị không có một tài sản gì giá trị, nhà cửa tạm bợ. Vốn làm ăn cũng ít nên thu nhập từ dệt chiếu chỉ vừa đủ nuôi sống gia đình. Tham gia Quỹ Tình thương, có thêm vốn mua nguyên liệu thu nhập từ sản phẩm làm ra tăng lên rõ rệt. Sau 4 năm vay vốn chị M. đã làm được một ngôi nhà mới khang trang. Thu nhập hàng tháng từ việc dệt chiếu của chị M. khoảng 130USD. Chị M. tâm sự về những lợi ích chị nhận được khi tham gia Quỹ: vay vốn hoàn trả thuận lợi, kinh tế gia đình phát triển, con cái được ăn học đầy đủ và chăm lo hơn. Vòng vốn này, chị vay 450USD để mua cói dệt chiếu, ngoài ra chị cũng dành một phần cho chăn nuôi ngan gà. Có cói dự trữ để làm chiếu chị khẳng định rằng trong vụ này chắc chắn sẽ thu được lợi nhuận lớn.

loans.use: Buy sedge

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Nguyen Thi N., 37 years old, is the fourth-year member of TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam). When she first joined TYM, she just borrowed 50 USD because she wanted to get used to the weekly repayments policy. The profit she earned after the first year was not a whole lot, yet it helped her gain more confidence for the next loans. With Ms. N.'s cleverness, there is a significant increase in her family income. The loan is used more efficiently. Each month she earns about 100 USD from making sedge mats. With the savings from many years, she is able to build a new house. Ms. N. is very happy because TYM Fund helps her have a better life and her children are able to go to school. Now Ms. N. is thinking about breeding fish. Since the cost of food is increasing, she needs more money to buy good food for her fish. Thus, she would like to borrow 375 USD to buy breeding fish and fishfood.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Nguyệt, 37 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương. Vòng vốn đầu chị chỉ dám vay 50USD để làm quen với việc hoàn trả tuần. Lợi nhuận thu về sau năm đầu tuy không nhiều nhưng giúp chị Nguyệt vững tin để vay các vòng tiếp theo. Nhờ biết tính toán làm ăn, kinh tế gia đình chị đã có những thay đổi rõ rệt, đồng vốn đầu tư mang lại hiệu quả cao. Thu nhập hàng tháng của chị Nguyệt từ đan chiếu khoảng 100USD. Qua nhiều năm tích góp chị Nguyệt đã làm được nhà mới. Chị rất vui mừng và phấn khởi vì nhờ tham gia Quỹ, kinh tế phát triển nên các con chị được tạo điều kiện ăn học đầy đủ hơn. Hiện nay chị Nguyệt đang có dự án nuôi cá. Giá thực phẩm đang tăng, muốn cá nuôi nhanh lớn thì phải có nguồn thức ăn tốt. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 375USD để mua cá giống và thức ăn.

loans.use: Buy fishes and food for them

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Nguyen Thi S., 45 years old, joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) in 2003. Her family includes her husband, she, and their 4 children. Their income mainly comes from making sedge mats. After 5 years being a member of TYM Fund, Ms. S. is able to buy a moped and other furniture for her house. Her children are all able to go to school. Her business is doing well, and she is able to pay the repayments on time. That is why she is always able to borrow at the maximum level each loan cycle. With two sedging machine, each day Ms. S. is able to make 4 to 5 mats. She needs a lot of sedges in inventory. Now the price of sedge is inexpensive, so Ms. S. plans to borrow 575 USD to partly invest in buying more sedges, and party invest in her small farm. Her monthly income is about 250 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Soạn, 45 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 2003. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 4 người con. Nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình là dệt chiếu. Sau 5 năm tham gia Quỹ chị Soạn đã mua được xe máy cùng nhiều vật dụng có giá trị trong nhà. Các con chị cũng được bố mẹ cho ăn học đến nơi đến chốn. Làm ăn có hiệu quả, hoàn trả lại thuận tiện nên các vòng vốn chị Soạn đều vay mức tối đa. Với 2 cầu chiếu mỗi ngày dệt từ 4-5 chiếc chiếu, chị Soạn cần rất nhiều cói dự trữ. Hiện nay giá cói đang rẻ, chị Soạn dự định xin vay 575USD. Một phần tiền đầu tư mua cói dự trữ, một phần tiền đầu tư chăm bón. Thu nhập hàng tháng của chị Soạn là 250USD.

loans.use: Buy sedge

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Nguyen Thi T., 33 years old, currently live with her husband and two small children at Quang Xuong, Thanh Hoa. Like many families in the village, her daily job is weaving sedge sleeping-mattress. After joining TYM, her family income has increased significantly and help provide her children with education and more nutritious meals. She also has been able to build up a new house. Even though small, but it is much more stable than the old one and is much safer during raining season. Currently, apart from her man-made raw materials, she also need to buy more sedges to stabilize her production and income. During this loan cycle, Ms. T. would like to borrow 375 USD to buy more sedges while the prices is still low. Her monthly income is about 130 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Tấm, 33 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Cũng như nhiều gia đình khác ở làng nghề, hàng ngày chị Tấm dệt chiếu bán. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ Tình thương, đời sống gia đình chị đã có nhiều thay đổi, các bữa ăn gia đình được cải thiện, các con được chăm lo đầy đủ hơn. Chị cũng đã làm được ngôi nhà mới. Ngôi nhà tuy nhỏ nhưng giúp gia đình chị yên tâm hơn khi mùa mưa bão về. Hiện nay, ngoài nguồn nguyên liệu mà gia đình tự làm ra, để tăng thu nhập và có việc làm ổn định chị Tấm luôn mua thêm cói dự trữ. Vòng vốn này chị Tấm dự định vay 375USD mua cói khi giá đang rẻ. Thu nhập hàng tháng của chị Tấm là 130USD.

loans.use: Buy sedge

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Pham Thi H., 38 years old, currently live at Quang Xuong with her husband and three children. Their primary jobs used to be farming and raising ducks but haven't had much success due to their small invested capital. During 2007, she mad the first loan from TYM to buy breeding ducks. This project had brought her a lot of success and much more income. Due to the airy environment, her herd of ducks grows quickly. After the first year, her revenue double her initial cost. Confident with this result, she would like to borrow another 500 USD this term to continue to invest in this project.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị Hà, 38 tuổi, sống tại Quảng Xương cùng chồng và 3 con. Thời gian trước chị Hà cùng chồng chủ yếu làm ruộng và chăn nuôi nhỏ. Thu nhập của gia đình chỉ ở mức thấp do thiếu vốn đầu tư sản xuất. Năm 2007, chị Hà vay vốn Quỹ Tình thương đầu tư nuôi vịt. Loại dự án này mang lại lợi nhuận khá cao chỉ trong thời gian ngắn nhưng đòi hỏi nhiều vốn mua giống và thức ăn. Vòng vốn đầu chị Hà chỉ dám vay mức thấp do chưa quen với cách hoàn trả tuần. Ở vùng đồng ruộng điều kiện thoáng mát nên đàn vịt chị Hà nuôi rất nhanh lớn. Sau một năm, số lãi thu về gấp đôi so với lượng vốn bỏ ra ban đầu. Vui mừng với thành quả đạt được, ở vòng vốn thứ 2 này, chị Hà đăng ký xin vay 500USD để tiếp tục đầu tư vào dự án. mua vịt và thức ăn chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Buy ducks

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Pham Thi S., 39 years old, has joined TYM since 2004. Her family includes of her husband, herself and two young children who are still going to school. Their family main source of income are from raising pigs as well as her husband's wage as construction worker. Her husband earning is quite stable so she has been able to repay the loan regularly and on time. Each year, she sold three batch of pigs as well as one batch of fishes and can get close to a thousand dollars. The profits had been used to buy new furniture and pay for her children's education. As the cost is high, the profit have not been very large so she still need more money to invest into her business. During this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 575 USD to repair her breeding facilities and buy more pigs

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị Sự, 39 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 2004. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Nguồn thu nhập chính hiện nay của gia đình từ chăn nuôi và tiền công anh đi làm thợ xây. Do chồng đi làm công nhật nên việc hoàn trả tuần của chị Sự rất thuận lợi. Mỗi năm bán vài 3 lứa lợn và 1 vụ cá, gia đình chị Sự thu lãi vài nghìn USD. Phần lợi nhuận thu về được chị dùng mua sắm đồ đạc, chi phí cho các con ăn học. Thu nhập từ chăn nuôi cao nhưng chi phí lớn vì hiện nay giá cả đang tăng nên chị Sự rất cần có thêm vốn để đầu tư. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị Sự vòng này là 575USD để sửa chữa chuồng trại và mua con giống.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Tran Thi H., 31 years old, currently live with her husband (34 years old) and two young children. Her family main sources of income are farming and raising pigs. During the 4 years participating in TYM, Ms H.'s loans have always been used to buy fertilizers and food-stuff for her pigs. Her husband is a construction workers and has stable income so she has never had problem repaying the loans. During this time, the weather is not cooperating and her family is having a lot of trouble with the crops as prices of fertilizers are also going up. Ms. H. need to borrow more money to buy fertilizers in time for the harvesting season. She also would like some additional money to buy more foodstuff and pigs. During this cycle, she decide to ask for a loan of 575USD

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Hà năm nay 31 tuổi còn chồng chị 34 tuổi. Hai anh chị có 2 con đang còn nhỏ. Gia đình không có nghề phụ, thu nhập chính là từ làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Tham gia được 4 năm, vốn vay được chị Hà sử dụng chủ yếu mua phân bón và chăn nuôi lợn. Chồng đi làm thợ xây, thu nhập tương đối ổn định nên việc hoàn trả tuần không gặp khó khăn. Đồng vốn vay luôn được sử dụng đúng mục đích nên kinh tế phát triển rất tốt. Hiện nay thời tiết khắc nghiệt, lúa chết, giá phân bón lại tăng lên, để kịp thời mùa vụ chị Hà quyết định vay vốn để mua phân bón, phần còn lại đầu tư chăn nuôi. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị Hà là 575USD.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and pigs

loans.name: Block C North 2003-2 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rose K iden. She is currently in the business of selling vegetables and is requesting a loan to pay school fees. Rose is 35 years old and is married with a husband who is a watchman. She has 3 children ranging from age 5 to 12 and her children go to school. Each week, Rose makes approximately 80 Sudanese pounds in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

Rose is joined in her small group by Trupina M., Jesica K., Christhine K., and Poni S.. Trupina M. has a business brewing alcohol and wants to construct a house. Jesica K. is currently operating a business selling breads and wants a loan to buy a motor-bike. Christhine K. operates a business selling beans and sugar and wants to open a shop. Poni S. is currently in the business of baking cakes and is requesting a loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Julieta Abilio

texts.en:
Julieta is 32 years old and originally from the Gaza Province. She has a boyfriend and a 3-year-old daughter.

Julieta moved with her family to Matola, a village 15Km away from the capital city Maputo, when young. She studied until 7th grade and stopped in 1993 because she moved to South Africa to live with her sister. Julieta lived in South Africa until 2005, and there she worked with commerce, selling products and food in the street. Julieta met her boyfriend and moved in with him a few months later. Julieta decided to come back to Mozambique because according to her “life in Mozambique is prettier and nicer”. She has a small stand in the street where she sells food, such as tomatoes, rice, peanut, onions and garlic. Julieta makes between MTn 500 to MTn 1,000 per day. Julieta’s best business is the wholesale products of things she brings from South Africa. Julieta goes to South Africa at least once a month and brings many products that clients request and others that she knows she will easily sell, such as crackers. Julieta has to accumulate at least 3,000 Rands to make sure she can buy enough products, pay the transport and also the customs duties. Every 3 months Julieta benefits from her business in South Africa and goes visit her boyfriend who still lives there.

Together with her boyfriend (a Mozambican man from Maputo), Julieta bought land in Matola and started to build a house. The first MTn 8,000 loan with Hluvuku was used to pay half of the salary of the construction workers. They were asking MTn 16,000 and Julieta just had half of the money, and preferred to use a known institution than any man in the street. With this second loan of MTn 10,500 Julieta plans to continue building her house. She will buy windows, doors and 10 aluminum-roofing plaques to finish the bedrooms and the living room.

In the future, Julieta would like to get married (officially), finish her house with a bathroom and build a fence around her house. Julieta would also like to build a proper general store to sell many products and increase her daily income.

loans.use: Buy construction material

loans.name: San Valentin Group

texts.es:
The group consists of four people: Julia L., Eugenio B., Antonio C., and Roberto C.. They are former loan recipients who guarantee each other’s loans. Although they all have businesses in the same area, they live in different places with their respective families. They've been responsible borrowers for a long time--this is their 26th loan. They are all from humble backgrounds, so each of them is struggling to put his/her own business on a sound footing. If this were achieved, they would be able to provide a better life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Grupo compuesto por 4 persaonas:Julia L.,Eugenio B.,Antonio C. y Roberto C. clientes antiguos que se garantizan mutuamente, todos tienen su negocio por la misma Zona, pero viven en diferentes lugares con sus respectivas familias. Durante todo este tiempo han trabajado de manera responsable encontrandose en su secuencia 26, cada cliente y sus familias son de condiciones humildes por lo cual cada uno ellos lucha para sacar su propio negiocio a flote y asi poder brindar mejores condiciones de vida a sus respectivas familias.

loans.use: Money to invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Juan Isnado

texts.es:
Sr Isnado and his wife have three children. In their free time, the children help their father sell his merchandise and in this way earn money to pay for their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

El senor Isnado vive con la esposa y es padre de tres hijos quienes en sus momentos libres colaboran en la venta de su mercaderia y de esta manera pueden solventar sus estudios

loans.use: To purchase winter clothing

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
Sra Angelica is a hardworking woman. As well as being a street vendor in the local markets, she sometimes travels to the provincial markets. On these occasions her husband helps her transport the merchandise. She also takes care of their three school-age children. Her strong desire to get ahead is very clear. Sra Angelica lives in her father’s house where an extra room has been built to give her children more space. The family lives in an area a long way from La Paz. She is currently asking for her sixth loan; her credit history is first rate.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

La senora Angelica es una persona muy trabajadora ella ambula por las ferias de la zona y en ocaciones viaja a las ferias provienciales, en estas ocaciones es el esposo quien colabora en el traslado de la mercaderia, tiene a su cargo 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, en la cliente se observa muchos deseos de superacion, La señora Angelica vive en la casa de su papá donde construyeron una habitacion para brindar mas comodidad a los hijos ella vive junto a su familia en una zona alejada de la ciudad de La Paz y actualmente solicita el sexto credito teniendo un historial de credito inpecable.

loans.use: Repair and maintenance of her vehicle.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo used to work as an employee in a private home, but as time passed she realized that her income, even though it was secure, was not sufficient to cover her family's expenses. What's more, she didn't like having to depend on a fixed salary. At that time, her primary need was to pay for her debts and her children's schooling, so she began to sell meals which she prepared in her home and then sold. She saved enough to purchase a taco cart which she set up outside of her home. Thanks to her hard work and dedication she has been able to increase her sales.

Consuelo is requesting a loan, which she will repay in 5 months, so she can put a bigger roof over her cart, as well as purchase chairs and tables and offer better service to her customers. Your help will make this possible.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

Consuelo laboraba como empleada de confianza en un domicilio particular, pero con el paso del tiempo observó que sus ingresos, si bien eran seguros, no eran suficiente para solventar los gastos familiares, además de que no le gustaba depender solamente de un salario fijo determinado. en ese momento, su necesidad primordial era pagar sus deudas y el estudio de sus hijos, por lo que comenzó a vender comidas que elaboraba en su propio domicilio, hasta que a base de ahorrar pudo comprar un carrito para tacos que instalo fuera de su casa, gracias a su empeño y dedicación ha logrado incrementar sus ventas.

Solicita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 5 meses para colocar un techo más amplio a su carrito de tacos, así como para adquirir mesas y sillas para sus clientes y ofrecer mejor servicio. Con tu apoyo esto será posible

loans.use: TO PUT A ROOF OVER HER SMALL TACO CART, AND PURCHASE TABLES AND CHAIRS SO THAT SHE CAN OFFER BETTER SERVICE TO HER CUSTOMERS.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia started her business because she and her husband were without work. They decided to take a chance in traveling markets in various neighborhoods throughout the Monterrey metropolitan area to make a living and to support their children, their main concern.

The business started after her husband had spent many years struggling to find stable and well-paying work. To increase her family's income, Leticia started going to traveling markets, selling electronics.

Now she needs a loan of $500 that she will repay in six months to stock merchandise and to increase the volume of her sales. With your help, it is possible.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Leticia inicio en el negocio porque se quedó sin trabajo al igual que su esposo y decidieron aventurarse en los mercados rodantes en varias colonias del área metropolitana de monterrey, para subsistir y mantener a sus hijos, ya que para ellos son su máxima preocupación.

El negocio lo comenzó primero su esposo hace varios años tras batallar en conseguir trabajos estables y bien pagados, después ella para obtener mayores ingresos familiares se le unió en los mercados rodantes, vendiendo artículos electrónicos.

Ahora necesita un préstamo por US $ 500 que pagara en 6 meses surtir mercancía y obtener un mayor volumen de venta. Con tu apoyo esto será posible.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Sr. Rene is someone with a great desire to succeed despite his physical disability (he has problems with his lower limbs). He acts responsibly in whatever he does, always fulfils his obligations, and pays off his loans. In spite of his disability, he wants to get on in life so that he can feel useful. Currently he lives in the modest home that belonged to his parents before they died some time ago. He shares the house with his nephews and nieces whom he helps with their studies so that they can have the opportunities that were not available to him.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Rene es una persona con muchos deseos de superación pese a su discapacidad física, ( problemas en las extremidades inferiores) el desarrolla sus actividades con bastante responsabilidad y es muy cumplido con sus obligaciones y en el pago de sus créditos, pese a su discapacidad el quiere seguir adelante para sentirse útil en la vida, el vive actualmente en la casa muy humilde de sus padres quienes fallecieron tiempo atrás, la cual comparte con sus sobrinos a los cuales el les ayuda en sus estudios para que así tengan las posibilidades que el no pudo tener.

loans.use: To purchase wool.

loans.name: Martha Carolina

texts.es:
Martha is a 36 year old woman, living in the region of Villa Reconciliacion, she is single and has two children aged 14 and 6 years. Her dream has always been to have a better quality of life, and for this she works hard every day. Martha is a small business woman and she dedicates her time to tailoring clothing, and she has been doing so for 8 years now. She started her business with her own money and with the help of her next door neighbour. But she now wants to work alone and that is why she is requesting this loan - for the purchase of fabric to tailor clothing and for a new electric sewing machine.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha es una mujer de 36 años de edad, habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 6 años. Sus aspiraciones siempre han sido tener un mejor nivel de vida, es por eso que cada día trabaja más duro para poder lograrlo. Doña Martha es una pequeña comerciante que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa, tiene 8 años de experiencia en este negocio, ella empezó con dinero propio y también con lo que una vecina de su barrio le daba para vender. ahora ella quiere trabajar sólo y por eso está solicitando el crédito, para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de ropa y una máquina de coser eléctrica

loans.use: To purchase fabric and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Glenda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Glenda carries on door-to-door sales of cosmetics (sales on credit). She started 6 years ago with some money she had saved up. Every day she struggles to find new clientele to expand her client base. Glenda is 32 years old and she has 3 children aged 17, 13, and 6 years. Her partner is a taxi driver and supports her and her family financially. She needs this loan to build a garage in her house so that she will be able to safely keep her partner's taxi cab, because it represents his livelihood.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Glenda se dedica a la venta ambulante, en su casa de habitación y al crédito de cosméticos, empezó hace 6 años con un dinero que tenia ahorrado, cada día se esfuerza por buscar más clientes para extender su mercado. Glenda tiene 32 años de edad, es acompañada y tiene 3 hijos de 17, 13 y 6 años respectivamente. Su comprañero es taxista y le apoya economicamente al sustento de la familia. Necesita el crédito para construir un garaje en su casa de habitación y así poder dejar seguro el vehículo del señor, porque es su instrumento de trabajo

loans.use: To build a garage in her house.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza is married with three children. Her husband works as a security guard. She started her business to support her husband who was an unemployed mason. Twelve years ago she started her grocery store in a small room in her house which has grown, little by little.

She now asks for a loan of $1,175 that she will repay in six months to buy merchandise and to increase her sales. This way she will be able to offer a greater variety of products in her establishment.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Esperanza es casada y tiene 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja como guardia de seguridad. Inició el negocio para apoyar a su esposo que estaba desempleado y era albañil. Comenzó hace doce años con su tienda de abarrotes al principio solo en cuartito de su casa, el cual poco a poco ha ido ampliando.

Ahora solicita un préstamo por US $1,175 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía e incrementar sus ventas y así tener mayor variedad de productos que ofrecer en su establecimiento.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Irma Del Socorro

texts.es:
Irma is 28 years old and in a relationship, and, like her partner, she runs a small business. She is dedicated to selling clothing, shoes, and DVDs and CDs. Irma is always looking for ways to improve her business and increase her inventory. She's requesting a loan to acquire more merchandise to help her keep improving and growing her business. She has three children, ages 7, 9 and 11, for whom she wants to provide a good life and the ability to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Irma tiene 28 años de edad, es acompañada y su comprañero al igual que ella es un pequeño comerciante. Irma se dedica aa la venta de ropa, zapatos, DVD y CD. Irma siempre está en busca de mejorar su negocio y aumentar el inventario que actualmente posee. Requiere del préstamo para adquirir su mercadería para ir mejorando y agradando su negocio. Tiene 3 hijos de 11, 9 y 7 años a los cuales quiere darles una vida digna y con posibilidad de salir adelante

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business / Comprar mercadería para su negocio

loans.name: José Diego

texts.es:
José Diego is 49 years old, married and has two children ages 23 and 25 who are already professionals and on their own. His wife works at home while he has been dedicate to making mattresses for the past 20 years. He started with money he earned from selling a property he owned in the central part of the country. He hopes to reinvest the money he makes from the business to replace the machinery he currently uses. His goal is to improve the business so he can sell more mattresses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Don José Diego tiene 49 años de edad, casado, con 2 hijos de 23 y 25 años, que ya son profesionales e independientes a él. Su esposa es ama de casa. Don José Diego se dedica a la elaboración de colchones desde hace 20 años, empezó con el dinero generado por la venta de una finca que él tenia en el interior del país. Con las ventas generadas con el negocio espera poder mejorar su negocio y poder cambiar la maquinaria que actualmente usa. Solamente vive con su esposa, es por eso que su meta es poder mejorar el negocio de la venta de colchones.

loans.use: Purchase materials to make mattresses / Comprar materia prima para elaboración de colchas

loans.name: Simona Del Carmen

texts.es:
Simona lives alone in the February 25th barrio in Managua. She's 41 years old and has four children ages 22, 23, 26 and 27 who live on their own. She sells clothing and new shoes with 20 years of experience. She started the business with her own money and savings her children gave her. With the loan she plans to purchase a variety of merchandise to satisfy her customers' demands with style and selection and generate more earnings. Her goal in the future is to increase her inventory and improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Simona habita en el barrio 25 de Febrero, soltera, y tiene 41 años de edad, con cuatros hijos de 22, 23,26 y 27 años de edad. Sus hijos ya son independientes. Doña Simona vende ropa y zapatos nuevos con veinte años de experiencias las dificultades son las ventas bajas. Comenzó con capital propio al ahorrar dinero que sus hijos le daban. Con el préstamo va a comprar mercadería variada, para sastifacer a clientes con estilo y variedad y así obtener más ganancias. A futuro es incrementar más inventario y mejorar su nivel de vida.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of merchandise to meet customers' demands / Comprar mercadería variada para poder cubrir demandas

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana is 50 years old, married and lives in the Isaías Gómez barrio of Managua. She has five beautiful children who are grown up and live on their own. Her husband makes aluminum and glass windows and helps with the household.

Juana's business is renting chairs and tables, which she started with her own money and the support of her husband. She has been doing this for two years and it has gone well. She also works in a church as a minister and earns a salary. She plans to use the loan to add an extra room to her home. Her goals for the future is to increase her inventory and add to her clientele, and to support her children with their education so they are successful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Juana es casada y habita en el barrio Isaías Gómez, tiene 50 años de edad, con cinco hermosos hijos que viven independientes. Su esposo elabora ventanas de vidrio y aluminio y así ayuda a su hogar. El negocio de doña Juana es el alquiler de sillas y mesas, este negocio lo comenzó con dinero propio y apoyo de su esposo.
