Tiene dos años de experiencia y le ha ido bien ella también trabaja en una Iglesia como reverenda donde devenga un salario. El préstamo lo quiere para construir un cuarto para mejorar su vivienda. A futuro es aumentar más sus inventarios y obtener más clientelas, apoyar a sus hijos en la educación para que sean hombres de bien.

loans.use: Build an additional room for her home / Construcción de habitación en su vivienda

loans.name: Sandra Lorena

texts.es:
Sandra is 51 years old, married and lives in the Villa Reconciliación barrio in Managua. She has six children between the ages of 18 and 35. Sandra sells gold jewelry, which she has been doing for 20 years, and she started the business with her own money. She plans to use the loan for infrastructure, to make improvements on her home. In the future she hopes to sell clothing and other items and improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Sandra tiene 51 años de edad, es casada y habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, tiene seis hijos de 18,24,27,28,30 y 35 años de edad. La Sra., Sandra vende joyas de oro tiene veinte un años de experiencia, su negocio lo inicio con dinero propio. El préstamo lo va a invertir en infraestructura, para mejoras de su vivienda. A futuro es vender ropa y otras variedades y mejorar el nivel de vida.

loans.use: Purchase beams and zinc sheets to make improvements on her home / Comprar perlines, zinc para hacer mejorar en su casa de habitación

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda is a 51-year-old widow who lives in the Domitila Lugo barrio in Managua. She has nine daughters who are already married and out on their own. Her business is selling new and used clothing, which she has been doing for 22 years. With the loan she plans to purchase building materials like bricks, beams and cement to refurbish her home, and later to increase her business' inventory, to improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Hilda tiene 51 años de edad, es viuda y habita en el barrio Domitila Lugo, tiene nueve hijas ya casadas e independiente. El negocio de la Sra. Hilda es la venta de ropa nueva como usada, tiene veintidós años de experiencia. Con el préstamo va comprar materiales de construcción, como: bloques, perlines, y cemento para reconstruir su vivienda. A futuro es incrementar el inventarios de su negocio y mejorar el nivel de vida.

loans.use: Purchase building materials like bricks, cement and beams to refurbish her home

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramón is married and has been retired for many years. As his pension was not enough to pay his and his wife's expenses, several years ago they started buying merchandise to sell to their neighbors and relatives. Now, some days during the week, they go to a street market to sell as well. Their six children are all married and their youngest daughter helps them sell.

Ramón requests a loan of $600 that he will repay in six months to buy merchandise. With your support he will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ramón esta casado y es pensionado pero desde hace muchos años, como con la pensión no completaba para solventar sus gastos hace varios años empezaron comprando mercancía que podían vender entre sus vecinos y sus familiares. y así ahora ciertos días de la semana van a la pulga a vender también. Todos sus hijos que son seis ya están casados, pero su hija mas pequeña les ayuda a vender.

El solicita un préstamo por US $ 600 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo el saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Jorge Homero

texts.es:
Jorge is married with three small children. His wife is a housewife. He drives his own bus and the other two he owns are driven by his drivers. Jorge bought his first bus six years ago. Before that he had been a driver, but he decided to go out on his own and buy his own buses.

Jorge needs a $500 loan that he will repay in six months to repair one of his buses which is in need of repair. With your help, Jorge will continue his business.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Jorge esta casado, su esposa se dedica al hogar, tiene tres hijos pequeños, el personalmente conduce su autobús y los otros dos que posee lo hacen sus choferes. Comenzó hace 6 años cuando compro su primer autobús, el anteriormente era chofer, pero decidió independizarse y comprar sus propios autobuses.

El necesita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para la reparación de uno de ellos ya que en este momento necesita repara ración. Con tu apoyo Jorge continuara con su negocio.

loans.use: Repair of One of his Buses

loans.name: Jose Claudio

texts.es:
Claudio is married but does not have children. His wife is a housewife. A year ago, Claudio was unemployed and began to sell soft drinks, later fried foods, and, little by little, started his business. Now his business has a greater assortment, also selling "pan dulce" (pastries) and some groceries. Each day he wants to improve his business and to increase the products he sells so that he has what people want.

He needs a loan of $600 that he will repay in six months to remodel his store. With your support, he will succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudio esta casado, pero no tiene hijos su esposa se dedica al hogar. Hace un año quedo desempleado y empezó a vender refrescos, y luego frituras y así poco a poco emprendió su negocio, ahorita ya lo tiene mas surtido ya que también vende pan dulce y algo de abarrotes pero quiere cada día acondicionarlo mas, y aumentar los productos que vende conforme la gente se lo solicite.

El necesita un préstamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su tienda. Con tu apoyo el lo lograra.

loans.use: Remodelar su tienda

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es:
Maria is divorced with five children. When she separated from her husband, she was in a very difficult economic situation because she lacked money and the financial aid she received for food was not enough. She had the skill to bake because her family has always had bakeries. She started by making white bread, then sugar loaves, and now she bakes an even greater variety. Her efforts have allowed her to prosper.

Now, Maria needs a loan of $600 that she will repay in six months to buy an industrial mixer. With your contribution, Maria will continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

María es divorciada pero tiene 5 hijos, cuando se separo de su pareja vivió un situación económica muy difícil debido a la falta de dinero, ya que con la pensión alimenticia no era suficiente, su familia siempre ha tenido panaderías, por lo que ella sabia ese oficio, empezó haciendo pan blanco, luego de azúcar, y luego mas variedad, ha logrado prosperar a base de su esfuerzo.

Ahora necesita un préstamo por US $ 600 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una batidora de uso industrial. Con tu contribución María continuara su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of an Industrial Mixer

loans.name: Kobina

texts.en: Kobina is 51 years old and the father of twelve children. 5 of the 12 children are in school. Kobina has been a driver and a transport owner for 30 years.  He travels from his village to Accra and Takoradi everyday. His vehicle needs repairs and maintenance to put it back on the road and to enable him to earn his income and support his children in school. He will use his loan to repair his vehicle and to set up a petty trading store for the wife. He is a member of the group called “Asomdwe” meaning Peace. Peace members agree to guarantee for each other's loan repayment.

loans.use: To repair “trotro” passenger bus

loans.name: Bichitos Group

texts.es:
Sr. Cesar is 30 years old, married, and has three young children. His wife helps him sell clothing so that he can travel into the interior of the country to make sales. (He goes to the small towns of Los Yungas.) Their home is rented, and the family’s sole source of income is generated by this business. It is located on the main street of the busy business area. He is a good member of the organisation.

50 year-old Sra. Ines is married and has two children in a state high school. Her husband works with her. She lives in her sister’s house which has only three rooms. She also is an excellent member of the organisation. Her sales booth is located in the main square of La Paz.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

El sr. Cesar tiene 30 años de edad, casado, tiene tres hijos pequeños la esposa le ayuda en la venta de ropa ya que él viaja a vender al interior (Los pueblos que están ubicados en los Yungas). La vivienda es alquilada, el único ingreso que tiene es el que le genera ese negocio el cual está ubicado en la avenida principal de una zona comercial de gran afluencia. E s buen cliente .

La Sra. Ines es casada tiene 50 años de edad, con dos hijos que están en secundaria en colegio estatal. El esposo le ayuda trabaja juntamente con la ella. Vive en la casa de su hermana, ocupa solamente 3 habitaciones. Es excelente cliente, su puesto de venta esta ubicado en la Plaza principal de la ciudad de La Paz

loans.use: To increase capital and provide a wider range of merchandise.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 36-years old and the father of 3 children. All his children are in school. He is a driver by profession. Samuel is so lovely a husband that he has opened a grocery store for his wife to so she can also earn a living. He will use his loan to buy more grocery products like babies’ diapers, sanitary towels, washing powders, rice, vegetable oil, etc. to increase her wife’s inventory.  He plans to help his wife save some money for the children’s education. Samuel is a member of the group called “Asomdwe” meaning Peace. Members agree to guarantee each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Samuel in the photo with the wife.

loans.use: To buy grocery products

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 39-years old and the father of five children. He married and his wife operates a beauty salon in their town. All his children are currently in school. John has been a professional driver for 12 years. He has been able to buy a passenger bus from his savings. He will use his loan to buy new tires for his vehicle. John is a member of the group called “Asomdwe” meaning Peace. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy vehicle tires

loans.name: Kingsford

texts.en: Kingsford is married and the father of three children. All his children are in school. Kingsford is a Straighter (mechanic) and has been fixing or straightening people’s vehicles for four years. He has been able to buy a “trotro” to help him increase his income. His wife sells spices to help with the family expenses. Trotro is a mini transport or bus that transports passengers to their various destinations. Kingsford will use his loan to repair his vehicle so he can continue to earn extra income. He is a member of the group called “Asomdwe” meaning Peace. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To repair “trotro” mini public transport

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob is a married man and the father of two children. One the children is in school. Jacob is a Sprayer and has been spraying people’s vehicles for four years.  Jacob will use his loan to buy more sand paper, filla, tinner and other spraying materials to enable him expand his operation. He hopes to use part of the loan also to support his wife in her seamstress business. Jacob is a member of the group called “Asomdwe” meaning Peace. Members agree to guarantee for each as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy sand paper, filla, tinner and vehicle spraying materials

loans.name: Sonia Margarita

texts.es:
Sonia is dedicated to selling gold and silver jewelry, an activity that she started when she divorced. She started this business because the alimony that her ex-husband provided was not enough to cover her housing costs or to support her children. A little less than a year ago, she began to sell silver jewelry on consignment, and, in this manner, began to build her list of customers.

Sonia is requesting a loan of US $600, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can establish her business and not sell just by going house-to-house. She wants to rent a shop. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Sonia se dedica a la venta de joyería de oro y plata, actividad que emprendió cuando se divorcio. empezó a batallar, ya que con la pensión que le da su esposo y no alcanzaba a mantener los gastos de la casa y de los hijos. Hace poco mas de un año empezó vendiendo joyería de plata a consignación y así fue formando su cartera de clientes.

Solicita un préstamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para establecerse y no vender solamente de casa en casa, quiere rentar un local. con tu apoyo esto sera posible.

loans.use: Rent a shop.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is 48-years old and the father of four children. The children are in school. For the past five years, he has been selling cement to people who want to build a home. Cement has a large market, as more people are building homes in his town. He will use his loan to buy more bags of cement and increase his stock. He is a member of the called Providence. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cement

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
Juana started her business selling comforters when her husband lost his job and they were struggling to make ends meet. She began three years ago selling to her neighbors and family members. Gradually, she has increased her sales.

Now, she needs a loan of US $350, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can remodel her home, installing a shop inside of it, and, in this way, establish her business more.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana emprendió su negocio de venta de blancos cuando su esposo se quedo sin trabajo y no tenia ni para la alimentación básica. Comenzó hace 3 años vendiendo con los vecinos y familiares pero poco a poco ha logrado incrementar sus ventas.

Ahora necesita un préstamo por US $ 350 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su casa, instalando un local dentro de esta, y asi formalizar mas su negocio.

loans.use: Remodel her shop.

loans.name: Nuura

texts.en: Nuura is married and she has one child. Nuura been buying and selling large quantities rice, millet, beans, peanuts, wheat and some grocery products for ten years. She travels to the northern part of Ghana to buy her products and retails them in the central region of the country. The cost of her frequent travels reduce her income. She will use her loan to buy more bags of rice, millet, beans, peanuts, etc., on each trip so that her travel expenses are fewer and she can avoid price hikes. She is a member of the group called “Odwanwhefo Pa” meaning the Good Shepherd.  Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, millet, bean, peanuts, wheat, etc

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is 38- years old and a married woman. She trades in frozen foods like fish, assorted meat and chicken. Prices of frozen foods keep increasing, and this lessons her income when her stock is low. She will use her loan to buy more cartons of frozen foods to enable her stay in business and also to avoid price hikes for good income. She is a member of the group called “Odwanwhefo Pa” meaning the Good Shepherd. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fish, meat and chicken

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
Jose is single and he began his business because three years ago he lost his job. For him, working with his hands has always come easily. As a result, he began making decorative items, which he then paints and sells directly to customers, without a middleman. In this manner, his business began to prosper.

Now, Jose needs a loan of US $350, which he will repay in 6 months, so that he can remodel his shop. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Jose es soltero y empezo este negocio porque hace tres años quedo desempleado, a el siempre se le facilitaron las manualidades, por lo que inicio fabricacando los articulos para decoracion, despues tambien pintandolos y vendiendolos, el directamente sin intermediarios, fue asi como su negocio empezo a prosperar.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $350 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su local, con tu ayuda esto sera posible.

loans.use: Remodel his shop.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is 35-years of age and she has been selling plastic containers to enable people store water for use in the various homes in her community. She also sells babies' products like diapers, creams and soaps. Water shortage is very common and the demand for storage containers  is in high demand. Efua is married with 4 children and her biggest dream is to see the children go to university. She will use her loan to buy more plastic containers and increase her business. She is a member of the group called Exodus 14:14. Members agree to support and guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more plastic containers for storage of water

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is the mother of five children. The children are all in school. She has been selling cosmetics, soft drinks like coca cola, fanta, sprite and some grocery products in her town. She is a hardworking woman and it is her cherished dream to see all her children complete university. Grace will use her loan to buy more crates of soft drinks, cosmetics and some grocery products to increase inventory and sales so that she can take care of the family. She is a member group called “Odwanwhefo Pa” meaning the “Good Shepherd”.  Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy boxes of cosmetics, crates of soft drinks and grocery products

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria is divorced and has five married children. None of her children help her in her business; rather, she has an assistant who performs this job. She began twenty years ago, when her ex-husband left her and she needed to support her children. She bought used clothing which she then resold to her friends and family members. Gradually, her sales have increased.

Now, Maria is requesting a loan of US $250, which she will repay in 4 months, so she can purchase a new awning since the framework of the one she has broke. With your help, Maria will continue to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria es divorciada y tiene 5 hijos casados, ninguno de sus hijos le ayudan en el negocio ella tiene un ayudante para esto. Ella comenzó hace 20 años, cuando su ex esposo los abandono y necesitaba sacar adelante a sus hijos por lo que compro ropa seminueva y empezó a ofrecerla entre sus familiares y amigos poco a poco ha logrado incrementar sus ventas.

Ahora solicita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar un toldo nuevo, ya que el que tiene se rompió el armazón. con tu apoyo ella seguira proserando.

loans.use: Purchase a new awning.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda is a single woman who is dedicated to selling suitcases, backpacks, and novelty items. She began this business because she did not have a job and she needed to find an activity so she could support herself. She began it 10 years ago when she was laid off from the factory she was working in. She used her severance to start this business. Due to her efforts, the business prospered and subsequently she found a space where she formally established her store.

Hilda needs a loan of US $600, which she will repay in 6 months, so she can remodel her shop. With your help, she will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Hilda es soltera, se dedica a la venta de maletas, mochilas y novedades. Inicio este negocio porque no tenia empleo y necesitaba una actividad para mantenerse. Empezo hace 10 años, cuando la liquidaron en la maquiladora que trabajaba y la liquidacion la invirtio para comenzar su propio negocio. En base a asu esfuerzo a propserado y posteriormente rento su local donde se establecio formalmente.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su local. Con tu ayuda ella saldra adelante.

loans.use: Remodel her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes and slippers for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy used women's clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy used women's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy costume jewelry for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients for a catering service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of shoes and clothes for her small business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in materials for her small beauty parlor

loans.name: Lucia Gabriel

texts.en:
Lucia is 38 years old and originally from Boane, a village 30Km away from the capital city Maputo. Lucia is married and has 5 children aging 15 to 1 years old. Lucia studied until 5th grade and stopped after the Mozambican civil war started, never returning to school again.

Lucia has been working selling products for many years now. Since 2000 she has had a small stand at the Boane’s central market where she sells food, such as tomatoes, onions, garlic, peanuts, coconut and basic products such as oil and soap. Tomatoes and oil are Lucia’s best products. She buys the products in Maputo, going 3 times a week by public transportation. Lucia buys a box of tomatoes for MTn 250 and sells 4 for MTn 5. Lucia makes around MTn 800 per day, at the end of the month she makes up to MTn 1,200 in a single day. Lucia’s husband works at their own machamba (small agricultural field) and helps with the household expenses and the children’s school fees.

This will be Lucia’s third loan with Hluvuku and first one with Kiva. The first MTn 5,000 was used to buy merchandise and increase the products sold at the stand, attracting more clients and increasing her daily sales. The second MTn 10,000 was used to buy cement to keep helping with the construction of her new house. Lucia currently lives at a small house with her family, but is already building a bigger house on land they have recently bought. Lucia intends to use this MTn 10,000 to buy merchandise, possibly diversifying the products offered at her stand, and if money allows buy some bricks and more cement to continue the construction of her house.

In the future Lucia would like to build a small henhouse at her new house’s backyard so that she can raise chicks and sell them, improving her household income.

The picture shows Lucia with her 6-year-old daughter Francisca and her youngest son, Luciano, 1 year old.

loans.use: Buy products to increase inventory of stand

loans.name: Lilah

texts.en: Lilah lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married, the mother of 3 children, and has a small  embroidery business. She has been involved in this business for more than two years. Her business is going well and now she wants to expand and has requested an individual loan to complete her stock and buy new embroidery machines  to improve her business and help her husband and her family. She is happy about this loan.

loans.use: Buy embroidery machines

loans.name: Jamshid

texts.en: Jamshid lives with his own family in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has a clothing sales shop. He was out of country for a bout 8 years and he worked in a clothing sales shop. When he came back to Afghanistan one year ago he opened a clothing sales shop. His business is going well but he needs to import more clothes. He needs money so wants to take out an individual loan to complete his stock and buy more clothes for the young generation to make a good monthly income and help his family.

loans.use: Buy more clothing for his shop

loans.name: Akmal

texts.en: This is Akmal, son of M. E.. He lives in the first district of Ningarhar province. Akmal is married and has five children. He is an active person and has been working as a shopkeeper since 2002 in Jalalabad city. But he can't solve his financial problems, therefore he wants to stand on his own feet and improve his small business, so he has requested from AFSG to take a 500,00 Afghanis loan for 18 months. With this loan he wants to buy some more food and materials for his shop.

loans.use: TO buy Foods and materials for his shop

loans.name: Wcsl Group

texts.en: Solomon K. is headmaster for a primary school in Makeni town, Sierra Leone.  He worked as a teacher for 32 years but could not make sufficient income.  His wife does microbusiness and could barely make enough income for the family.  Solomon would like to assist his wife to expand the business and is therefore requesting a loan of Le.600,000 which he will repay from his monthly salary.  Teresa is also a teacher and would like a loan of Le.400,000 to invest in her microbusiness of food selling and she would repay the loan from her monthly salary. Total loan amount required for the group is Le.1,000,000.

loans.use: To purchase more stock.

loans.name: Wcsl - 2 Group

texts.en: Mr. Daniel B. K. is a head teacher at Weslean Primary School in Makeni town of Sierra Leone.  He has been teaching for 31 years but the salary is insufficient to enable him to build a family house.  It took Daniel and his group members (who are all teachers) a long time to save to purchase a piece of land.  Some members have started constructing their houses but could not continue due to lack of money.  When the group heard about the Kiva program through SMT, they submitted an application for a loan of Le.2,800,000 to purchase building materials for the completion of their family houses. The group members will pay their installments from their monthly salaries.

loans.use: To purchase building materials ( iron sheets, cement, doors)

loans.name: Trinh Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Trinh Thi T., 33 years old, is a 4th-year member of TYM. Her primary job is selling birds and she has been doing well due to her trustworthy and good communication skills. Each month, Ms T. earn about $130. In addition to that she also raise pigs and chickens to increase her family's income in order to pay for her children's education. She currently live with her husband and 2 children (a 9 years old and another 5 years old). This loan cycle, she would like to borrow 825 USD to buy more birds for he business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trịnh Thị Tình, 33 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương. Công việc hàng ngày của chị là buôn bán chim cảnh. Nhờ có khiếu ăn nói và luôn tạo được sự tin tưởng nơi khách hàng nên số lượng chim của gia đình bán ra ngày càng nhiều, thu nhập cũng cao. Bình quân một tháng chị Tình thu khoảng 130USD/tháng. Ngoài ra chị còn chăn nuôi để có thêm thu nhập, đời sống gia đình khá giả, có điều kiện đầu tư cho con cái ăn học. Hiện chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con, 9 và 5 tuổi. Vòng vốn này chị Tình làm đơn xin vay 825USD để mua chim về bán.

loans.use: Buy birds

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Thuận, 45 years old, is a fourth year member of the TYM Fund. Her family includes the couple and four children, two are still in school age. She weaves straw mattresses. She uses the funds from her loans to buy straw, the raw material for making straw mattresses. The income is quite rewarding at 150USD a month. After 4 years with the Fund, she has saved enough and been able to build for them a new house. They are all happy for the new life. She is applying for a loan of $375 to buy straw.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Thuận, 45 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 4 người con, trong đó 2 con còn đi học. Công việc của chị Thuận là đan chiếu bán. Sau khi vay vốn của Quỹ, chị có thêm nguyên liệu làm nên thu nhập tăng lên đáng kể. Sau 4 năm tham gia, chị Thuận đã làm được nhà mới khang trang. Vòng vốn dài hạn này chị vay 375USD để mua thêm cói dệt chiếu. Chị rất phấn khởi vì nhờ tham gia Quỹ mà gia đình chị đã như được bước sang một trang mới. Thu nhập hàng tháng hiện nay của chị Thuận là 150USD.

loans.use: Buy sedge

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Though 63 and all children have grown up, Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Đạm is ever active. Her husband has passed away and she is living with one of her sons. As people in the area, she farms rice paddy and weaves straw mattresses. Her income is about 6-7USD a day. The daily income is convenient for her to pay her weekly repayments. She wishes to keep being active so does not have to depend on her children too much. This time she is applying for a loan of $375 to buy straw.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Tuy đã 63 tuổi, các con đều đã trưởng thành nhưng chị Nguyễn Thị Đạm vẫn tích cực tham gia lao động sản xuất. Chồng đã qua đời, chị sống cùng với người con trai. Cũng như người dân trong vùng, chị Đạm làm ruộng và dệt chiếu. Trước đây chị vay vốn làm kinh tế và hỗ trợ các con ăn học. Mỗi ngày thu nhập từ dệt chiếu 6-7USD, ngoài ra chị còn có lương hưu 70USD/tháng. Việc dệt chiếu không những thuận lợi trong hoàn trả tuần mà còn giúp chị Đạm có tiền mua sắm các tiện nghi trong gia đình. Đến nay các con chị đã ra trường và có công ăn việc làm, chị Đạm vẫn tiếp tục vay vốn sản xuất tạo thu nhập để không phải nhờ vả các con. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị lần này là 375USD để mua cói.

loans.use: Buy sedge

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Hồng, 33 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. She farms and tends livestock for living. They did not have either much land or livestock so the main income was coming from her husband’s construction job. In 2005, she joins the TYM Fund and takes out loans to invest in livestock. The business is prosperous, family’s economy is better and she can provide more to her children’s education. She is applying for a loan of 375USD to buy pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Hồng, 33 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Công việc chủ yếu của chị là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Diện tích ruộng không nhiều, vốn đầu tư cho chăn nuôi ít nên thu nhập chủ yếu của gia đình chủ yếu từ chồng làm thợ xây. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ vào năm 2005, có thêm vốn đầu tư nên thu nhập từ chăn nuôi tăng lên đáng kể. Đời sống gia đình được nâng cao, 3 con chị Hồng được mẹ cho ăn học tử tế. Với sự hỗ trợ từ phía chồng nên việc hoàn trả của chị Hồng rất thuận lợi. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 375USD để đầu tư nuôi lợn.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Lịch, 43 years old, lives with her husband and three children, two of them still in school age. She weaves straw mattresses for living. She produces quality product and the business is steady. She joins the TYM Fund to finance her business. The monthly income is 200USD. This time she is applying for a loan of 375USD to buy straw, raw material to make straw mattress.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Lịch, 43 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 3 con. 2 trong số 3 người con của chị còn đang đi học. Theo nghề truyền thống là dệt chiếu, chị Lịch thường chọn nguyên liệu tốt để làm chiếu nên sản phẩm làm ra đến đâu là bán hết đến đó. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ Tình thương, có thêm vốn, công việc làm ăn phát triển rất thuận lợi. Đời sống gia đình được nâng cao, các con được cho ăn học tử tế. Hiện nay thu nhập bình quân của chị Lịch là 200USD/tháng. Đang lúc giá rẻ nên chị Lịch làm đơn xin vay 375USD để mua thêm cói dự trữ.

loans.use: Buy sedge

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Lý, 32 years old, second year member of the TYM Fund, lives with her husband and two children, both are at school age. She weaves straw mattresses farms rice paddy for living. Her husband drives truck. She uses the funds from her loans to invest in her mattress weaving business. The monthL. income is 100USD. The weekL. repayment plan fits her well. Her husband chips in when needed. The famiL. economy is relativeL. comfortable and allows her to take care of her children better. She is applying for a loan of 375USD to buy straw, raw material for mattress weaving.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Lý, 32 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 2 của Quỹ Tình thương. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 2 con còn đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Công việc của chị Lý là ở nhà dệt chiếu và làm ruộng còn chồng chị lái xe chở hàng. Các vòng vốn trước chị Lý thường vay vốn mua cói dệt chiếu. Thu nhập hàng tháng của chị khoảng 100USD. Nhờ có thu nhập thường xuyên nên việc hoàn trả tuần của chị Lý rất thuận lợi. Những khi có khó khăn chồng chị lại hỗ trợ một cách tích cực. Kinh tế khá giả nên chị Lý có điều kiện chăm sóc con cái nhiều hơn. Vòng vốn này chị làm đơn xin vay 375USD để mua thêm cói dệt chiếu.

loans.use: Buy sedge

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Niên, 52 years old, is a member of the TYM Fund since 2003. Her husband passed away long ago and she lives with a son. The family was always poor. The house was so unstable, they constantly worry when monsoon season comes. After joining the fund the family economy gets better that she was able to save a little and the saving was used to build a sturdy new house. She would like to take out a loan of 325USD to buy straw, raw material for straw mattress weaving. Her monthly income is about 180USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Niên, 52 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 2003. Chồng mất đã lâu, chị sống cùng người con trai. Trước đây nhà chị rất nghèo, nhà cửa tạm bợ, khi mùa mưa gió đến thì luôn lo lắng. Vay vốn của tổ chức khác thì chỉ trả được lãi nên đời sống gia đình mãi không khá lên được. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ, nhờ cơ chế hoàn trả thuận tiện nên chị đã tích góp và làm được một căn nhà mới khang trang. Vòng vốn này chị vay 325USD để mua thêm cói dệt chiếu. Thu nhập hiện nay của chị Niên là 180USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy sedge

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 36 years old, is the fifth member of TYM Fund. Her husband passed away when her 2 children are still very little. Her life at that time was very difficult for her. Since her family did not own any valuable properties, she could not loan money from the banks. When the TYM Fund came to her area, Mrs. T. enthusiastically joined and borrowed money. The borrowed money is mainly used in buying sedge to weave mats. Her painstaking character together with a convenient working mechanism of TYM Fund make ways for her family economy to improve. After 5 years of participation, Mrs. T. saved enough money to build a well-furnished house with TV, fan, etc. Her current average income is 150 USD/ month. This time she wants to borrow 500 USD to buy more sedge, and partly for breeding animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Thảnh, 36 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 5 của Quỹ Tình thương. Chồng mất khi 2 con còn rất nhỏ, cuộc sống của chị vất vả tưởng như không thể thoát ra nổi. Nhà neo người không có tài sản gì đáng giá nên chị không thể vay được ở các ngân hàng. Khi Quỹ Tình thương về với địa phương, chị Thảnh đã chủ động xin tham gia vay vốn. Số vốn vay được chị đầu tư chủ yếu vào mua cói dệt chiếu. Sự chịu khó nỗ lực vươn lên cộng với cơ chế hoạt động rất phù hợp của Quỹ đã tạo điều kiện cho kinh tế gia đình chị phát triển. Sau 5 năm tham gia chị Thảnh đã tích góp xây dựng được ngôi nhà mái bằng và mua sắm nhiều tiện nghi có giá trị khác trong gia đình như tivi, quạt điện, phích điện ... Thu nhập hàng tháng hiện nay của chị Thảnh là 150USD. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 500USD để mua cói, ngoài ra chị cũng dành một phần cho chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Buy sedge and breed animals

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Pham Thi S., 37 years old, is the fourth member of TYM Fund. Her husband is an abroad laborer. She stays at home with 3 children that are going to school. Her main activities are working on the rice field, breeding animals and weaving sedge mats. She usually uses borrowed money to buy sedge, fertilizer and animal-feed. She spends the profit in sending her children to school and in living cost. Her current average income is 100 USD/month. Also, her husband usually sends money home. This time she wants to borrow 375 USD to buy sedge and fertilizer. 
 Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị Sậu, 37 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương. Chồng đi xuất khẩu lao động, chị ở cùng với 3 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Công việc chính của chị là làm ruộng, chăn nuôi và dệt chiếu. Các vòng vốn vay thường được chị sử dụng mua cói, phân bón bón ruộng và thức ăn chăn nuôi. Lợi nhuận mang lại được chị Sậu đầu tư cho các con ăn học và chi phí cho sinh hoạt gia đình. Thu nhập một tháng của chị Sậu từ dệt chiếu khoảng 100USD, ngoài ra chồng chị cũng thường xuyên gửi tiền về cho vợ con. Vòng vốn này chị Sậu xin vay 375USD để mua cói và phân bón.

loans.use: Buy sedge and fertilizer

loans.name: Cao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Cao Thi S., 47 years old, is the fifth member of TYM Fund. Her husband is a worker, and she sells chickens in the market. Everyday, she carries the chickens to Hanoi to sell. Even though the work is strenuous, she earns more profit than to sell chickens locally. Her current average income is 300 USD/month. She spends her profit in sending her children to school and to furnish her house. Last time, Mrs. S. borrowed 375 USD. This time, she wants to borrow 575 USD to buy more chickens to sell in the town.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Cao Thị S., 47 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 5 của Quỹ Tình thương. Chồng làm công nhân, bản thân chị làm nghề buôn gà. Hàng tuần chị mang gà từ nhà ra Hà Nội bán. Công việc tuy vất vả nhưng lợi nhuận cao hơn bán tại địa phương. Bình quân một tháng chị thu khoảng 300USD. Số tiền này chị đầu tư cho các con ăn học và mua sắm vật dụng trong gia đình. Vòng vốn dài hạn vừa rồi chị mới vay 375USD nhưng việc buôn bán luôn cần vốn để quay vòng nên chị S. quyết định vay thêm 575USD. Có thêm vốn, chị S. có thể thu thêm nhiều hàng cho những lần đi buôn xa nhà.

loans.use: Buy chickens

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Do Thi L., 38 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2004. Her family has 4 members: 2 parents and 2 children who are still going to school. Before, her main activities were working on the rice field and breeding animals. After borrowing and saving money, she is able to buy a rice-husking machine. Her average income is 130 USD/month from husking the rice. Since buying the husking machine, Mr. Duc, her husband, does not have to work in Hanoi anymore. He now stays at home and helps her. This time she wants to borrow 575 USD to buy new motor and diesel engine to accommodate local people.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Đỗ Thị Lọc, 38 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2004. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Công việc trước đây của chị Lọc là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Qua các vòng vốn chị đã tích cóp và mua được máy xát gạo. Trung bình một tháng chị Lọc thu 130USD từ dịch vụ xay xát. Từ khi có thêm việc, anh Đức, chồng chị không đi làm cửu vạn ở Hà Nội nữa mà ở nhà hỗ trợ vợ. Vòng vốn này chị Lọc đề nghị xin vay 575USD để đầu tư thay mô tơ mới và mua thêm máy nổ phục vụ bà con thôn xóm.

loans.use: Buy new motor and diesel engine

loans.name: Sandra Esther

texts.es:
Sandra is an enterprising woman who started her business because she didn't have a job and she saw a good opportunity to start her own business. She did so because she needed money to cover her expenses and to get ahead. She started her business a year ago when the owners of a stationary store offered to sell it to her and because she couldn't afford all of her expenses.

She now needs a loan of US$600, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase merchandise to increase her store's stock.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Sandra es una muer emprendedora que inició el negocio porque no tenia trabajo y vio una buena oportunidad de iniciar su propio negocio, ya que necesitaba dinero para costear sus gastos y salir adelante. Comenzó hace 1 año, cuando los dueños le ofrecieron la papelería, ya que la estaban traspasando.

Ahora necesita un préstamo por US $ 600 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y tener mas surtido el negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto started his business because he had difficulty covering his educational expenses due to his father’s passing and his mother lack of economic opportunities. For this reason, he decided to start a business. He started out by selling chips and soft drinks outside an educational center, where he has been able to increase his sales little by little. He was eventually able to set up a more formal snack bar business.

He now needs a loan of $500.00 USD, which he will repay in 6 months, so that he can invest it into his business by purchasing goods, which will in turn increase his profits. With your help, Alberto will be able to continue his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Alberto inició el negocio porque tiene dificultades economicas para cubrir sus gastos de estudio ya que su papa fallecio y las posibildades economicas de su mama son muy escasas. Por lo que emprendio un negocio, comenzo vendiendo fritos y cocas hace un año afuera de una institucion educativa donde poco a poco ha logrado incremenar sus ventas y asi ha podidio establecer su negocio tipo snack, mas formalmente.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para invertir mas en su negocio, comprando mercancia, lo cual le producira mas ganancias. Con tu apoyo Alberto podra seguir estudiando.

loans.use: Purchase snacks

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina is a married mother of 3 children ages 20, 18, and 16. She started the business because she needed an additional income aside from her husband's. Her parents are under her care, and she needs money for their diabetes medication, so 2 years ago she started selling comforters, sheets, and bedding by catalogue to her friends and family. Her sales have been good, so she set up a business space.

She now needs a loan of $500.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can expand her business space. With your help, Carolina will keep moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Carolina es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 20, 18 y 16 años. Inició el negocio por necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional al que le proporciona su esposo, porque se hace cargo economicamente de sus papas, ella necesitaba dinero para medicamento de sus padres ya que los dos son diabeticos. Por lo que decidio emprender su negocio comenzó hace 2 años , ofreciendo colchas, sabanas, blancos por catalogo entre sus familiares y amigos. logrando asi buenas ventas, hasta establecerse en un local.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $ 500 que pagara en 6 meses para ampliar su negocio. Con tu ayuda Carolina seguira adelante.

loans.use: Remodel bussines space

loans.name: Blanca Esthela

texts.es:
Blanca started her business because she needed the additional income. Her husband does not have a steady job, and she needed to pay tuition for her 3 children. Five years ago, she started selling cosmetics by catalogue, then she included lingerie. Until now, her business has prospered. Her eldest daughter, Laura, helps her to sell the products and collect payments.

She needs a loan of $400.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to expand her business space. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Blanca inició el negocio por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional al que le proporciona su esposo ya que el no tiene un trabajo fijo y necesitaba pagar las colegiaturas de la escuela sus 3 hijos comenzó su negocio hace 5 años, ofreciendo cosmeticos por catalogo, despues agrego leneceria y hasta la fecha le ha ido muy bien, su hija mayor Laura le ayuda a vender y cobrar a los clientes.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para poder ampliar su negocio. Con tu ayuda esto sera posible.

loans.use: Remodel business space

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Elisa started the business due to financial necessity since she did not have enough money to raise her children. Her husband does not make very much money as a welder because he is not on a fixed income. Elisa wanted her 2 children to continue with their studies, but it was difficult because she did not have enough money to buy neither school supplies, nor uniforms, nor shoes. It was then—10 years ago—that she started selling basic foodstuff such as beans, sugar, rice, bread, and milk. She soon set up her general store, and thanks to this business, her children have been able to study and get ahead in life.

She needs financial support, a loan of $350.00 USD that she will repay in 6 months, so that she can restock her shop by purchasing merchandise. With your help, Elisa will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Elisa inició el negocio por necesidades economicas, ya que no se completaba para sacar a sus hijos adelante, porque su esposo gana poco y su sueldono es fijo, el trabaja como Soldador. Ella deseaba que sus 2 hijos siguieras estudiando, pero veia la situacion muy dificial porque no tenia para comprar los utiles escolares, unifromes ni zapatos. Fue entonces que comenzó su negocio hace 10 años vendiento productos de primera necesidad como frijol, azucar, arroz, pan y leche, hasta poder establecer una tienda de abarrotes, y garcias a esta sus hijos han podido estudiar y salir adelante.

Ella necesita apoyo economico, un prestamo por US $350 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir mas su abarroteria, comprar mercancia. Con tu ayuda Elisa saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca is a widow who has 3 children: Rolando, age 26 (employed), Sergio, age 33 (employed), and Francisca, age 28 (homemaker). She started this business out of financial necessity since she did not have sufficient income to both raise her children and pay for their educational expenses. She started making candy and selling it from home 15 years ago. She now sells it in nearby communities, thus concurrently broadening her client-base and her profits.

She needs a loan of $775.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase the ingredients necessary to make her candy. With your help, Francisca will get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisca es viuida y tiene 3 hijos: Rolando de 26 años empleado , Sergio de 33 años empleado y Francisca de 28 años se dedica al hogar. Inició el negociopor necesidad economica ya que no tenia ingresos suficientes y tenia los gastos de la escuela y manutención de sus hijos. Comenzó su negocio hace 15 años haciendo dulces y vendiendo en su su casa pero ahora, ya sale a venderlos en municipios cercanos, abarcando mas clientes y logrando mejores ingresos.

Ella necesita un credito por US $775 que pagara en 6 meses, para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de sus dulces. Con tu ayuda Francisca saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase the ingredients necessary to make candy

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor is a widow and has three children: Jazmin, age 33, is a housewife; Karen, age 29, is married; and Isac, age 24, just received his bachelor’s degree in Business Administration. She started her business because she needed extra income to be able to pay for household and personal expenses, and she also needed her own income in order to afford her home and health expenses. She began three years ago selling clothing. As she had always liked sales, it went well after the business was started, and she has continued selling clothing since then.

She is requesting a loan of $775, which she will repay over 4 months, in order to purchase more clothing and have a greater variety of clothing, and in this way earn more. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Leonor, es viuda y tiene 3 hijos: Jazmin de 33 años se dedica al hogar, Karen de 29 casada e Isac de 24 años quien se acaba de recibir de Lic. en Administración de Empresas. Inició el negocio por la necesidad de contar con un ingresos extra para gastos familiares y personales ya que necesitaba de un ingreso propio para poder costear los gastos de su casa y gastos de salud. Comenzó su negocio hace 3 años , porque siempre le han gustado las ventas, inicio y le fue bien, por lo que ha continuado con esto, ella vende ropa.

Ella requiere un prestamo por US $775 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mas ropa y tener un mayor surtido y así obtener mas ganancias. Con tu apoyo esto sera posible.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela started her business because of financial needs since her husband was unemployed and they decided to set up their own business. They have been getting ahead little by little. 2 years ago she started selling oils, lubricants and adhesives and cars because her husband used to spend a lot of time selling these products and thus was familiar with them.

She now needs a loan of US$350, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase more oils and to increase their profits. With your support this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Mariela inició el negocio por necesidad economica ya que su esposo se quedo sin trabajo y optaron por poner un negocio propio y han ido saliendo adelante poco a poco.Comenzó hace 2 años con la venta de aceites, lubricantes y adhitivos para los sutos, ya que su esposo se desempeñaba como vendedor de estos productos, por lo que conocia los productos.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $350 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mas aceites y poder obtener mejores ganancias. Con tu apoyo esto sera posible.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
Rosalba is married and has four children: José Guadalupe, age 26, laborer; Jaime Humberto, age 25, teacher; Daniela, age 20, lives in her home; and María Magdalena, age 17, who also lives with her. She began her business because her husband’s salary wasn’t enough to cover the household expenses and children’s school tuition. She needed to make extra money, as they are still paying for their home. She started one year ago, selling food to her neighbors, and after she was successful doing that, she established a cafeteria and sold Mexican snacks.

She is requesting a loan of $350, which she will repay over 6 months, to purchase ingredients to make her food. With your help, she will continue to have a successful business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Rosalba es casada y tiene 4 hijos , Jose Guadalupe de 26 obrero, Jaime Humberto de 25 maestro, Daniela de 20 años vive en su hogar y Maria Magdalena de 17 años tambien. Inició el negocio por necesidad economicas ya que con el sueldo de su marido no podia solventar los gastos de la casa y de estudio de sus hijos. Ella requeria contar con recurso extras ya que ademas se encuentran pagando su casa. Comenzó hace 1 año, vendiendo comidas a sus vecinos, y como le funciono establecio una cafeteria y venta de antojitos mexicanos.

Ahora solicita un prestamo por US $350 que pagara en 6 meses para contar con mas materia prima para elaborar sus alimentos. Con tu ayuda ella seguira con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her food

loans.name: Cora Aleyda

texts.es:
Cora began her business because her husband’s income wasn’t sufficient to be able to get her family ahead in life, and she needed to make extra money in order to get her three children ahead. She started the business two years ago, selling fried foods and soft drinks from her house, until she established a small general store.

She is requesting a loan of $350, which will be repaid over 6 months, in order to purchase merchandise and to better stock products in her store. With your support, Cora will be able to achieve this.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Cora inició el negocio porque los recursos que su esposo le daba no eran necesarios para sacar adelante a su familia y requiera contar con recursos adicionales para poder sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos.Comenzó hace 2 años, vendiendo fritos y refrescos en su casa, hasta que establecio una pequeña tienda de abarrotes.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $ 350 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y tener mas surtido su negocio. Con tu apoyo Cora podra lograrlo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for store

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
Maria is married and his husband works as a gas station attendant. They have four children who are 1, 13, 17, and 18 years old. She started her business because her needs were increasing because her children were getting older and she needed to help her husband with their school expenses. Five years ago on her own initiative she started selling mail-order linens and shoes to her friends, aquaintances and to people are her children's school.

She needs a loan of US$600, which she will repay in 6 months, to be able to purchase seasonal shoes and thus to increase her sales. With your help this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Maria es casada su esposo trabaja como despachador en una gasolineria, tienen cuatro hijos de 18,17,13 y 1 año. inició el negocio por la necesidades que se incrementaron a medida que sus hijos crecian y ella necesitaba apoyar a su marido con los gastos de estudio de ellos. Comenzó hace cinco años por iniciativa propia vendiendo blancos y zapatos por catalogo entre sus amistades y familiares, y en la escuela de sus hijos.

Ella requiere un prestamo por US $ 600 que pagara en 6 meses para poder comprar zapatos de temporada y asi incrementar sus ventas. Con tu ayuda esto sera posible.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Maria Esthela

texts.es:
Esthela started her business because the company where she worked was liquidated and also because she had an illness that prevented her from spending much time out of the house. She needed to have a source of income to support her husband who worked as a driver. Fourteen years ago she opened a grocery store, which has been bringing in good income.

She now needs a loan of US$600, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase merchandise and to have more stock in her grocery store. With your help this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Esthela qué inició el negocio porque la liquidacion de la empresa donde trabajaba, para invertirlo y poder iniciar un negocio, aunado a una enfermedad que sufrio, que no permita que pudiera trabajar mucho tiempo fuera. Ella necesitaba tener una fuente de ingresos para aopyar a su esposo quien trabja como chofer. Comenzó hace catorce años con una tienda de avarrotes, la cual le ha generado buenos ingresos.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $ 600 que pagara en 6 meses para poder comprar mercancia y tener mas surtida la tienda de abarrotes. Con tu ayuda esto sera posible.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sonia Esperanza

texts.es:
Sonia started the business because her husband, who works as a gas station attendant, did not earn enough money to keep up with the family’s growing expenses. Ever since their 2 children entered school, those expenses increased. She wanted to help her husband out by earning an additional income so that they could pay for tuition as well as the household expenses. She started 3 years ago because a friend who sold shoes by catalogue invited her to do the same. Since she really needed the extra income to cover her children’s education, she did not think twice about selling shoes. This business has generated great profits for her because of her broad client-base.

She is requesting a loan of $500.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to buy merchandise. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Sonia inició el negocio por que no le alcanzaba con el sueldo de su esposo, quiuen trabja como despachador de una gasolinera y con la entrada de sus 2 hijos a la escuela aumentaron mucho los gastos. Ella deseaba apoyar a su esposo con un ingreso adicional para poder sacar adelante los gastos de la escuela junto con los de la casa. Comenzó hace tres años porque una conocida que vendia la invito,a vender zapatos por catalogo, y teniendo la necesidad de un ingreso extra por lo de la escuela de sus hijos, no lo penso y se dedico a esto, actualmente le ha generado buenos ingresos ya que cuenta con una amplia clientela.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para poder comprar mercancia Con tu ayuda esto sera posible.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Olga Alicia

texts.es:
Olga started her business to support her husband with household expenses. Since her husband didn’t have a stable job, she was forced to look for a lucrative activity, and that’s how she got into selling clothes. She started two years ago, selling door to door. Now she holds events where she shows her clothes three times a week, a strategy that has resulted in greater sales.

She is presently requesting a $400 loan, to be repaid in six months, which will be invested in buying a sales rack, to be used in more frequent clothes shows.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga inició el negocio para salir adelante por si misma y para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares y salir adelante. Su principal necesidad fue el que su esposo no tuviera un trabajo fijo, lo que la obligó a buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos y se puso a vender ropa. Comenzó hace 2 años vendiendo casa por casa hasta realizar demostraciones 3 dias por semana, estrategia que le genero mejores ventas y es asi como ha continuado su negocio.

Ahora solicita un prestamo por US $ 400, que pagará en 6 meses, para comprar un estante para ventas y poder utilizarlo para realizar demostraciones de ropa más de 3 veces por semana.

loans.use: Purchase of a sales rack.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es:
Mayra took over her mother’s business. She decided to keep selling shoes for a living because she needed to help her parents with the household expenses, as well as raise her 2 children. She started following her mother’s footsteps 6 years ago, selling shoes by catalogue and at the local markets, until finally setting up a business space in her home.

She is requesting a loan of $400.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase a display shelf for the shoes and to restock merchandise to fill some orders.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Mayra inició el negocio para seguir con el negocio con el que contaba su madre, decidio seguir trabajando en la venta de zapatos ya que requiera apoyar a sus padres con el gasto de la casa asi como sacar a sus 2 hijos adelante. Comenzó hace 6 años seguiendo los pasos de su madre en la venta de zapatos por catalogo y mercados hasta poner un local estable en su casa.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para un estante para la exibicion de los mismos y surtir pedidos pendientes por entregar.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and a display shelf

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria is married and has three children. She began her business out of economic necessity since her husband's salary didn't allow them to get ahead and so she put herself to work. Four years ago, she began selling catalog cosmetics to her neighbors and family members until she began to work directly for an important worldwide cosmetics company.

Gloria needs a loan of US $400, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can purchase merchandise and fulfill her customers' orders.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Inició el negocio por necesidad economica dado que el sueldo de su esposo no alcanzaba para salir adelante y se puso a trabajar por su cuenta. Comenzó hace 4 años vendiendo cosmeticos por catalogo entre sus vecinos y familiares, hasta trabajar directo para una importante empresa de cosmeticos a nivel mundial.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y poder surtir pedidos que tiene pendientes, ademas de estucheros para venta.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Bui Thi N., 48 years old, is living with her husband and 3 children. She joined the TYM Fund since 2003. At first, she borrowed 50 USD and invested in breeding pigs. Her first profit of 40 USD motivated her to continue borrowing money. After 4 years, she is able to breed pigs and do retailing with starting fund of 1500 USD. Earning more money, she can send her children to better school. Currently, all of her children are attending colleges and universities. She wishes to be able to continue borrowing money from TYM Fund. This time, she wants to borrow 625 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Bùi Thị N., 48 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 3 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Chị bắt đầu tham gia Quỹ vào năm 2003. Ở vòng đầu chị được vay 50USD và đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Số tiền lãi 40USD trong năm đầu tiên là động lực thúc đẩy chị N. tiếp tục vay vốn trong những vòng tiếp theo. Cho đến nay chị có trên 4 năm vay vốn chăn nuôi lợn và buôn bán nhỏ với tổng số vốn vay trên 1500USD. Có thêm thu nhập, các con chị đều có điều kiện ăn học tử tế. Hiện nay cả 3 con chị đều đang học đại học, cao đẳng. Mong muốn của chị là tiếp tục được tham gia Quỹ vay vốn chăn nuôi. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị N. vòng này là 625USD.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Bui Thi T., 30 years old, joined the Fund since 2003. Her family has 5 members: 2 parents and 3 children. At first, Mrs. T. borrowed 100 USD to breed rabbits. Her first profit was 80 USD. Since then, she started to build up experience and borrow more money. Her projects improve throughout the time, and bring her more profit. Last year, she was able to build a gate for her house and furnish the house. She always wishes to borrow more money to improve her projects. With her current average income of 130 USD/month, she wants to borrow 625 USD this time.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Bùi Thị Tươi, 30 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2003. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 3 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Năm đầu tiên chị Tươi vay vốn 100USD đầu tư nuôi thỏ. Kết thúc vòng vốn chị lãi được 80USD. Từ đó đến nay, chị Tươi đã tích lũy thêm được nhiều kinh nghiệm và mức vay cũng tăng dần lên qua các năm. Dự án ngày càng phát triển và mang lại nhiều lợi nhuận. Năm ngoái, chị đã xây thêm được cổng và sửa sang lại ngôi nhà đang ở. Chị luôn mong muốn được vay các mức vốn lớn để phát triển dự án. Với thu nhập hàng tháng 130USD, vòng vốn này chị đề nghị xin vay 625USD.

loans.use: Buy rabbits

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 37 years old, joined TYM Fund in 2002. Her first loan was 125USD, used to brew wine. After the first year, her profit was 60USD. Brewing wine brings her a steady income, yet not quite high. After two years spending the loan on brewing wine, Mrs. H. switched to sell pork. Her pork comes from two sources: from other household, and from her own farm. Her average monthly income is 150USD. Besides, her husband, Mr. Dinh Van Dieu, alo helps her with the repayments whenever she has difficulty, so she is able to continue to be a member of TYM Fund. After 5 years, Mrs. H. is able to buy a moped. THis time she would like to borrow 625USD to buy pork and sell it.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hồng, 37 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2002. Vòng đầu tiên chị vay 125USD để nấu rượu. Sau năm đầu tiên chị lãi được 60USD. Việc nấu rượu mang lại thu nhập thường xuyên nhưng cũng không cao. Sau hai năm vay vốn đầu tư nấu rượu, chị Hồng chuyển sang đầu tư vào buôn bán thịt lợn. Ngoài mua việc mua thịt lợn từ các lò mổ, chị Hồng cũng chăn nuôi lợn để tăng thêm lượng hàng cung cấp. Thu nhập hàng tháng của chị Hồng khoảng 150USD. Bên cạnh đó chồng chị, anh Đinh Văn Điều, cũng tích cực hỗ trợ vợ trong việc hoàn trả mỗi khi chị gặp khó khăn nên việc tham gia Quỹ của chị Hồng hết sức thuận lợi. Sau 5 năm tham gia Quỹ, chị Hồng đã mua được xe máy giúp cho việc đi lại được thuận tiện hơn. Vòng vốn này chị tiếp tục đề nghị được vay 625USD để mua thịt lợn bán.

loans.use: Buy pork

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi Q., 50 years old, joined TYM Fund in 2003. She has a husband and two children. Her first loan of 70USD was used to brew wine. After the first year, her profit was 100USD. In those next three years, she continued to take loans to brew wine and breeding pigs. Last year, she was able to rebuild her house. Now the price of materials for construction work is increasing, so Mrs. Q. discussed with her husband to borrow 950USD to buy some land and produce bricks. This new job will bring more profit, yet it requires a lot of investment. Mrs. Q. hopes that she will be able to borrow bigger loan in the next years. Her family's average monthly income is 250USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Quỳ, 50 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 2003. Gia đình chị gồm hai vợ chồng và 2 người con. Số vốn vay 70USD lần đầu được chị Quỳ đầu tư cho việc mua gạo nấu rượu. Cuối vòng vốn chị lãi được 100USD. Trong 3 năm tiếp theo chị Quỳ tiếp tục vay vốn về nấu rượu và chăn nuôi lợn. Đến năm ngoái chị đã xây được một căn nhà mới. Hiện nay giá nguyên vật liệu xây dựng đang lên, chị Quỳ bàn với chồng vay 950USD về mua đất về sản xuất gạch xây dựng. Nghề này mang lại nhiều lợi nhuận nhưng cũng đòi hỏi phải có vốn lớn. Chị Quỳ mong các năm tiếp theo chị sẽ được vay mức vốn lớn hơn. Thu nhập hiện nay của gia đình là 250USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy clay to make bricks

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi Q., 35 years old, is a fifth-year member of TYM FUND (Kiva Partner in Vietnam). She has a husband and two children who are still going to school. She used her first loan in breeding pigs successfully, and she continues to use her next loans in this project. Besides, she also has a small stall to sell other daily products; it helps with her repayments. Her income is about 150 USD per month. This time she applies for a loan of 450USD to breed pigs and poultry.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Quyên, 35 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 5 của Quỹ Tình thương. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Sau năm đầu vay vốn chăn nuôi lợn thành công, các vòng vốn sau chị tiếp tục đầu tư vào dự án này. Bên cạnh đó chị Quyên còn buôn bán hàng khô để có tiền trả tuần. Hiện nay thu nhập hàng tháng của chị Quyên khoảng 150USD. Vòng vốn này chị làm đơn xin vay 450USD về chăn nuôi lợn, gà.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phan Thi H., 51 years old, joined TYM FUND (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) in 2003. She has a husband and a grown-up son. She used her first loan of 70 USD to breed pigs. At the end of that year she earned 50 USD in profit. From that time on, she continues to use her loan to breed pigs, and she is able to increase the size of her loan each year. Mrs. H. uses the profit from her farm to pay for the living expenses and for her son's schooling. Her income is about 150 USD per month. This time she applies for a loan of 450USD to buy breeding pigs and their food.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Phan Thị Hịu, 51 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2003. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 1 con trai đã trưởng thành. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị xin vay 70USD để chăn nuôi lợn. Cuối năm chị thu lãi 50USD. Từ đó đến nay số vốn đầu tư cho việc chăn nuôi tăng dần lên qua các năm. Tiền lãi thu được, chị Hịu dùng trang trải chi phí sinh hoạt hàng ngày và cho con ăn học. Thu nhập bình quân của chị hiện nay khoảng 150USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 450USD để mua lợn và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Trinh Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Trịnh Thị Lại is 54 years old. She is married and has 2 children. They live in Đồng Tâm, Ninh Giang. After joining TYM fund, she invested her loans into pig raising. Her husband is a retired official and he receives a pension from the government. She started with just one pig and today she has 5-6 pigs. She makes a profit of about 1000 USD a year. She is able to buy the needed goods for her household. She is requesting a new loan of 625 USD to buy breeding pigs and feed for the animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trịnh Thị Lại, 54 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại xã Đồng Tâm, Ninh Giang. Sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ Tình thương, đồng vốn vay được chị đầu tư chủ yếu vào chăn nuôi. Chồng chị là bộ đội về hưu có lương tháng nên việc hoàn trả tuần rất thuận lợi. Từ một con lợn ban đầu đến nay số lợn đã lên đến 5-6 con. Số tiền lãi hàng năm cũng lên đến hơn 1000USD. Kinh tế phát triển, chị Lại sắm sửa thêm nhiều đồ đạc có giá trị trong nhà. Vòng vốn này chị Lại tiếp tục xin vay 625USD mua lợn giống và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy pigs and food for them

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Vũ Thị Hòa is 54 years old. She is a 4th year TYM fund member. She has 4 children, 2 are still living with her and her husband. She sells pork, this is her main occupation. Ever since she received the loans from TYM, the sales have increased because she could buy more pork to sell. With the money that she makes, she is able to buy the goods that are needed for her household. Her income is 220 USD a month. She is requesting a loan of 950 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Hòa, 54 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ được 4 năm. Chị có 4 người con, trong đó 2 người còn sống với bố mẹ. Công việc hàng ngày của chị Hòa là buôn bán thịt lợn. Từ khi có thêm đồng vốn vay từ Quỹ, số lượng hàng bán ra tăng lên đáng kể. Có thêm thu nhập chị Hoà mua sắm thêm được nhiều vật dụng có giá trị trong gia đình. Thu nhập hiện nay của chị Hòa là 220USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị tiếp tục xin vay thêm 950USD để mua thịt lợn bán.

loans.use: Buy pork

loans.name: Ni Komang Rani

texts.id:
Ni Komang Rani owns a small food kiosk in her front yard. The earnings from the kiosk is used to supplement her husband's income. Her husband, Nengah Jasa, works as a truck driver in the Javanese route. Since her husband's income is barely enough to cover daily living expenses, Rani started a kiosk with starting capital of $110. Rani stocks her kiosk with merchandises like snacks, foods, drinks and others. Rani opens her kiosk at 6 am and closes at 6pm. Each morning, Rani goes tot he market to purchase goods to be sold. She goes to the market at 5 am every day. The market is not too far from her home. She earns about $55 each day. Rani saves her earnings for later days. All her children has been married. She will use the loan from Dinari to purchase more goods varieties to be sold and expand her offering.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Hidup dikota membuat Komang Rani membuka usaha warung didepan rumahnya. Untuk membantu suaminya , Nengah Jasa, yang bekerja sebagai sopir truk ke Jawa . Karena Penghasilannya sebagai sopir tidak mencukupi untuk kebutuhan ekonominya. Maka Rani membantu dengan membuka warung di rumahnya.Dengan modal awal Rp.1.000.000,- Rani melengkapi isi warungnya dengan bermacam-macam barang dagangan seperti makanan, minuman,sembako ,snak,dan lain-lain. Rani membuka warungnya pada pagi hari jam 6 pagi sampai sore jam 6 sore. Setiap pagi Rani juga pergi ke pasar untuk membeli keperluan dagangannya,sekitar pukul 5 pagi,karena rumahnya dekat dengan pasar negara. Keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp.50.000,- perhari, Rani bisa mempergunakan untuk memenuhi kebutuhannya sehari-hari ,karena kebutuhan sembako harganya sangat mahal sekarang ini,maka Rani juga harus bisa menabung untuk masa depannya,karena anak-anaknya sudah semua menikah dan tinggal bersama suaminya. Pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari dipakai untuk menambah modal usahanya agar dagangannya semakin banyak dan berkembang.

loans.use: Increase Merchandise Variety

loans.name: Ni Nengah Sodi

texts.id:
38 year old Ni Ketut Sodi is married. Her husband works in a private company. Ni Ketut Sodi is highly motivated, Ni Ketut Sodi has 2 children, one of which has been married and the other in college. Ni Ketut Sodi is thankful that her child obtained scholarship from the Mayor's office because he is very smart. Ni Ketut Sodi has owned her kiosk for a while. She plans to use the $550 loan to purchase equipments for her kiosk. SHe sells various snacks and Balinese traditional cakes. Every day Ni Ketut Sodi purchases her merchandise from Negara market. She leaves at 4 am and since the market is close to her home, she is usually back by 5 am. Ni Ketut Sodi immediately prepares her merchandise in the kitchen. She usually opens her kiosk at 6 am. As many people stops by to buy snacks, coffee and tea on the way to school and work. Each day she earns about $440 in sales and $55 profit. Ni Ketut Sodi is hopeful that Dinari loan can improve her kiosk and increase its profitability.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Ni Ketut Sodi berumur 38 tahun dan suaminya bekerja disebuah perusahaan swasta. Ni Ketut Sodi memiliki semangat hidup sangat tinggi. Ni Ketut Sodi memiliki 2 orang anak, 1 anaknya sudah berumah tangga dan 1 masih kuliah. Ni Ketut Sodi sangat bersyukur karena anaknya mendapat beasiswa dari bupati karena pintar. Ni Ketut Sodi menekuni usaha warungnya sudah lama.Dengan modal yang didapat dari Dinari Rp.5.000.000,- dipergunakan untuk membeli semua kebutuhan warungnya.Adapun dagangan yang dijual adalah berbagai macam makanan ringan dan aneka jenis kue tradisional Bali. Setiap hari Ni Ketut Sodi berbelanja di pasar Negara pukul 04.00 pagi sudah berangkat ke pasar, jarak pasar dengan tepat tinggalnya sangat dekat. Sampai dirumah pukul 5.00 pagi Ni Ketut Sodi langsung mempersiapkan dan memasak semua keperluan warung dan rumah tangganya. Ni Ketut Sodi mulai berjualan jam 6.00 pagi karena pagi-pagi banyak yang membeli jajan, kopi, dan teh. Setiap hari penghasilan kotor yang didapat Rp.400,000,-dan keuntungan bersih tiap hari Rp.50,000,-. Ni Ketut Sodi bersyukur mendapat pinjaman dana dari Dinari sehingga warungnya menjadi ramai.

loans.use: Broaden Merchandise Variety

loans.name: Ni Ketut Armawati

texts.id:
After Ni Ketut Armawati was married to I Made Ariasa, she started running a small kiosk in front of her house. She chose the business because she was already used to selling merchandises, just like her mother. She sells various snacks, coconut ice, coffee, etc. Everyday she opens the kiosk at 7 am and closes at 6 pm. Despite a lot of other kiosks near her house, it doesn't decrease her income. Her daily gross income is Rp 500,000 and her net income is up to Rp 60,000 per day. Before getting a loan from Dinari, her kiosk business was not so good as she only offered a few merchandises. However, she has more merchandes and customers nowadays. The loan that she gets is used as the business capital for adding more varieties of merchandises.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Setelah menikah dengan I Made Ariasa, suaminya, Ni Ketut Armawati mulai membuka warung kecil di depan rumahnya.Usaha ini dipilih karena dari kecil Ni Ketut Armawati sudah terbiasa untuk berjualan mewarisi keahlian ibunya. .Barang yang dujual aneka macam makanan kecil , snack, es kelapa muda, kopi dll.Setiap hari Ni Ketut Armawati membuka warung pada pukul 7.00 pagi dan tutup pada pukul 06.00 sore. Walaupun banyak ada warung disebelah kanan dan kiri rumahnya, tidak mengurangi penghasilan yang didapatnya. Setiap hari penghasilan kotor yang didapat dari hasil warungnya Rp 500,000,-, dan penghasilan bersihnya mencapai Rp 60,000,- perhari. Sebelum mendapat pinjaman modal dari Dinari usaha warung Ni Kt Armawati sepi karena dagangannya sedikit tetapi sekarang sudah banyak dan pelanggangnya pun bertambah. Dengan modal yang didapat betul-betul dipakai untuk modal usahanya menambah dan melengkapi jenis barang dagangannya.

loans.use: To add business capital to get more merchandises

loans.name: Astuti

texts.id:
Astuti was born in Java and she went to Bali to work. She met I Putu Abdika and finally was married to him. They have a son named I Putu Pradyana Putra who is now 1 year old. Astuti's husband works in a repair shop, while Astuti runs the kiosk business. She got a loan of Rp.5,000,000 from Dinari and she used it as the business capital. She spent the money to make a simple kiosk and to purchase the supplies. She sells merchandises such as snacks, bread, coffee, and drinks. Everyday she spends about Rp. 150,000 to purchase the supplies. Astuti opens the kiosk from 7 am until 3 pm. Her daily gross income is Rp.200,000 so she can get net income Rp.50,000 per day. With the loan from Dinari, Astuti hopes she can gain more profit and she can cover all of her family's expenses.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Astuti berasal dari jawa dan merantau ke Bali. Akhirnya bertemu dengan I Putu Abdika yang sekarang menjadi suaminya.Dari perkawinan mereka memiliki 1 orang anak laki-laki yang diberi nama I Putu Pradyana Putra umur 1 tahun. Suami Astuti bekerja sebagai bengkel. Sedangkan Astuti menekuni usaha warung. Modal yang dipergunakan untuk usaha warungnya diperoleh dari pinjaman Dinari sebesar Rp.5.000.000,-. Modal ini dipergunakan untuk membuat warung yang sederhana dan sisanya untuk membeli dagangan. Adapun dagangan yang dijual seperti; makanan ringan, roti,kopi,berbagai macam minuman. Setiap hari modal yang dikeluarkan untuk membeli dagangan sebesar Rp.150,000,-. Astuti membuka warungnya mulai jam 7.00 pagi dan tutup warungnya jam 15.00 wita.Setiap hari penghasilan kotor yang didapat dari berjualan Rp.200,000,-. Jadi tiap hari penghasilan bersih Rp.50,000,-.Dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari Astuti mengharapkan keuntungan yang meningkat dan bisa memenuhi semua kebutuhan rumah tangganya.

loans.use: To add business capital for getting more merchandises

loans.name: Ni Luh Karsini

texts.id:
Ni Luh Karsini is very grateful to get a loan from Dinari. Given the capital that she had, she could open a handphone counter near Negara terminal. She spent an initial capital of Rp. 5,000,000 to buy 2 sets of glass rack which cost Rp. 3,000,000, mobile phone prepaid voucher which cost Rp. 1,000,000 and mobile phone SIM cards which cost Rp. 1,000,000.
