Her daily gross income is about Rp. 300,000 and her net profit is about Rp. 35,000 per day. Ni Luh Karsini is also very wise when managing her family's expenses. With a profit of Rp.35,000 per day, she can keep Rp.10,000 for her saving.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Luh Karsini sangat bersyukur mendapat pinjaman dana dari Dinari. Dengan modal yang didapat Ni Luh Karsini bisa membuka konter HP yang berlokasi di dekat terminal Negara.Modal awal yang dihabiskan untuk membuka konter HP menghabiskan Rp.5.000.000,-. Adapun keperluan yang dibeli seperti; membeli 2 set rak kaca Rp.3.000.000,-,membeli isi pulsa elektrik Rp.1.000.000,-, dan membeli nomor perdana Rp.1.000.000,-.Setiap hari penghasilan kotor yang diterima Ni Luh Karsini Rp.300,000,-dan keuntungan bersihnya Rp.35.000,-per hari. Ni Luh Karsini sangat bersyukur mendapat pinjaman modal dari Dinari. Ni Luh Karsini Juga hemat dalam mengatur keperluan rumah tangganya. Dengan keuntungan Rp.35,000,-per hari Ni Luh Karsini juga bisa menyisihkan Rp.10,000,- untuk ditabung.

loans.use: To purchase various handphone accessories

loans.name: Thị Nhung

texts.vi:
Mrs N. Thị Nhung, the group leader, is 43 years old. She's requesting a loan of 2.714.000 VND to replenish the stock for her food stand. Her income is, on average, 120.000 VND/day. She likes taking out loans from SEDA because she can repay in installments. She was the group leader in the last round, her group has repaid the loan. This time she has recruited new members to join her team. She has 3 school aged children.

- Mrs N. Thị Chung is 24 years old. She owns a shop making aluminum windows.She's seeking 2.242.000 VND to buy material for her shop.

- Mrs N. Thị Lan is 69 years old. She sells bamboo. She's seeking 2.242.000 VND.

- Mrs Lê Thị Ngân is 44 years old. She has a food stand selling snacks. She is seeking 2.006.000 VND.

- Mrs N. Thị Liên is 25. She sells CDs. She's seeking 2.006.000 VND.

- Mrs N. Thị Lan is 21. She runs an internet cafe. She is seeking 2.006.000 VND to buy a computer.

- Mrs N. Thị Thêm is 37. She sells refreshment drinks. She is seeking 2.006.000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cô N. Thị Nhung (MS: 030007), năm nay 43 tuổi. Cô vay 2.714.000 VND mua hàng chế biến về bán hàng ăn. Mức thu nhập trung binh là 120.000 VND/ngày. Cô rất thích tham gia vì được trả dần. Cô đã làm nhóm trưởng hết một kỳ, nhóm cô đã hoàn trả vốn vay của chu kỳ 1. Lần nay cô kết nạp thêm một thành viên mới vào nhóm để họ cũng được vay vốn của chương trình như cô. Cô có ba con hiện còn đang đi học. Chị N. Thị Chung (MS: 030008),năm nay 24 tuổi. Chị vay 2.242.000 VND để mua bán khung nhôm cửa kính. Cô N. Thị Lan (MS: 030010), năm nay 69 tuổi. Cô vay 2.242.000 VND để mua bán nứa, tre. Cô Lê Thị Ngân (MS: 030024), năm nay 44 tuổi. Cô vay 2.006.000 VND để mua nguyên liệu bán hàng ăn, chè nước. Chị N. Thị Liên (MS: 030027), năm nay 25 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua bán băng đĩa. Chị N. Thị Lan (MS: 030036), năm nay 21 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua thêm máy kinh doanh của hang Internet. Chị N. Thị Thêm (MS: 030026), năm nay 37 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để bán nước giải khát.

loans.use: food stand

loans.name: Thi Thiet

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyêm Thị Thiết is 35 years old. She is a very hard working woman. She raises pigs and husks rice (with the help of her husband and children). She uses the rice husk (bran) to feed the pigs to cut down the expenses. This is her second group loan, the first one was successfully paid off by her group. This time she is the group leader. She has 3 school aged children. Her family income is 150.000 VND/day. She likes SEDA very much because she can pay off the loan in installments. She is seeking 2.714.000 VND to buy feed for her animals.
- Mrs Nghiêm Thị Toàn is 56. She needs a loan to buy fertilizer for her rice field. She's seeking 2.006.000 VND.
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Sênh is 60 years old. She is seeking 2.006.000 ND to buy rice to make rice cakes.
- Mrs Nghiêm Thị Hoa is 62 years old. She needs 2.714.000 VND to buy grocery for resale.
- Mrs Đỗ Thị Thân is 55 years old. She sells basic goods, she needs 2.006.000 VND.
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Hoà is 51 years old. She husks rice, she needs 2.478.000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyêm Thị Thiết (MS: 020044), năm nay 35 tuổi. Chị rất năng động và chịu khó ngoài chăn nuôi lợn, chồng chị và con chị còn mua thóc về sát lấy gạo ban còn cám để cho lợn ăn, để giảm chi phí chăn nuôi. Chị đã tham gia vay vốn một chu kỳ và cả nhóm chị hoàn trả rất tốt, chu kỳ hai này chị lại làm nhóm trưởng. Chị có 3 con còn nhỏ và đang đi học, mức thu nhập bình quân của gia đình 150.000 VND/ngày.Chị rất thích tham gia chương trình vì được trả góp. Chị vay 2.714.000 VND để mua cám chăn nuôi. Cô Nghiêm Thị Toàn (MS: 020038), năm nay 56 tuổi. Cô vay 2.006.000 VND về mua lân đạm bón lúa. Cô Nguyễn Thị Sênh (MS: 020039), năm nay 60 tuổi. Cô vay 2.006.000 ND để mua gạo làm bánh bán. Cô Nghiêm Thị Hoa (MS: 020040), năm nay 62 tuổi. Cô vay 2.714.000 VND để đi chợ mua bán phế liệu. Cô Đỗ Thị Thân (MS: 020042), năm nay 55 tuổi. Cô vay 2.006.000 VND để đi chợ mua bán hoa quả. Cô Nguyễn Thị Hoà (MS: 020043), năm nay 51 tuổi. Cô vay 2.478.000 VND để lấy vốn mua thóc xay gạo bán.

loans.use: raise pigs, sell basic goods.

loans.name: Tutikhon

texts.en: Tutikhon A. is 52 years old and a widow. She has a son and a daughter. Tutikhon is a market vendor and she sells trousers and shirts for men in the local market. Her children help her in the business. Tutikhons’s daughter is pictured in the photo as Tutikhon had left that day for the neighboring city. Tutikhon has been in this business for eleven years already. During these years she has managed to make her business stable and profitable, generating the main income for her family. Tutikhon is trying to satisfy the needs of any client with various tastes and income levels. She works very hard to give her dearest children a good education and to make them happy. In order to cover the higher education expenses of her daughter as she’s going to enter the university, Tutikhon is planning to increase her working capital in order to purchase the new summer goods to sell. With this purpose Tutikhon requests $870 US Dollars for the term of 3 months. Tutikhon promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all supporting her. Your support will really help her. Be an important part of the growth of Tutikhon’s business.

loans.use: Tutikhon would like to purchase new goods to sell at her men's clothing stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the capital for her business

loans.name: Nasirullo

texts.en: Nasirullo K. is 38 years old and is married with six children. Nasirullo sells foodstuffs like tea, sunflower oil, baby food, soft drinks and sweets. He rents a place for selling which is located in one of the local markets. Nasirullo has been running his own small business for 2 years. At the same time he raises cattle. His wife, who is pictured in the photo, helps Nasirullo with sales. The business is the main source of income and at the same time requires considerable funding. Nasirullo works very hard to give his dear children a good education and to make them happy. In order to cover the higher education expenses of his elder son as he’s going to enter the university, Nasirullo is planning to increase his working capital in order to increase the range of his selling goods. Besides he wants to purchase small cattle in order to increase the number of his cattle. Today Nasirullo requests $1200.00 US Dollars for the term of 12 months. Nasirullo thanks everyone for support and promises to pay the loan in time. Nasirullo is counting on your help. Be an important part of the growth of Nasirullo’s business.

loans.use: Nasirullo would like to purchase foodstuffs for increasing the range of goods in his store and small cattle to raise.

loans.name: Thị Cúc

texts.vi:
Mrs N. Thị Cúc is 24 years old. She makes pork sausages. She is requesting 2.006.000 VND to buy pork. Her husband is furniture maker, he makes wooden tables and chairs. They have 3 young children. Their family income is 150.000 VND/day. She like SEDA's program because she can pay back the loan in installments. This is her second group loan, her first was successfully paid of. This is the same group but she is now the group leader so she could help/support other members.
- Mrs Nghiêm Thị Mến is 28 years old. She makes pork sausages. She's requesting 2.006.000 VND.
- Mrs N. Thị Hảo is 49 years old. She is requesting 2.006.000 VND to buy feed for her pigs.
- Mrs Nghiêm Thị Huế is 20 years old. She needs 2.006.000 VND to buy pigglets to raise.
- Mrs Nghiêm Thị Thanh is 28 years old. She sells basic goods. She needs 2.006.000 VND
- Mrs N. Thị Ty is 27 years old. She sells basic goods. She needs 2.006.000 VND

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị N. Thị Cúc (MS: 020034), năm nay 24 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua thịt lợn về làm giò, chả bán. Chồng chị làm thợ bán bàn ghế bằng gỗ. Chị có 3 con còn nhỏ. Mức thu nhập của gia đình chị 150.000 VND/ ngày. Chị rất thích tham gia vào chương trình vì được trả góp. Chị đã tham gia được một chu kỳ vay vốn và cả nhóm chị hoàn trả rất tốt. Lần này chị và cả nhóm tiếp tục tham gia kỳ II và chị đã xung phong làm nhóm trưởng để giúp đỡ các thành viên khác trong nhóm. Chị Nghiêm Thị Mến (MS:020032), năm nay 28 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để buôn bán giò, chả. Cô N. Thị Hảo (MS: 020033), năm nay 49 tuổi. Cô vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám cho lơn. Chị Nghiêm Thị Huế (MS: 02..35), năm nay 20 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua lơn về nuôi. Chị Nghiêm Thị Thanh (MS: 020036), năm nay 28 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua bán phế liệu. Chị N. Thị Ty (MS: 020037), năm nay 27 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua bán phế liệu.

loans.use: by pork to make sausages

loans.name: Shaibigul

texts.en: Shaibigul S. is 52 years old and married with two children. Shaibigul is a market vendor and she sells men's clothing. She has been in the business for more than ten years. Shaibigul’s husband, who is pictured with her in the photo, helps her with the business. Shaibigul is a friendly and polite woman. She is trying to diversify the range of goods so that she satisfies the needs of her clients with various levels of income. However, the majority of her goods are attractive for customers with average incomes. The business is stable, allowing Shaibigul to make a considerable contribution to the family budget. Now Shaibigul is planning to purchase new men's summer clothing. With this purpose she requests $300 US Dollars for the term of 3 months. Shaibigul thanks all supporting her and promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: Shaibigul would like to increase her working capital in order to expand her business and purchase new goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock of mobile phones and scratch cards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a knitting machine and wool.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase carpentry materials, like timber, velvet, wood, and glue.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an embroidery machine and materials.

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en: Vusal S. is a 25 year old man who sells milk and yoghurt in the small southern village of Saatli region. He started his business in 2002 when he purchased his first calf with the money he had saved. He is living with his retired parents and dairy sales is the only source of income in his family. Vusal decided to increase income for his family and applied for $800 USD to purchase one more good milking cow.

loans.use: Vusal would like to purchase one milking cow.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris A. is 42 years old. She is married with 2 children who are currently in school. She works very hard to support her husband in taking care of their children in school. She operates a clothing shop in the community market. She sells men's and women's clothes like jeans, trousers, club shirts, skirts, and tops, among others. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of men's and women's clothes to increase her stock to make more income for her business and family. She is a member of the group called Transformer Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral in order to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of men's and women's clothes

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 40 years old. He is married and has 3 children. One of his children is in secondary school, and the other two are studying in primary school. They live in a rented house. He has an old taxi. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new engine and new tires and renovate the car in order to increase his income and save for a better future for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase a new engine and new tires.

loans.name: Tofiq

texts.en: Tofiq M. is a 26 year old farmer who owns livestock in the small southern village of Saatli. He works at a dairy factory in the same region, but his main source of income is keeping and breeding calves. He started his business in 2000. He is living in Internally Displaced People Camp with his parents. As he is the only person who works in his family, he tries to improve the living conditions of his family. For this purpose he applied for $1000 USD to purchase three calves for $300 USD each and fodder for the rest $100.

loans.use: Tofiq would like to purchase 3 calves and fodder.

loans.name: Lobonak South 2006-2 Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Antila K..  She is currently in the business of brewing alcohol and is requesting a loan to expand the business.  Antila is 37 years old and is married with a husband who is a watchman. She has 3 children ranging from age 6 to 12 and her children go to school.  Each week, Antila makes approximately 570 Sudanese pounds in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business. Antila is joined in her small group by Rose P., Jane IP., Lina Micheal, and Elizerbeth P..  Rose P. has a business selling at the hotel and wants to expand the business.  Jane IP. is currently operating a business selling at a shop and wants a loan to expand the business.  Lina Micheal operates a business of selling breads and wants to expand the business.  Elizerbeth P. is currently in the business of selling vegetables and is requesting a loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna A. is a 28-year-old businesswoman. She is single and independent. She is the owner and operator of a hardware shop and sells items like cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets and plates, cutlery sets, etc in the local market. Anna is an achiever, and her focus is to expand her business to make more income. She wants to use the loan to buy increased stocks of plastic materials and kitchen sets to serve her customers. She is a member of the community group called Trust and Obey Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral in order to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy increased stocks of plastic materials and kitchen sets

loans.name: Malik

texts.en: Malik B. is a 38 years old farmer who owns his small business of selling dairy to local neighbors. He lives with his wife and four children in the southern region Bilasuvar, in Internally Displaced People Settlement. He started his business in 1990 and since that time it has been his only source of income. He recommends himself as a good borrower, because he already borrowed a loan from Aqroinvest and successfully paid it back. Now he applied for $800 USD to purchase one more cow and start selling milk to the local milk factory.

loans.use: Malik would like to purchase one milking cow.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Azer

texts.en: Azer M. is a 34 year old man who raises livestock in the Bilasuvar Internally Displaced People Settlement. He started his business in 1988 and this is the only source of income for his family. He is married and has two children. As he is IDP he receives very small financial support from government, but it is about  less than $10 USD per person. So Azer pushes himself to work hard and improve his business. For this purpose he applied for $800 USD to purchase one milking cow.

loans.use: Azer would like to purchase one milking cow.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Anar

texts.en: Anar A. is a 37 year old farmer who sells dairy to the local people and dairy factory. He is married and lives with his family in Bilasuvar Internally Displaced People Settlement. He started his business in 1992, and since then he has been doing well and it brings him good income. But prices for products have increased five times and now his earnings are not enough to cover basic family needs. He believes that one more milking cow could bring stability in his family and could help him earn more by selling more milk per day. For this purpose he applied for $700 USD.

loans.use: Anar would like to purchase one more milking cow.

loans.name: Nartul

texts.ru:
Nartul Y. lives in the town of Yavan. He is 43 years old, married and has six children. He does animal husbandry and has a small farm where he breeds calves and then sells them for meat. In order for the calves to grow quickly they need to be fed well and a large stock of fodder is necessary. Nartul decided to get a loan to buy several tons of fodder. This will allow him to feed and grow the cattle faster to have it ready for sale. He plans to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Ярикулов Нартул житель города Яван. Возраст 43 года , он женат и имеет 6 детей.Занимается животноводством. Имеет небольшую ферму , где разводит бычков и затем продает мясникам на мясо.Для того , чтобы бычки быстро росли их необходимо хорошо кормить . Для этого необходим большой запас комбикорма. Для этого он решил получить кредит и закупить несколько тонн комбикорма. Это даст возможность быстрее откормить скот и вывезти на продажу. А погасить кредит он сможет в течении 6 месяце

loans.use: To buy fodder

loans.name: Elkhan

texts.en: Elkhan B. is a 41 year old farmer who has been selling dairy products such as milk and yoghurt in Bilasuvar Internally Displaced People Settlement since 1999. He is married and has three children. He applied for $800 USD to purchase one milking cow. He also works in the local police department, but his main source of funding is dairy sales.

loans.use: Elkhan would like to purchase one milking cow.

loans.name: Natiq

texts.en: Natiq M. is a 27 year old man who has been breeding livestock and poultry in Bilasuvar Internally Displaced People Settlement since 2002. His main source of income is breeding livestock and the second is working as a driver. He recently got married and now he has one son. He lives with his parents and it is very hard for him to keep two families. To improve his life conditions he applied for $600 USD to purchase one milking cow and start selling dairy products to the local milk factory.

loans.use: Natiq would like to purchase one milking cow.

loans.name: Rafiq

texts.en: Rafiq A. is a 42 year old trader who keeps a general store in Bilasuvar Internally Displaced People Settlement. He has sold food and bath equipment such as shampoo, soap and powder since 2000. He is married and has three daughters. His shop is very popular among local people because he is very polite to everyone – that’s why all goods in his shop sell out more quickly than new goods coming in. To improve the situation, Rafiq needs to expand the number of goods he sells and purchase more equipment. For this purpose he applied for $800 USD.

loans.use: Rafiq would like to expand the number of goods he sells at his general store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Born on 31 December 1975 in Amégnran, Mr. Adama H. is married and has eight (8) children. His bakery is his source of income, and is highly sought after by many women because he is the sole breadmaker in his area. This high income business allows him to meet the needs of his family and especially the education of his children.

To strengthen his capital base and better satisfy his clientele, he is asking for a loan. This will serve to stock a large quantity of wheat flour. The realization of this dream will allow him to maintain his clientele and to enlarge it. Thus, his income will increase, allowing his family to flourish.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Né le 31 décembre 1975 à Amégnran, monsieur Adama H. est marié et père de huit (08) enfants. Ayant pour source de revenu la boulangerie, il est sollicité par beaucoup de bonnes femmes car il le seul fabricant de pains dans sa localité. Cette activité très génératrice de revenus lui permet de satisfaire les besoins de sa famille et surtout la scolarisation de ses enfants.

Pour renforcer son fonds de commerce et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, il sollicite un crédit. Ceci servira au stockage en grand nombre de la farine de blé. Ce rêve réalisé lui permettra de maintenir sa clientèle et d’en avoir d’autres. Ainsi, son revenu augmentera, source de l’épanouissement de sa famille.

loans.use: To obtain a supply of wheat flour

loans.name: Feyruz

texts.en: Feyruz Q. is 56 years old and has four children. His main activity is breeding livestock and he has been engaged in this activity since 1988. He lives in the Bilasuvar Internally Displaced People Settlement and does not work anywhere, because there is nowhere to work in this newly-built settlement. As meat is very popular all across Azerbaijan, Feyruz would like to expand his activity and purchase another two calves, each for $400 USD, to increase his monthly earnings.

loans.use: Feyruz would like to purchase two calves to raise.

loans.name: Kurbonbi

texts.ru:
Kurbonbi Nazurova lives in the town of Yavan. She is 38 years old, married and has six children. She is a housewife and has a small farm where she keeps sheep and calves. At this time she wants to buy a cow which will bring milk. She has a large family and because she is unable to provide them with dairy products, she decided to get a loan and purchase a cow. She plans to pay off the loan within six months. This will help her a lot as the cow costs a lot of money so this loan will be of great help and she will be able to pay it off partially within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Назурова Курбонби жительница города Яван. Возраст 38 лет , замужем и имеет 6 детей. Она домохозяйка. Но имеет небольшое хозяйство , где разводит овец и бычков. Но сейчас она хочет купить дойную корову , которая бы давала ей молоко. Так как у нее очень большая семья и она не может обеспечитьее молочными продуктами , она решила получить кредит и купить корову. Погасить кредит она сможет в течении шести месяцев. Это очень поможет ей так как приобрести корову сейчас очень дорого , а кредит выручит ее и она частично сможет погашать кредит течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Murat

texts.ru:
Murat S. lives in the town of Yavan. He is 47 years old, married and has five children. He works in the middle school of Yavan as a chef. Besides that he also does animal husbandry because his salary is very small. He buys calves, feeds them and then resells on the same markets. He plans to get a loan so he can buy another calf. It will help increase his commodity and profits. He plans to pay off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шоимардонов Мурат житель города Яван. Возраст 47 лет , женат и имеет 5 детей. Работает в средней школе города Явана шеф-поваром. Кроме того занимается животноводством , так как заработная плата очень маленькая. Покупает бычков , откармливает иперепродает на тех же рынках . Планирует получить кредит , чтобы купить еще одного бычка. Это поможет ему увеличить оборотную сумму.Погасить кредит он сможет в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Miniqul

texts.ru:
Miniqul G. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is married and has four children. He has secondary education and has a retail business selling vegetables. He sells potatoes which he buys from local farmers and sells on the market. He has been doing this for the past two years. This business brings small income which is only enough to buy food. Miniqul wants to get a loan so he can pay for a truck of potatoes which he ordered. If he pays for it then all of the profits from sales will be his. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Ганиев Миникул проживает в городе Турсун-заде . Женат и имеет 4 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Занимается торговлей овощами. Продает картофель , который скупает у дехкан и продает на рынке. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже около 2 лет. Этот бизнес приносит небольшой доход , которого хватает лишь на питание. Клиент хочет получить кредит , чтобы оплатить за камаз картофеля , который он заказал. Если он заплатит , то вся прибыль от проданного картофеля останется ему.Погасить кредит он сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru:
Dilorom N. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 51 years old, married and has four children. She sells fruits and vegetables and has her own vendor space on the market. This business is the only source of income for her family. In order to improve her family's living conditions, she needs to work very hard. At this time Dilorom need to pay a year's rent for her space on the market. She does not have enough cash flow and available funds to pay a large sum of money and this is why she needs a loan. She plans to pay it off within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Нурмахмадова Дилором жительница города Турсун-Заде. Возраст 51 год. Замужем и имеет 4 детей. Занимается торговлей продуктов питания( овощи и фрукты). Имеет торго вую точку на рынке города. Ее бизнес является единственным источником дохода ее семьи. Для того , чтобы улучшить условия жизни она должна много работать. Сейчас ей необходимо оплатить арендную плату за свою торговую точку. Но оплачивать крупную сумму из оборотных средств у нее нет возможности , поэтому она решила получить кредит, который сможет частично погашать в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To pay the year's rent

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru:
Sharofat S. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda with her family. She is married and has four children. She has her own coffee shop Saehat, which is located in the town's marketplace. She has been in this business for the past 15 years. She wants to buy a stove for baking of sambusa (Tajik patties). This will help increase the variety of her products and attract new customers as well as bring in extra income. To make this possible she needs to get a loan which she plans to pay off within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Сатторова Шарофат жительница города Турсун-заде. Проживает со своей семьей . Она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Имеет частную столовую «Саехат» , которая находится на рынке города. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 15 лет. Хочет купит печь , для выпечки самбусы. Это поможет ей увеличить ассортимент предлагаемой продукции . что даст возможность привлечь новых клиентов. Кроме того это даст ей дополнительный доход . Для достижения своей цели ей необходимо получить кредит , который сможет погасить в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a stove

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Odjamol

texts.ru:
Odjamol A. lives in Tursun-Zoda. She is 32 years old, married and has 4 children. Odjamol manages a market stand at the local "Dehkon" market in Tursun-Zoda where she sells clothes brought from wholesalers in Dushanbe. In order to increase the income from her business Odjamol wants to expand the inventory which she hopes will lead to increased sales. To finance the purchase she needs to take out this loan and is planning to pay it back in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Эшниязова Оджамол проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 32 года , замужем и имеет 4 детей. Занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли. Имеет торговую точку на рынке « Дехкон» города Турсун-заде. Торгует одеждой , который привозит из города Душанбе , покупая у оптовых продавцов. Планирует увеличить товарооборот . который сможет принести ее семье дополнительный доход. Для этого она хочет получить кредит и погашать его в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of additional inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Yves Ekoué

texts.fr:
Born in Cotonou in BENIN, Mr. Yves Ekoué M. is 28 years old. A computer services technician, he is married and is the father of two children, with three other people in his care. Given the quality and speed of his work, the size of his clientele continues to grow. Thus, he is able to partly satisfy his family's needs.

With the hope of increasing his income, he wanted to open a workshop to repair electronic equipment. However, due to a lack of financial means, he has never been able to achieve his goal. Currently, having decided to realize his dream, he is asking for a loan. This will help him increase his income and allow his family to flourish.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Né à Cotonou au BENIN, monsieur Yves Ekoué M. est âgé de 28 ans. Maintenancier Informatique, il est marié et père de deux enfants avec trois autres personnes à charge. Vu la qualité et la rapidité dans ses prestations, le nombre de sa clientèle ne cesse d’augmenter. Ainsi, il arrive à satisfaire en partie les besoins de sa famille.

Dans le souci d’augmenter son revenu, il voulait ouvrir un atelier de réparation d’appareils électroniques. Mais par manque de moyens financiers, il n’est jamais arrivé à atteindre son objectif. Aujourd’hui, décidé à réaliser son rêve, il vient solliciter un crédit. Ceci l’aidera à augmenter son revenu source de l’épanouissement de sa famille

loans.use: To open an electronics repair workshop

loans.name: Husan

texts.ru:
Husan A. lives in Tursun-Zoda. He is 42 years old, married and has 5 children. He works as a clerk at the Tajik aluminum plant in Tursun-Zoda. On the side Husan also has a small cattle raising business. However, recently he has become a proud grandfather of a baby girl and now Husan wants to buy a milk cow to so that the child has fresh cow's milk. Also, if there is a surplus of milk from the cow, Husan will be able to sell it or make soured milk products from it. To purchase the cow Husan decided to take out this loan which he will be able to pay back in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Эшмуродов Хусан житель города Турсун-заде. Возраст 42 года, женат и имеет 5 детей. Работает служащим на Таджикском алюминиевом заводе. Но он имеет небольшое хозяйство , где разводит бычков. Но теперь у него родилась внучка и ему необходимо купить корову , чтобы иметь свое домашнее молоко. Кроме того , если молока будет много . он сможет его продавать или готовить кисло-молочные продукты. Для этого он решил получить кредит , который он сможет погашать в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To Purchase a Microscope and additional Drugs

loans.name: Najmiddin

texts.ru:
Najmiddin D. lives in Tursun-Zoda with his entire family. He is married and has 4 children. Najmiddin has been selling groceries at the local "Dehkon" market for the last 7 years. The income from his business is barely enough to support his large family. That is why Najmiddin is very interested in increasing sales by expanding his inventory and to finance the purchase of additional goods he needs to take out this loan. He is hoping that an updated inventory will allow him to attract more customers. Najmiddin is planning to pay back the loan in the next 4 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Доминов Наджмиддин житель города Турсун-заде. Проживает вместе со своей семьей. Он женат и имеет 4 детей. Занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Торгует на рынке «Дехкон» уже 7 лет. Бизнес приносит доход, который едва хватает для того , чтобы обеспечить свою семью.Поэтому он хочет увеличить товарооборот. Для этого ему необходимо получить кредит. Он сможет завести новый ассортимент и привлечь новых клиентов. Погасить кредит он сможет в течении 4 месяцев.

loans.use: Increasing sales

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ru:
Ahmad B. lives in the city of Tursun-Zoda. He is 44 years old, married and has 4 children. He has a professional degree as a cook. For the last 10 years Ahmad has been managing his own restaurant where he cooks national Tajik dishes. Ahmad wants to take out this loan to purchase new equipment for his kitchen: a refrigerator, a stove and dishes. This investment will help him attract new customers and increase the restaurant's revenue. The increased quality of the Tajik cuisine that Ahmad will be able to serve using new equipment will entice the locals to visit his restaurant more frequently. Ahmad is planning to repay the loan in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Бакиев Ахмад житель города Турсун-Заде. Возраст 44 года. Женат и имеет 4 детей. Имеет средне-специальное образование . По профессии повар. Так и работает. Имеет свою частную столовую, где готовит национальную кухню. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 10 лет. Планирует получить кредит , чтобы закупить новое оборудование: холодильник , печь , и посуду. Это поможет ему привлечь новых клиентов и получить больший доход. Кроме того улучшив качество предлагаемой продукции поможет населению пользоваться услугами нашего клиента.Погасить кредит сможет в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of equipment

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru:
Zarina K. lives in Tursun-Zoda in Tajikistan. She is 23 years old and makes a living selling children's clothes. Her market stall is located at the "Sahovat" market in Dushanbe. Zarina has been managing her business for the last 5 years. She lives with her parents and helps them support the family. Right now Zarina wants to purchase new inventory and needs to take out a loan to finance the purchase. She is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Каримова Зарина проживает в городе Турсун-Заде. Возраст 23 года. Занимается торговлей детской одежды. Торговая точка находится на рынке « Саховат» города Душанбе. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 5 лет. Живет с родителями и помогает им обеспечивать семью. Сейчас хочет завести новый ассортимент товара , поэтому решила получить кредит. Погасить его она планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Expanding inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a candyfloss (cotton candy) machine.

loans.name: Agbuidohoin

texts.fr:
Born in 1968 in Tabligbo (Prefecture of Yoto), Mrs. Agbuidohoim A. currently lives in the village of Amégnran.

Married to a man, she is the mother of five (5) children. Thanks to the sale of foodstuffs, she is able to take care of her needs and those of her family. But ever since she faced a lack of funds, her business has declined considerably.

For her stability and the security of her business, she is asking for a loan in order to respond to her problems. She is absolutely sure that this project will be very beneficial to her, in that it will let her respond to her difficulties.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1968 à Tabligbo (préfecture de Yoto), madame Agbuidohoin A. vit présentement dans le village d’Amégnran.

Marié d’un homme, elle est mère de cinq (05) enfants. C’est à l’aide de la vente de denrées alimentaires qu’elle arrive à prendre en charge ses besoins et ceux de sa famille. Mais depuis qu’elle a eu manque d’argent, son activité a considérablement déchu.

Pour sa stabilité et la mise en confiance de son commerce elle sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir répondre à ses problèmes. Elle est certainement sûre que ce projet lui sera très avantageux dans la mesure où elle répond à sa difficulté.

loans.use: To stock and sell foodstuffs

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Saodat U. lives in the city of Tursun-Zoda. She is divorced and has 3 children. Saodat is the sole bread winner for the family and to earn a living she sells shoes and clothes at a market in Dushanbe. She has been managing her clothing business for the last 15 years. In order to expand the number of items she offers at her clothing stand Saodat needs to take out this loan. She hopes this investment will help her increase her sales and her income which is necessary to support her growing children. Saodat is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Уронова Саодат проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Разведена и имеет 3 детей. Она одна без чьей-либо помощи обеспечивает свою семью. Работает на рынке города Душанбе. Торгует обувью и одеждой. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 15 лет. Хочет увеличить товарооборот , путем получения кредита. Это поможет ей увеличить доход , который так необходим ее детям. Погасить кредит она планирует в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Expansion of inventory

loans.name: Zouweratou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Zouweratou B. was born on May 14, 1968 in Lomé. She is married and the mother of two children. She sells fruit juice, ice, milk, and ice water. She has been in this business since 1998 in the neighborhood called Agoè Zongo in the northern part of Lomé.

In the year 2000, she used her savings to purchase a freezer so as to better serve her customers. With her earnings from this business, she helps her husband meet family expenses.

She is asking for this loan so that she she can buy a new freezer costing 300.000FCA (about US$ 715) as well as 12 sacks of sugar, milk, and small plastic bags.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame B. Zouweratou est née le 14 mai 1968 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle vend du jus de fruits, du glaçon, du lait et de l’eau glacée. Elle mène cette activité depuis 1998 dans le quartier d’Agoè Zongo à l’extrême nord de Lomé.

En l’an 2000 avec l’économie qu’elle a faite, elle a acquis un congélateur pour pouvoir bien servir ses clients. Avec le revenu de son activité, elle aide son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.

Le présent crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acquérir encore un nouveau congélateur d’une valeur de 300.000FCA et d’acheter 12 sacs de sucre, du lait et des sachets.

loans.use:
purchasing a freezer and sugar and milk for re-sale

Achat et vente d'un congelateur, du sucre, et du lait

loans.name: Mahmadrahim

texts.ru:
G. Mahmadrahim lives in the Abdurahmoni Jomi region of Tajikistan. He is 38, is married and has 5 children. G. and his family work in agriculture. They work together harmoniously. He has a plot of land in which he sows wheat, potatoes and other vegetables. He needs a loan to stock up fertilizers for the spring planting season. He plans to repay his loan within 6 months. At harvest time, G. will sell his wheat, potatoes and other vegetables in various markets in and around Dushanbe.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Гафуров Махмадрахим житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 38 , женат и имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается сельским хозяйством. Имеет участок земли , который засеивает пшеницей , картофелем и другими овощами. Планирует получить кредит , для того , чтобы закупить удобрения. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 6 месяцев.У него большая семья и все они дружно работают на земле и помогают друг другу.Полученный урожай клиент будет реализовывать на базарах города Душанбе

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Akossiwoa

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akossiwoa G. was born on December 31, 1965 in ZogbeKpimé, in Kloto County. She is married to Mr. Kodjo Sowo who is a stock clerk. Mrs. Akossiowo G. sells fruit in the neighborhood called Agoè. She often does her buying in Agou County, a locality where fruit is abundant in Togo. This business which she began in 2000 brings in an acceptable income, especially since she got her first loan from WAGES. After having paid off her first loan, she is requesting a loan of 120.000 FCFA (US$ 300) to start up a new business selling a locally produced drink since she has noticed that the people in her neighborhood are fond of it. She intends to add this business to her sales of oranges. With the loan, she plans to purchase 20 baskets of oranges and 50 liters of the locally produced drink.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame G. Akossiwoa est née le 31 décembre 1965 à ZogbeKpimé dans la préfecture de Kloto. Elle s’est mariée à Monsieur SOWO Kodjo qui est Magasinier. Madame G. Akossiwoa est revendeuse de fruits dans le quartier d’Agoè. Elle achète souvent dans la préfecture d’Agou, localité dans laquelle les fruits abondent au Togo. Cette activité qu’elle a commencée depuis 2000 lui procure un revenu acceptable surtout depuis qu’elle a obtenu un premier crédit auprès de WAGES. Après le remboursement de son premier crédit, elle sollicite un crédit de 120.000 FCFA pour débuter encore une nouvelle activité de vente de boisson locale qu’elle constate que cette boisson est appréciée par les habitants de son quartier. Ainsi elle ajoutera ce commerce à la vente des oranges. Avec ce crédit qu’elle sollicite elle envisage acheter 20 paniers d’oranges et 50 litres de boisson locale.

loans.use:
purchase and re-sale of fruit and locally produced drinks

Achat et vente de fruits et de boissons locales

loans.name: Hougouhoin

texts.fr:
Born in 1982 in Djrékpoba (Prefecture of Vo), Mr. Hougouhoin T. lives and works as a barber in the same village. Unmarried and childless, he is able to meet his needs through his job. Having run into an obstacle, a lack of apprentices, his work is slowing down gradually. For his stability and job security, he is asking for a loan in order to open a barbershop and obtain work supplies. He is very confident that this job will be very profitable insofar as dealing with his difficulties.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Né en 1982 à Djrékpoba (préfecture de Vo), monsieur Hougouhoin T. vit dans le même village et exerce son métier de coiffure. Célibataire et sans enfant il arrive à répondre à ses besoins par la coiffure. Ayant remarqué un obstacle, manque d’apprenti, le métier freine son allure pas à pas. Pour sa stabilité et la mise en confiance de son boulot, il sollicite un apport financier pour ouvrir un atelier et s’équiper en matériels de travail. Il est très confiant que ce métier lui sera très rentable dans la mesure où il répond aux difficultés.

loans.use: To open a barbershop and buy work supplies

loans.name: Mabéza

texts.fr:
Mr. Mabéza E. was born on December 24, 1978 in Lomé. He is a bachelor with no children. In 2006 he opened up a center selling office supplies in the neighborhood called Agoè. He also prepares papers and photocopies. His business is doing well, especially since he is the only one to have such a venture in this neighborhood.

The loan that he is requesting will permit him to purchase 20 cartons of pre-packaged paper, 15 packages of file folders, and other office supplies.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur E. Mabéza est né le 24 décembre 1978 à Lomé. Il est célibataire sans enfants. En 2006 il a crée un centre de vente de fournitures de bureau dans le quartier d’Agoè. Il fait également les traitements de texte et des photocopies. Son activité marche bien d’autant plus qu’il est le seul à ouvrir ce centre dans le quartier.

Le crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 20 cartons de rames, 15 paquets de chemises et d’autres fournitures de bureau.

loans.use:
Purchase of office supplies

Achat des fournitures de bureau

loans.name: Komlavi

texts.fr:
Born in 1967 in Amégnran (Prefecture of Vo), Mr. .Komlavi D. lives and has a job in the same village. He is married and has one daughter. Thanks to his job, he is able to take care of his needs and those of his family. However, he is currently facing some workshop-related difficulties. For his stability and job security, he is asking for financial support to set up a fully-equipped workshop. He is very confident that this project will be very profitable insofar as allowing him to set up his workshop.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Né en 1967 à Amégnran (préfecture de Vo), monsieur Komlavi D. vit dans le même village et exerce son métier. Marié, il est père d’une fille. C’est à l’aide de ce travail qu’il arrive à prendre en charges ses besoins et ceux de sa famille. Cependant, il se confronte à des difficultés d’atelier. Pour sa stabilité et la mise en confiance de son travail, il sollicite un apport financier pour monter un atelier à l’équipement. Il est très sûr que ce projet lui sera très profitable dans la mesure où il va monter son atelier.

loans.use: To set up and equip his workshop

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Fatou S. is an old woman who has been selling crafts for over 30 years. The crafts she sells are all made by village women. Her main customers are tourists from Saint-Louis, Senegal.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Fatou S. est une vieille dame qui s’adonne au commerce d’objets d’art depuis plus de 30 ans. Ses objets sont entièrement des produits de la nature fabriqués par des villageoises. Sa principale clientèle reste les touristes venant de saint louis su Sénégal.

loans.use: Making crafts to sell to tourists

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca A. is 30 years old. She is married with 2 children, aged 15 and 9. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, beans, canned foods, evaporated milk, soap, etc in her locality. She deems the loan an opportunity to expand her shop and wants to use the loan to buy increased stocks of rice, sugar, canned foods, soap, vegetable oil, etc to serve her customers and to increase her income for her business and family. She belongs to the community group called Adomako Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral in order to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy increased stocks of rice, sugar, canned foods, soaps, vegetable oil, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a splitting machine and a plainer machine.

loans.name: Davlatbek

texts.ru:
Davlatbek J. lives in the Abdurahmoni Jomi region of Tajikistan. He is 56 years old. He is married and has 5 children. Like the large part of the population of rural locality, Davlatbek trades cattle. In order to increase his income, Davlatbek wants to purchase additional bull calves. This will help him to increase his turnover, and for this he wants to obtain a loan. He will purchase 2 or 3 additional bull calves, fatten them for about 40 days, after which he will sell them at the local market. Davlatbek intends to pay back his loan in 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Джумаев Давлатбек проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 56 лет. Он женат и имеет 5 детей. Как и большая часть населения сельской местности занимается торговлей крупно-рогатого скота. Для того , чтобы увеличить свои доходы ему необходимо купить дополнительных бычков. Это поможет ему увеличить товарооборот.Но для этого он хочет получить кредит. Он купит еще 2-3 бычков , которых будет откармливать около 40 дней , после чего будет продавать их на рынке.Погасить кредит он планирует в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase bull calves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul A. is a 25-year-old young businessman. He is single and very focused. Abdul has been a beef seller for 8 years now. He buys his supplies from Techiman, which is 50 km away, and sells to his customers. With his small working capital, he is not able to buy larger quantities to make enough income. He wants to use the loan to buy beef in bulk to serve his customers with good quality beef for their meals. He believes this will provide him with increased income to expand his business. He belongs to the community group called Butchers Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral in order to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of beef

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr:
Mrs. N. lives in the poor neighborhood of Médina Fall, in Thiès. Taking into account the distance that separates the traditional village from the city markets, she offers her customers a convenient service with her small business of selling foodstuffs and staple goods. The loan she is requesting will allow her to diversify the products she sells and better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame N. est une dame qui habite le quartier pauvre de Médina FALL de Thiès. Compte tenu de la distance qui sépare le village traditionnelle et les marchés de la ville, Elle propose aux populations des services de proximité en mettant à leurs côtés un petit commerce de produits alimentaires et de première nécessité. Le pret sollicité lui permettra de diversifier sa gamme de produits pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Increase and diversify her supply of foodstuffs

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Mr. Kodjo A. was born in 1978 in Amégnran (Vo prefecture), where he still lives and works selling lubricants, namely motor oil. He is married and has one child. Thanks to his business, he is able to meet his needs and those of his family. However, recently he has noticed a large increase in the number of customers and in the demand for lubricants, due to the great increase in the number of “Zémidjans,” or motorcycle taxis. To satisfy his customers and make his business profitable, he is requesting a loan in order to find a solution to his troubles. He is confident that this project will be very profitable and will help solve his problems.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1978 à Amégnran (préfecture de Vo), monsieur Kodjo A. vit dans le même village et exerce son commerce de vente de lubrifiant notamment les huiles à moteur. Marié, il est père d’un enfant. C’est grâce à ce commerce qu’il arrive à prendre en charge ses besoins et ceux de sa famille. Mais depuis il a constaté une forte augmentation de sa clientèle et de la demande en lubrifiant à cause de la prolifération des Zémidjan ou taxi moto. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle et rentabiliser son commerce, il sollicite un apport financier pour pouvoir trouver une solution à ses difficultés. Il est très confiant que ce projet lui sera très rentable dans la mesure où il résoudra ses problèmes.

loans.use: Purchase lubricants

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en: Aminu H. is a 40-year-old businessman. He is a husband and the father of 6 children who are currently in school. He is a retailer of beef in the local market. He buys his supplies from Techiman, which is about 50 km away, and sells to his customers. Beef is enjoyed by many Ghanaian homes because the flavour is good and it is quite affordable. With his small working capital, he is not able to buy larger quantities to make enough income. He wants to use the loan to buy beef in bulk to serve his customers with good quality beef for their meals. He believes this will provide him with increased income to expand his business and also to finance his children’s education. He belongs to the community group called Butchers Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral in order to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy beef in bulk to serve his customers

loans.name: Pouwereou Group

texts.fr:
The Pouwoereou Association was created by five energetic women who have businesses in the Agoè Kitidjan neighborhood. Their main line of business consists of making and selling local beverages. In addition, some members of the association sell cereals and vegetable oil. Their goal is to help one another. The first loan that the Pouwoereou Association just repaid allowed the group to purchase cereals when they were in season and sell them in times of high demand. These sales allowed them to quickly repay their loan, and they are now requesting a new one to purchase two bags of millet, one bag of beans, two bags of rice and three containers of vegetable oil.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

L’ Association POUWOEREOU est créée par Cinq (5) femmes dynamiques qui exercent des activités commerciales dans le quartier d’Agoè Kitidjan. Leur activité principale est la préparation et la vente boisson locale. En dehors de celle-ci, certain membre de cette association exerce le commerce de céréales et d’huile végétale. Elles se sont données comme objectif l’entraide mutuelle. Le premier crédit que l’Association POUWOEREOU vient de solder lui a permis de faire l’approvisionnement des céréales en leur période d’abondance et de les revendre en temps de pénurie. C’est ce qui leur a permis de vite rembourser et de solliciter ce nouveau crédit pour acheter 2 sacs de mil, 1 sac d’haricot 2 sacs de riz et 3 bidons d’huile végétale.

loans.use: Purchase of cereals and vegetable oil

loans.name: Imom

texts.ru:
Imom S. lives in the Abdurahmoni Jomi region of Tajikistan. He is 68 years old. He is married and has 6 children. He has been raising livestock for 30 years. In addition, Imom is also a beekeeper. He sells honey in the local market. He wants to purchase young bull calves for fattening and resale. In order to purchase calves, Imon needs to take out a loan. This will help Imom to increase his income, and make it possible to improve his family’s living conditions. Imom intends to repay his loan in 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Салохов Имом житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 68 лет. Женат и имеет 6 детей. Занимается животноводством уже 30 лет. Хочет купить маленьких бычков для откормки и перепродажи. Для этого нужны дополнительные средства. Поэтому он запланировал получить кредит. Это поможет клиенту увеличить доход, который даст возможность его семьи улучшить условия жизни.Погасить кредит клиент сможет в течении 6 месяцев. Кроме того он занимается пчеловодством и получаемый мед он реализует на рынке.

loans.use: To purchase bull calves

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard O. is a 43-year-old businessman who deals in hardware. He is married with 3 children who are currently in school. Richard is very hardworking and supportive of his family's daily needs. He sells items like radio sets, batteries, touch lights, screwdrivers, machine oil, door locks, lanterns, etc in the local market. He also provides financial support to his wife, who sells used clothes to support him and provide for the family. His dream is to build a container shop that can accommodate all his products to ease his costs and risk of theft. He wants to use the loan to buy additional products like agrochemicals and simple spraying machines to serve the farmers, who frequently demand these because the farming season has begun. Richard is a member of the community group called Confident Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral in order to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy additional products like agrochemicals and simple spraying machines

loans.name: Fidelite Group

texts.fr:
Created in 2006, the Fidelité Association brings together three women who each have a different business. Their average age is 40, and they are all married and have children. They sell cassava flour and cloth at the market in Agoè. They are currently on their fourth loan cycle from WAGES. The loan they are currently requesting will allow them to purchase seven bags of cassava flour and three rolls of cloth. With the income they will earn from selling these products, they will help pay their families’ expenses.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Créée en 2006, l’ Association FIDELITE regroupe 3 femmes qui exercent des activités commerciales différentes. L’âge moyen de ces femmes est de 40 ans. Elles sont tous mariées et mère de famille. Elles sont revendeuses de farine de manioc et de tissus dans le marché d’Agoè. Elle sont à leur 4ème cycle de prêt au près de WAGES. Le crédit qu’elles sollicitent actuellement leur permettra d’acheter 7 sacs de farine de manioc et 3 rouleaux de tissus. Avec le revenu qu’elles tirent de cette activité, elles contribuent aux dépenses de la famille.

loans.use: Purchase of cassava flour

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia S. is 33 years old. She is a wife and mother of 3 children who are currently in school. Patricia owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, etc. She is also an interior decorator with skills in room and business decorations. She wants to use the loan to buy more stock of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, etc to expand her business. She believes that with increased income, she would be more capable of financing her children’s education. She belongs to the community group called Israel Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral in order to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more stock of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, etc to expand her business

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is an entrepreneur from Zaporoshye, which is located in the south-central region of Ukraine. She is divorced and her children are all grownups. She has a small business where she sells children’s toys, board games, and sporting goods at one of the large outdoor markets in Zaporoshye. Lubov is fortunate to have an excellent location for her sales kiosk because the combination of such a good location and an attractive array of items for sale attracts many prospective customers. In a typical month Lubov generates approximately $300 of profit from her business. The income she generates from her business is not much but is sufficient to enable her to pay for her basic needs.

Lubov is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,500 Ukrainian Griven ($750) to purchase new items for the summer season and to add to her available working capital. She would like to purchase a supply of inflatable toys and sporting goods which are sure to sell well during the warmer time of year.

loans.use: To capitalize on the summer season by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., inflatable toys and sporting goods) in anticipation of warmer weather and to increase the business' available capital

loans.name: Donohol

texts.ru:
Donohol Q. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 38 years old. She is divorced and has two children. Donohol has a secondary education and was trained as an elementary school teacher. Unable to make enough money as a teacher, Donohol works as a trader. She has stall in the Tursan-zoda market where she sells fabrics. She has been in this business for 2 years. Since she is the only breadwinner of the family, she has to work a lot. Now she wants to increase her turnover. She plans to obtain a loan which will help her to increase her turnover and will allow her to increase profitability of her business. She plans to pay back her loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Кувандикова Донохол проживает в городе Турсун-Заде. Возраст 38 лет. Разведена и имеет 2 детей. Имеет среднее образование. По специальности учитель в начальной школе. Но по профессии не работает. Занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку на рынке города Турсун-заде.Торгует тканями. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 2 года. Так как она является единственным кормильцем семьи ей приходится много работать. Сейчас она хочет увеличить товарооборот. Для этого она планирует получить кредит , который сможет ей увелить товарооборот и получить больший доход от бизнеса. Погасить кредит она планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase turnover

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Adozouhoin

texts.fr:
Born in 1972 in Boko, Mrs. Adozouhoin S. lives in Avétsèdomé, in the Vo prefecture. A married mother of six children, she does small jobs and is currently stocking cereals. However, this is hardly enough to pull herself out of poverty. Her lack of capital and other obstacles are hindering her business. She is thus requesting this loan to purchase a supply of cereals and meet the growing demand of her customers. This will allow her to better meet her family’s needs as well.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1972 à BOKO, madame Adozouhoin S. réside à Avétsèdomé dans la préfecture de Vo. Mariée et mère de six (06) enfants, elle exerce le petit commerce et fait des stockages de céréales au moment venu. Mais ceci ne suffit guère pour la faire sortir de son état de pauvreté. Le manque de fonds de commerce et d’autres handicaps font entorse à ses activités. Elle sollicite donc ce crédit pour s’approvisionner en céréales et répondre aux demandes de plus en plus croissantes de sa clientèle. Ceci lui permettra de ,ieux subvenir qux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Stocking and selling cereals

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is a business owner from the town of Novyi Rozdil in western Ukraine. She is married, and she has four children under the age of eleven. Mariya began selling clothing at the market about three years ago, and she currently has a nicely-arranged and well-designed kiosk where she sells a variety of women’s clothing. She has approximately $3,000 worth of inventory on hand, and she sells approximately $2,000 worth of clothing each month.

Unfortunately, one of Mariya’s children recently experienced some medical problems. As a result, the family had to pay rather significant medical bills, which ultimately depleted much of Mariya’s business' available cash. In order to purchase new inventory, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 Ukrainian Griven ($1,075). With the loan proceeds, she will be able to purchase summer clothing so that she will be prepared with inventory for the new season.

loans.use: To prepare for the upcoming season by purchasing summer inventory

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia S. is 43 years old. She is married with 3 children who are currently attending school. It is her fervent wish to provide these children with better life opportunities through education. She owns and operates a grocery shop in one of the busy local markets with items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk, etc. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil, etc to increase her stock. She belongs to the community group called Israel Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral in order to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil, etc

loans.name: Ajara

texts.en: Ajara B. is 35 years old. She is married with 4 children who attend school. She is very supportive of her husband and helps provide for the family’s basic needs. She owns and operates a grocery shop in her local community and sells items like soap, evaporated milk, rice, canned foods, and drinks. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, cartons of milk, canned foods, and drinks to increase her stock of goods to sell. She is a member of the community group called Israel Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral in order to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, cartons of milk, canned foods, and drinks

loans.name: Shamigul

texts.ru:
Shamigul T. lives in Vahdat. She is 41 years old, is married and has 2 children. She has a secondary education. Shamigul has a small grocery store in the city market. She has this business for more than 11 years and it is the sole source of income of her family. Now, Shamigul wants to increase the variety of inventory she sells. She needs a loan to do it. She plans to pay back her loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Таварова Шамигул жительница города Вахдат .Возраст 41 год, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Клиентка имеет небольшой продуктовый магазин на рынке города Вахдат.Занимается бизнесом более 11 лет. Эта деятельность является единственным источником дохода ее семьи. Сейчас Шамигул хочет увеличить ассортимент магазина. Для чего ей нужны деньги. Клиентка решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the variety of inventory

loans.name: Agboessi

texts.fr:
Mme. Agboessi S. was born in 1970 in Avétsèdomé in the department of Vo. She now lives in the same village with her family. She is married and the mother of four (04) children, she has a little grocery shop. She has a lot of energy and is enterprising. She gives an enormous hand to her husband with the household finances and the care of the family’s needs. However her business cannot cover all her needs. Thus to revitalize and stabilize her income she is requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Née en 1970 à Avétsèdomé dans la préfecture de Vo, madame Agboessi S. vit dans le même village avec toute sa famille. Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, elle exerce le petit commerce d’alimentation générale. Elle est très dynamique et entreprenante et apporte un soutien énorme à son mari dans la gestion du foyer et la prise en charge des besoins de la famille. Mais son commerce n’arrive pas à satisfaire ses besoins. Ainsi pour le redynamiser et stabiliser son revenu, elle sollicite ce crédit.

loans.use: Supply and sale of foodstuff

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.ru:
Gulruhsor M. lives in the town of Vahdat, Tajikistan. She is 43 years old and married with 4 children. Gulruhsor has been buying and selling dried fruit for more than 10 years. She has a sale kiosk at the local market in Vuhdat. Since her husband is currently unemployed, her business is the only source of income for her large family. Gulruhsor is requesting a loan to buy dried fruit from wholesale merchants. She plans to repay the loan in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer

Маликова Гулрухсор жительница города Вахдат. Возраст 43 года, замужем ,имеет 4 детей.Гулрухсор занимается куплей продажей сухофруктами.Она имеет торговую точку на местном рынке города Вахдат.Занимается этой деятельностью более 10 лет. Бизнес является единственным источником дохода ее большой семьи. Так как муж клиентки временно не работает.В данный момент Гулрухсор хочет закупить у оптовых поставщиков товар.Для чего ей нужны деньги и она решила взять кредит сроком на 10 месяцев.

loans.use: to increase the assortment

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Hounzouhoin

texts.fr:
Mme. Hounzouhoin D. is 70 years old, married and the mother of one child. Despite her ripe old age, her energy shines in her activities. She sells second-hand clothes from market to market. The income she derives allows her to provide for her personal needs as well as those of the family, her husband being so old. In order to increase her income and revitalize her business, she is requesting a loan that will allow her to provide for her needs.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 70 ans, madame Hounzouhoin D. est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Malgré son âge avancé, elle montre un dynamisme à travers ses activités. Elle vend des friperies de marché en marché et le revenu qu’elle tire lui permet de subvenir à ses propres besoins et à ceux de la famille, tant son mari est vieux. Afin d’accroître son revenu et redynamiser son commerce elle sollicite un crédit, qui lui permettra de subvenir plus à ses besoins.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Sissi

texts.fr:
Mme. Sissi A. was born in 1965 in Koutidji. She lives with her husband in Avétsèdomé in the department of Vo. She is married and the mother of six (06) children. Her main activity is the sale of essential foodstuff. The income she derives from this activity allows her to contribute to the budget of the household. But this income is far from meeting the needs of the family, where poverty continues to rule. To improve her income and her living conditions, she is requesting this loan.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Née en 1965 à Koutidji, madame Sissi A. vit auprès de son mari à Avétsèdomé dans la préfecture de Vo. Elle est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants. Sa principale activité est la vente des produits alimentaires de première nécessité. Le revenu qu’elle tire de cette activité lui permet de participer à la gestion de son ménage. Mais ce revenu est très loin se satisfaire les besoins de sa famille où la misère continue par régner. Pour améliorer son revenu et ses conditions de vie, elle sollicite ce crédit.

loans.use: Stocking and sale of food products

loans.name: Richmond

texts.en: Richmond L. is 25 years old. He is single and enjoys trading. He is a retailer of engine oil, break fluid, and other spare car parts. He buys his supplies from oil filling station operators in barrels and sells in smaller quantities to his customers. He is handicapped by low working capital since the oil price has gone up. He therefore needs the loan to remain in business. He wants to use the loan to buy additional barrels of engine oil, gallons of break fluid, and scraps to serve his customers. He believes this will enable him to make a good income from his business. He is a member of the community group called Ezekiel Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral in order to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy additional barrels of engine oil, gallons of break fluid, and scraps

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is a 37-year-old woman. She is married with 5 children who are currently in school. She is a food vendor and sells banku. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains, and it is eaten with hot pepper or soup. She has many customers since banku is enjoyed by many Ghanaians as breakfast, lunch, and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She hopes to raise her income to support her children’s education. She belongs to the community group called Ezekiel Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral in order to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence A. is a 30-year-old woman. She is a wife and the mother of 4 children who attend school. She is a serious-minded businesswoman who works hard to support her husband and provide for her family. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. She deems it an opportunity to expand her business and wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc to increase her stock of goods available for sale. Mary belongs to the community group called Ezekiel Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral in order to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: Constance N. is 25 years old. She is married with 1 child. She owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood. Constance is very skillful and a talented hair dresser who adds a lot of beauty to the hair of her many customers, and that is her secret. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service; therefore, she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weaves, pomade, shampoo, activators, etc to avoid shortages and poor service. She is a member of the community group called Ezekiel Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral in order to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products like weaves, pomade, shampoo, activators, etc

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian N. is a 24-year-old woman. She is single and independent. She sells soft drinks and bottled ice kenkey to the community’s manual workers in the afternoons. Bottled ice kenkey is prepared by boiling milled maize grains and then mixing it with sugar and milk and refrigerating it. It is enjoyed with bread or meat pie, and many Ghanaian manual workers enjoy it as lunch. Vivian wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize, sugar, and soft drinks to increase her sales and make more income. She is a member of the community group called Ezekiel Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral in order to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize, sugar, and soft drinks

loans.name: Dioulayel 2 Group

texts.fr:
After our first loan which we were able to completely reimburse in a timely manner, we would like to request another loan from Kiva to continue to work as we began to do a year ago. Our work consists in engaging in petty trading to sustain our families, and thanks to the loan that we received from SEM, we have even been able to put aside some savings after having made our repayments.You are the only lenders who have helped us to work normally, without constraints. This is the reason why we would like to renew the loan you had granted us.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Suite au premier prêt que nous sommes parvenues à rembourser intégralement et dans les delais, nous sommes venues solliciter un autre prêt auprès de Kiva pour continuer à travailler comme nous l'avions commencé, il y a un an. Notre travail consiste à faire du petit commerce pour soutenir nos familles et grâce au prêt que nous avions reçu de SEM, nous arrivons même à faire des économies après avoir rembourser. Vous êtes les seuls bailleurs qui nous ont aidé à travailler normalement sans contrainte. c'est pour cela que nous souhaitons renouveler le prêt que vous nous aviez accordé.

loans.use:
purchase of household necessities and foodstuffs

achat de produits domestiques et alimentaires.

loans.name: Khelcom 2 A Group

texts.fr: Our ecovillage is located in an area frequented by tourists who all go to a town very far away from our ecovillage to connect to the internet. The same thing happens with the young people in our village who also go to the town looking to connect to the internet. Since there is great demand for the internet, we would like to ask for your help in creating a cybercafé in the village which would fill the current gap in information technology in our area. Ever since our village got wired for electricity and connected to the telephone network, we have been looking to open a cybercafé, not only in order to create jobs, but to take part in the development of our locality by allowing the populace access to information via modern communication technology. For this reason we have established two groups, each having the same objective. Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteerNotre écovillage se trouve dans une zone touristique qui voit toutes les personnes qui y viennent se  rendre dans une ville très éloignée de notre écovillage pour se connecter à Internet. c'est la même situation qui se répète pour les jeunes du village qui empruntent la même voie pour avoir accès à une connection. La demande étant très forte à ce sujet, nous venons solliciter votre appui afin que nous puissions créer un cybercafé dans le village et permettant ainsi de combler le gap numérique qui existait dans les environs. Depuis que notre village est connecté aux réseaux électrique et téléphonique, nous oeuvrons dans le sens de créer un cybercafé pour non seulement créer des emplois, mais participer aussi au développement de notre localité en aidant les populations à avoir accès à l'information avec les nouvelles technologies de comunication modernes. pour cela nous nous sommes constitués en deux groupement avec chacun le même objectif.

loans.use: Purchase of computers and other equipment for cybercafeAchat d'ordinateurs et équipements pour cybercafé

loans.name: Mujeres De Valor Group

texts.en:
Roseline is an outgoing and lively 26 year old woman who lives with her husband and two children (ages: 7, 10) in the community of Agua Negra (Black Water). Agua Negra is nestled inside the biggest port on the North Coast of the DR, with several ships coming in and out every day. Roseline and her husband have two of their nieces living with them, and they can barely afford the basic necessities. With this loan Roseline will replenish her clothing and shoe supply, and continue selling them from her home. In the future she wants to own a house and expand her business.

Thank you for supporting these women!
