loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes for retail.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia Z. D. C. is a busy business woman in the town of Mache high in the mountains of the Libertad region. Her family owns some land where they raise different animals such as pigs, cows, and chickens to sell at local markets. They also own two vans that they use as taxis to shuttle people to and from Mache and the capital of the region, Trujillo.

Julia is 51 years old, married, and has 4 children. She loves working with her family and spending time with her children. She loves building relationships and working hard to improve her family’s future.

A member of the community bank Mujeres D. Mache, Julia is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN to repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to buy feed and vaccines for her animals.

loans.use: To buy feed and vaccines for her animals

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor belongs to the Las Dalinas 2 Communal Bank, located in Market #5 in the Calleria District of the Department of Ucayali. She is 37 years old and a mother of three; her husband is an electrician. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles, Flor decided to invest in a business to sell miscellaneous household and sewing items.

Today, Flor owns a stand in one of the markets of our city. Each day, before opening her stand, she prepares breakfast for her children, drops them off at school, then goes to work. In the evening, she helps her kids with their homework and talks to her husband about what happened during their respective days.

With this loan of 800 soles, which will be paid back within 6 months, Flor will buy rubber bands, glue, underwear, silk lace, notebooks, zippers, buttons, cosmetics, needles, etc.

Flor wants to provide her children with the best. She believes it is very important to grow a bit each day in order to continue to improve as an entrepreneur and a working woman.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

La señora Flor pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Dalinas 2, ubicado en el Mercado N° 3, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es técnico electricista, es así que Flor con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de pasamanería.

En la actualidad tiene un puesto de venta en uno de los mercados de nuestra ciudad, antes de irse a abrir su puesto prepara el desayuno de sus hijos los lleva al colegio y de ahí se dirige a trabajar, por las noches ayuda a sus hijos a hacer sus tareas, conversa con su esposo lo que les paso durante el día.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: elásticos, pegamentos, ropa interior, blondas, papelotes, cuadernos, cierres, botones, cosméticos, agujas, etc.

Flor quiere brindar lo mejor a sus hijos, para ella es muy importante seguir creciendo cada día mas para seguir mejorando como empresaria y mujer trabajadora.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.en:
Martina is a lively 30-year-old woman who lives with her husband (Luis Manuel) and her three children (ages 11, 9 and 4) in the community of Los Dominquez. With the money from this loan, she will start a business selling undergarments for women. She will start by selling them from her home, but eventually it’s her dream to sell them from a store. Martina has lived in Los Dominquez for 10 years but still is only able to afford to rent a very small home. Her dreams for the future are to buy her own house, and to have her kids go to university.

Thank you for your support!

loans.use: To buy undergarments for retail sale.

loans.name: Gilma

texts.es:
Señora Gilma lives in the Calleria District of Ucayali Department, and belogs to the Damas del Oriente Comunal Bank. She is 50 years old and has 6 children. Her husband is a professor but his income is not enough to cover the monthly costs of keeping a home, so Gilma invested her first Manuela Ramos loan of 300 Soles in opening a beauty salon. Now she gets up every morning at 7am to make breakfast for her husband and children, then goes to her beauty salon to see clients until 9pm. With a loan of 1,000 Soles Gilma will buy beauty products in large quantities, including hair dyes, gels, permanents, combs, scissors, hairsprays, conditioners, and others. She will repay the loan in 4 months. Gilma plans ahead and hopes to succeed in her business in order to ensure the wellbeing of her family. She feels truly happy because her business and earnings continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gilma pertenece al Banco Comunal Damas del Oriente, ubicado en el Jr Libertad No 775 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 50 años y es madre de 6 hijos, su esposo es Profesor, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuenta no son suficientes para los gastos mensuales, es así que Gilma con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña peluquería. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un salón de belleza, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, de allí se dirige a su local para abrirlo y atender a sus clientes hasta las 9 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza, tintes, líquidos, permanentes, peines, tijeras, lacas, reacondicionadores, etc. Gilma se proyecta al futuro y solo espera triunfo en su vida y en su negocio para el bienestar de su familia, se siente realmente feliz por que su negocio crece cada día mas y sus ganancias también.

loans.use: Gilma will use the loan to buy products for her salon.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Señora Elva lives in the Yarina District of the Ucayali department, and belongs to the Mujeres con Futuro Comunal Bank. Elva is 63 years old and separated, but her income isn’t enough to support her family of 8 children. When Elva received her first loan of 300 Soles from Manuela Ramos, she started a business selling local fruits. Now she sells fruit from her home, which has the advantage of allowing her to take care of her home and children while running her business. At night she asks her children how they’re doing in school and helps them with their homework. With a loan of 1,000 soles, Elva will buy fruits like: plantains, coconuts, sweet peppers, mandarin oranges, and candies, and sodas. Elva is very happy with the loans that she’s received because they’ve helped her save and given her good terms. She hopes to continue to receive support to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elva pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres con Futuro, ubicado en el Jr. José Olaya Mz. Ñ Lt. 10, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 63 años y es madre de 8 hijos, es separada, pero los ingresos con los que cuenta no alcanzan para mantener a su familia. Elva con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de frutas regionales. En la actualidad vende sus frutas en la puerta de su casa, le da muchas ventajas por que así puede atender su casa y a sus hijos que aun depende de ella, por las noches les pregunta a sus hijos que tal les ha ido en su escuela y les ayuda a ser sus tareas. Con este préstamo de S/.1, 000 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará frutas regionales como: plátanos, coconas, ají dulce, mandarina, golosinas, gaseosas. Elva esta muy feliz es una gran ayuda los prestamos, por que la ayudan a ahorrar, las facilidades que le dan son muy buenas, y espera que la sigan apoyando para seguir creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Elva will use the loan to buy merchandise for her store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Señora Karina lives in the Calleria District of the Ucayali Department and belongs to the Mujeres Coraje Communal Bank. She is 37 years old and has three children. Karina’s husband is a merchant, but his income alone isn’t enough to support their family. Because of this, Karina decided to invest her first Manuela Ramos loan of 300 Soles in a business selling homemade meals. Now she has a trolley where she sells sausages and fries, hamburgers, and roasted chicken. In the mornings Karina cares for her daughters and her home, and leaves to sell her food at night. She’s very popular with her clients. With a loan of 1,500 Soles Karina will buy: disposable plates, eggs, meats, sodas, flour, potatoes, vegetables, and other supplies. She’s very grateful for the loans that she’s received from Manuela Ramos, because they’ve given her the opportunity to work hard and get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Karina pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Coraje, ubicado en el Jr 1° de Mayo 650,del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero los ingresos con los que cuenta no alcanzan para mantener a su familia, es así que Karina con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de salchipapas. En la actualidad ella tiene un carrito salchipapero que con los prestamos recibidos pudo comprar, ahora también vende hamburguesas, pollo brosther, por las mañanas atiende a sus hijas y su hogar, en las noches sale a vender, y tiene mucha aceptación por sus clientes. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: platos descartables, huevos, carnes, gaseosas, harina, papas, verduras, etc. Karina esta muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por los prestamos brindados, le dio la oportunidad de invertir y poder trabajar para salir adelante.

loans.use: With the loan, Karina wil purchase supplies to make her products.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Señora Juana lives in the Calleria District of the Ucayali Department, and belongs to the Damas del Oriente Comunal Bank. She is 58 years old and the mother of 5 children. Her husband is a merchant, and when Juana received her first loan of 300 Soles from Manuela Ramos she decided to invest in a clothing business. Now she sells a variety of products. She gets up every morning at 7am to make breakfast for her husband and children, and then works delivering and collecting payment for her products until 6pm. With a loan of 1,000 Soles Juana will buy: skirts, blouses, undergarments, pants, shirts, etc. She’ll pay back the loan in 4 months. Juana would like to get ahead and to see her business succeed so that she can support her family. Juana is happy to consider herself an independent woman as a result of her successful business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal Damas del Oriente, ubicado en el Mercado No 2 sección ropas del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 58 años y es madre de 5 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, es así que Juana con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de compra y venta de ropas. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de mercadería, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, de allí se dedica a la entrega y cobranza de su mercadería a sus clientes hasta las 6 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: faldas, blusas, prendas interiores, pantalones, camisas, etc. Juana posee muchas ganas de salir adelante y de seguir surgiendo en la vida para poder apoyar a su familia en los gastos del hogar pues esta contenta por que se siente una mujer independiente en cuanto a su negocio se refiere.

loans.use: Juana will use the loan to buy merchandise.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Julia Nansy

texts.es:
Señora Juliana belongs to the Las Brisas Comunal Bank, in the Calleria District of the Ucayali Department. She is 38 years old and the mother of three children. Juliana is separated from her husband. When Juliana received her first loan of 300 Soles from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in a business selling groceries. Now she leaves early each morning to sell homemade meals, oil, detergent, smoothies, cleaning supplies, cologne, and other products in large and small quantities. Juliana spends her nights caring for her children. With a loan of 700 Soles, Juliana will buy 1 case of oil, 2 cases of soap, detergent and plates. She’ll pay back the loan in 4 months. Juliana is happy that her income is increasing now that she sells large quantities. She can now enjoy the level of economic stability that she’s always wanted.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juliana pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Brisas, ubicado en el Jr. Antonio Maya de Britto 333, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 38 años, es madre de 3 hijos, es separada. Juliana con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la compra y venta de abarrotes. En la actualidad ella sale muy temprano para ofrecer sus productos que son platos, aceite, tazas, detergente, licuadora, talcos, colonias, al por mayor y menor, en las noches atiende a sus hijos. Con este préstamo de S/. 700 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 1 caja de aceite, 2 cajas de jabón, detergente, platos. Juliana esta muy feliz por que sus ganancias aumentan, ahora vende al por mayor, puede gozar de una estabilidad económica que siempre quiso tener.

loans.use: Juliana will buy merchandise with the loan.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Moise

texts.fr:
Mr. Moïse L. was born in 1965 in the village of Avétsèdomé where he currently lives. Mr. L. is the father of five (05) children. He is a courageous man who fights to provide for the needs of his family. He works, by himself, in agriculture, breeding, and small trades. However, he does not escape poverty and he constantly faces the problem of stock. His short term project is to stock and sell corn, for this he is requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Moïse L. est né en 1965 dans le village d’Avétsèdomé où il vit actuellement. Père de cinq (05) enfants, monsieur L. est un brave homme qui se bat pour assurer et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il exerce lui seul l’agriculture, l’élevage et le petit commerce. Toutefois, il n’échappe pas à la misère et il se confronte énormément au problème de fonds de commerce. Son projet à court terme est le stockage et la vente de maïs pour lequel il sollicite ce crédit.

loans.use: Purchase, stocking and sale of corn

loans.name: Banco Mujeres De Paciencia Group

texts.en:
Y. is a bright 29-year-old woman who lives with her husband, Eliberto, and her two children (ages seven and one) in the small community of La Cienaga. With this loan she will begin selling shoes on the street, walking from place to place for almost 10 hours a day. She is excited for the extra income her new business will generate because it is very difficult to depend only on her husband. When she is not working or taking care of her children she enjoys relaxing and watching TV at a local grocery store. In the future Y. wants to buy a house for her family to live in and wants to send her kids to a good school.

Thank you for your support!

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Karin

texts.es:
Karin lives in the Calleria District of the Ucayali Department, and belongs to the Damas del Oriente Comunal Bank. Karin is 31 years old and has three children. Her husband works in security but his income isn’t enough to cover the family’s expenses, so Karin used her first loan from Manuela Ramos to begin selling perfumes and clothing. Now Karin wakes up at 7am to make breakfast for her family, then delivers beauty products for her business until 5pm. With a loan of 700 soles Karin will buy large quantities of perfumes and other beauty products. She’ll repay the loan in 4 months. Karin works tirelessly in order to achieve the objectives that she has set for herself regarding the wellbeing of her family. Karin’s greatest wish is to give her children everything that they need as she watches them grow up.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Karin pertenece al Banco Comunal Damas del Oriente, ubicado en el Psj Cleto Martínez No 100 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 31 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es Seguridad, pero los ingresos económicos que tiene no le alcanza para su economía familiar, es así que Karin con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de perfumería y venta de ropas. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de productos de bellezas, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, luego se dedica al reparto de sus productos a sus clientes hasta las 5 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 700 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará mayor cantidad de perfumes y otros productos de belleza. Karin esta trabajando de manera incansable para lograr los objetivos trazados por ella misma para el bienestar de su familia, su mayor anhelo es ver crecer a sus hijos dándoles lo que necesitan.

loans.use: Karin will use the loan to buy merchandise.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ligia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Señora G. has received six loans from our institution over the past three years, which she has used to invest in her business. She raises her family with this business. She is a single mother and her daughter is currently in medical school. She wants to diversify her business and be able to offer more and better products. Apart from her business, she also works as a secretary.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

La señora G. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace unos tres años donde ha manejado seis creditos los que ha utilizado para capital de trabajo, cabe destacar que con el negocio ella mantiene su familia tiene una hija la que estudia medicina en la universidad es madre soltera, su sueño es diversificar mas su negocio y poder ofertar mas y mejores productos, adeñas ella trabaja como secretaria.

loans.use: Invest in clothing and cosmetic supplies

loans.name: Sodoadika

texts.fr:
Mr. Sodoadika L. was born in 1952 in Avétsèdomé in the department of Vo. He is married and is responsible for his eight (08) children. He is a shopkeeper and opened a small grocery store allowing him to provide for his family’s needs. But to secure his income and to fulfill efficiently his role as the head of the household, he needs to get a regular supply for his store. To this end he is requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Sodoadika L. est né en 1952 à Avétsèdomé dans la préfecture de Vo. Marié, il est père de huit (08) enfants qu’il prend en charge. Il est commerçant et a ouvert une boutique d’alimentation générale qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Mais pour sécuriser son revenu et jouer efficacement son rôle de chef de famille, il a besoin de ravitailler régulièrement sa boutique. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un financement.

loans.use: Buying supplies for a grocery shop

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa belongs to the Women with a Future Community Bank, located in Jr. Callao 172, in the Calleria District in Ucayali, Peru. She is a 58 year old working mother of three, but her income doesn’t meet the needs of her family, so Josefa decided to start a small grocery with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos.

She gets up early to take care of the business and converse with her clients. Running the business out of her home makes it easier to also take care of the house and children.

With this loan of $450, which she will repay in 6 months, Josefa will buy: 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, salt, oil, milk, soap, vegetables, etc.

Josefa is grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing for the growth of her business and her self-esteem.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Josefa pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres con Futuro, ubicado en el Jr. Callao 172, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 58 años, es madre D. 3 hijos, es obrero, pero los ingresos con los que cuenta no alcanzan para mantener a su familia, es así que Josefa con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega.

En la actualidad se levanta muy temprano para atender su negocio, se entretiene mucho conversando con sus clientes, tener el negocio en su casa le facilita muchas cosas como cuidar su hogar y atender a sus hijos.

Con este préstamo D. S/.1, 200 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: 1 saco D. arroz, 1 saco D. azúcar, sal, aceite, leche, jabón, conservas verduras, etc.

Josefa siente muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por todo lo brindado para el crecimiento D. su negocio y su autoestima.

loans.use: Merchandise to sell

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
Lucinda belongs to the Las Laboriosas Community Bank 2, located in la Calle Caballo Cocha 127, in the Calleria District in Ucayali, Peru. She is a 24 year-old mother of 2 children. Her husband is a mechanic. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to start selling beauty products.

Now she continues her business, and in the mornings she tidies her house, prepares food, and takes her kids to school. In the afternoon, she sells her products at other households.

With this loan of $300, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy cologne, perfume, lipstick, powder, jewelry, nail polish, mascara, etc.

Lucinda is grateful to Manuela Ramos for giving women the opportunity to start their own businesses, and to move forward for their well-being and the well-being of the ones they love the most.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lucinda pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Laboriosas 2, ubicado en la Calle Caballo Cocha 127, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 24 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es mecánico, es así que Lucinda con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de productos de belleza.

En la actualidad continua con sus negocio, para ellos por las mañanas asea su casa, prepara su comida y lleva a sus hijas a su escuela, por la tardes se dedica a ofrecer sus productos a domicilio y a la vez cobra los créditos que deja a sus clientas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: colonias, perfumes, labiales, sombras, talcos, joyas, esmaltes, rimel, etc.

Lucinda esta agradecida a Manuela Ramos por que da oportunidad a las mujeres de poner su propio negocio y salir adelante para el bien de nosotras y las personas que mas quieren.

loans.use: Merchandise for sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia belongs to the Women with a Future Community Bank, located in the Jr. Salvador Allende 759, in the Yarina Cocha District in Ucayali, Peru. She is a 54 year-old mother of 6 children. Her husband is a businessman. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to start selling juices and breakfast.

She rises very early to open her shop and attend to clients, who at early hours, come to drink delicious juice and prepared food. In the afternoons she rests and gets ready for the next day of hard work.

With this loan of $925, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy: papayas, platanos, eggs, milk, oranges, apples, sugar, and provisions for breakfast.

Lidia is in a calm stage of life. Her children are independent, and work has made her feel useful, happy, and thankful to the group formed at the community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lidia pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres con Futuro, ubicado en el Jr. Salvador Allende 759, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 54 años, es madre de 6 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Lidia con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de jugos y desayunos.

En la actualidad ella se levanta muy temprano para abrir su local y atender a sus clientes que desde tempranas horas acuden para tomar los ricos jugos y comidas que prepara, por las tardes descansa para la ardua jornada que le espera el día siguiente.

Con este préstamo de S/.2,500.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará como: papayas, plátanos, huevos, leche, algarrobina, naranja, manzanas, azúcar, víveres para sus desayunos.

Lidia esta en una etapa de su vida que se siente muy tranquila, sus hijos ya son independientes, trabajar la hace sentirse mas útil, feliz, y gracias al grupo que formo con su banco comunal se siente muy feliz..

loans.use: Provisions for food preparation

loans.name: Lizarda

texts.es:
Lizarda belongs to the Women with a Future Community Bank, located in Jr. Arenal 1210, in the Calleria District in Ucayali, Peru. She is a widowed 65 year-old mother of 6 children. Her income was not enough to meet the needs of her family, so with a loan from Manuela Ramos, she decided to start a small store selling frozen drinks.

She sells soda from her house, attending the store all day and also taking care of the house. Her children are grown and independent, but she loves when her grandchildren visit her, and she gets distracted by them.

With this loan of $750, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy: sodas of different prices and sizes, and will remoD. her house to make a better business environment.

Lizarda is an example of a working woman who, in spite of her age, keeps moving forward. Since she was young she has worked hard, and it has made her feel more independent. By making her own money, she could take care of her needs.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lizarda pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres con Futuro, ubicado en el Jr. Arenal 1210, D. Distrito de Calleria D. Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 65 años, es madre de 6 hijos, es viuda, pero los ingresos con los que cuenta no alcanzan para mantener a su familia, es así que Lizarda con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega de venta de bebidas heladas.

En la actualidad como todos sus hijos ya son independientes, ella vende sus gaseosas en su casa, atiende todo el día y también se dedica al aseo de su hogar, y disfruta mucho cuando sus nietos van a visitarla, se distrae mucho con ellos.

Con este préstamo de S/.2, 000 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: gaseosas de diferentes precios, tamaños, golosinas, y remodelo su casa para tener un ambiente mas amplio.

Lizarda es un ejemplo de mujer trabajadora, a pesar de su edad ella sigue adelante, desde que era joven siempre trabajo, la hacia sentirse mas independiente y así tener su capital para poderlo invertirlo.

loans.use: Merchandise to sell

loans.name: Aloumouvi

texts.fr:
Mr. Aloumouvi E. was born in 1986 in the department of Vo, he still lives in the same village where he is a trader. He is married and the father of four (04) children. Thanks to the lubrication oil he is selling, he is able to provide for the needs of his family. However, since he noticed an increase in his clientele, his trade has waned considerably. For his stability, and for his clientele to feel confident in him, he is requesting financing to remedy his difficulties. He is very confident that this project will be very profitable and he will be able to solve his problems.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Né en 1986 à Atsansi dans la préfecture de Vo, monsieur Aloumouvi E. vit dans le même village et exerce son métier de commerce. Marié, il est père de quatre (04) enfants. C’est grâce à son commerce de lubrifiants qu’il arrive à prendre en charge ses besoins et ceux de sa famille. Mais depuis qu’il a constaté une augmentation de sa clientèle, son commerce a considérablement déchu. Pour sa stabilité et la mise en confiance de sa clientèle, il sollicite un financement pour pouvoir remédier ses difficultés. Il est très confiant que ce projet lui sera très rentable dans la mesure où il pourra résoudre ses problèmes.

loans.use: Buying a supply of lubrication oil

loans.name: Rigoberto José

texts.es:
Rigoberto López is 28 years old. He is a entrepreneur that owns a small, home-based convenience store that sells basic products. He is single and has two young daughters, ages 7 and 4. The convenience store is run by his mother and it has been owned for 5 years. His future plans include converting the convenience store into a small market and remodeling his house in order to turn it into a place where he could live with dignity. The loan requested will be used to purchase basic grains and cleaning products since he has small amounts of them left.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Rigoberto López es un joven de 28 años, es un pequeño comerciante que tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, en la cual vende productos básicos. Es soltero, tiene 2 pequeñas niñas de 7 y 4 años de edad. La pulpería de Rigoberto es administrada por su madre, tiene 5 años de tenerla, y sus planes futuros es llegar a convertirla en una miscelanea, al mismo tiempo que desea remodelar su casa para llegar a tener una casa digna. El préstamo lo requiere para comprar granos básicos y productos de limpieza ya que actualemnte cuenta con poca existencia de estos productos.

loans.use: Purchase basic grains and cleaning products.

loans.name: Rey David

texts.es:
Mr. Rey David is a security guard and a resident of the town of Memorial Sandino. He has been employed for 4 years and during this time he has made improvements to his house little by little. Although there is still a lot that needs to be done -- the floor is composed of dirt and the walls are built with Nicalit (pressed sheets of asbestos, cement and cellulose). He needs this loan to build a small bedroom because, at the present time, the house has only one and it is very uncomfortable for his 4 children and wife. He believes this additional bedroom will provide more comfort to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Don Rey David es un guarda de seguridad, que habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, tiene 4 años de estabilidad laboral y durante ese tiempo ha venido mejorndo su casa poco a poco, aunque todavia le falta mucho ya que el piso de su casa es de tierra y las paredes son de nicalit. Necesita el préstamo para hacer un pequeño cuarto, ya que actualemnte la casa sólo tiene uno, y para sus 4 hijos y su esposa se hace muy díficil el poder acomodarse. Con este cuarto espera darle más comodidad a su familia.

loans.use: Build a small bedroom.

loans.name: Llerme

texts.es:
Llerma belongs to the Ladies of the Orient Community Bank, located in Jr. Libertad No 820 in the Calleria District in the Ucayali Department. She is the 40 year-old mother of 3 children. Her husband is a farmer, but the income is not enough to cover the costs of the family, so with the first loan that Llerme received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to start a small salon.

She wakes up at 7 am to cook breakfast for her children and husband, and to go open her beauty shop and attends to clients until 5 pm.

With this loan of $375, she will buy hair dye, nails, hair cutting supplies, hair settings (perms), hairdryers, etc.

Llerme is very pleased that she is achieving her dream and now can support her children and costs of her home. She is thankful for the support provided by Manuela Ramos for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Llerme pertenece al Banco Comunal Damas del Oriente, ubicado en el Jr Libertad No 820 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es agricultor, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuenta no son suficientes para los gastos familiares, es así que Llerme con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña peluquería.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un local de belleza, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, de allí abre su local de belleza para atender a sus clientes hasta las 5 pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: tintes, lacas, maquina para cortar pelo, fijadores, secadores de cabello, etc.

Llerme se siente muy contenta pues esta logrando cumplir sus sueños ahora puede apoyar a sus hijos y en los gastos de su hogar, esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Products for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Adesatu

texts.en:
Adesatu is married and has one child. She is pictured above standing in front of her new store. She sells beans, gari (milled cassava), millet, maize, peanuts, and other food items. Adesatu has run her business for about four years now. She treks to the northern part of Ghana to buy her products and then sells them in town to other market women in the same business.

She wants to use her loan to buy more bags of cereals in case of future price hikes. She believes this loan will also help her complete her store so that she can store her products. Adesatu is a member of a group called Odwanwhefo Pa ("The Good Shepherd"). Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals to sell and finish building her store.

loans.name: Candida Del Rosario

texts.es:
Señora Candida del Rosario M. has had nine loans approved with our institution over the past four years. She is married and has a daughter. Her business is a small food stand located by the company ENITEL, where her husband works. Candida sells soft drinks, juices, sandwiches, snacks and more. She will use the credit to expand her inventory and have a greater variety of food to offer. She has a lot of regular customers who work at the company, so this loan will help her improve sales.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Candida del Rosario M. trabaja con nosotros desde hace unos cuatro años con nuestra institución manejando nueve creditos, ella tiene una hija la que vive con ella y ya esta casada, Su negocio es un cafetin ubicado en ENITEL este negocio lo adquirio a traves de su esposo quien trabaja en esta empresa, ella vende gaseosas, jugos, frescos, sandwish, golosinas y otros, El credito lo utiliza para la compra de inventario y ofertar mas productos, ya que en esta empresa donde esta ubicado el cafetin existen muchos trabajadores que son sus clientes, por lo que el prestamo le permite mejorar sus ventas.

loans.use: Invest in her food stand: soft drinks, bread, juice, desserts.

loans.name: Claudia Estela

texts.es:
Ms. Claudia S. is a 36-year-old single mother of a 9-year old son, for whom she works so hard everyday because she wants to provide him with an education. They live in the Hialeah neighborhood in the city of Managua. She has 5 years of experience in her business. She used to be a street vendor, but after much effort, she was able to set up a general store. Her plans are to continue working arduously so that she can increase both her inventory and sales. She needs this loan in order to replace the roof of her general store because winter is approaching and she wants to prevent leaks.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Claudia tiene 36 años de edad, habita en el barrio Hialeah de Managua, es soltera y tiene un pequeño hijo de 9 años de edad, por el que ella trabaja fuertemente todos los días, ya que quiere darle estudios a su pequeño. Tiene 5 años de experiencia en su negocio, antes era una vendedora ambulante pero con mucho esfuerzo pudo poner su pulpería, sus planes son seguir trabajando arduamente para poder tener más inventario y más volumen de ventas. Necesita el préstamo para cambiar el techo de su plupería ya que el invierno se acerca y no quiere que se le meta el agua al negocio.

loans.use: Replace roof of general store

loans.name: Lastenia

texts.es:
Lastenia belongs to the Women with a Future Community Bank, located in Jr. Jose Olaya Mz. O Lt. 27, in the Yarina Cocha District in Ucayali, Peru. She is 65 years old, has 5 children, and is separated from her spouse. The income doesn’t meet the costs of the family, so with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, Lastenia decided to start selling material.

She offers her materials door-to-door and in homes, though she also has fixed clients with whom she works with very well, as they know of what good products she carries. Her children are independent, but they are always looking out for her.

With this loan of $1,000, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy materials of different colors and designs.

Lastenia feels good to be working with her community bank, and is moving forward for her own well-being and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lastenia pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres con Futuro, ubicado en el Jr. José Olaya Mz. O Lt. 27, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 65 años, es madre de 5 hijos, es separada, pero los ingresos con los que cuenta no alcanzan para mantener a su familia, es así que Lastenia con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la compra y venta de telas.

En la actualidad ella ofrece sus telas en forma domiciliaria, aunque tiene también sus clientes fijos con los que lleva trabajando muy bien, saben de las facilidades que deja sus telas y el buen producto que son, sus hijos ya son independientes, pero siempre están pendiente de ella.

Con este préstamo de S/.2,700 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: telas de diferentes colores y diseños.

Lastenia siente muy tranquila por trabajar con su banco comunal, esta saliendo adelante por su bienestar de ella y su familia.

loans.use: Merchandise to sell

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr:
Born in 1967 in Amégnran (Vo prefecture), Edoh A. lives in the same village where he practices his trade as a taxi driver. Married and the father of one child, he manages to support himself and his family, thanks to his trade. A very energetic individual, he deserves another car because of the quality of his performance. And so, he is applying for financial support to acquire a car in order to loyaly serve his customers. He is very confident that this project will be highly profitable, to the extent that he will change out his car.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Né en 1967 à Amégnran dans la préfecture de Vo, monsieur Edoh A. vit dans le même village où il exerce son métier de conducteur de taxi. Marié et père d’un enfant, il arrive à prendre en charge ses besoins et ceux de sa famille grâce à son métier. Très dynamique, la qualité de ses prestations lui valait un changement de voiture. Ainsi, il sollicite un apport financier pour l’acquisition d’une voiture afin de servir loyalement sa clientèle. Il est très confiant que ce projet lui sera très rentable dans la mesure où il changera de voiture.

loans.use: Taxi purchase

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 37 years old and the mother of four children. two of whom are in school. She sells baby products, like diapers, towels, and creams, and also she sells soft drinks, cocoa products, uncooked rice, and fresh eggs. Cecilia offers such a wide range of products in order to increase her income, help provide for the family, and pay for the children’s education.

She wants to use her loan to buy more baby products to sell so that she can increase sales. Cecilia is a member of the group called Christ Nti ("Because of Christ"). Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy baby products to sell, such as diapers and towels.

loans.name: Zulay

texts.es:
Señora Zulay belongs to the Breezes Communal Bank, located at 242 Jr. Seraph Filomeno of the Calleria District of the Department of Ucayali. She is 27 years old and the mother of 1 son. She is separated. With the first loan received of Manuela Branches of 300 soles Zulay decided to invest in a chicken sale business.

Currently she counts on the chicken sale business. She rises at 7 o'clock am to prepare the breakfast of her son and husband. From there she goes to her sales position in the market to sell her chickens until 3 pm.

With this loan of 1500 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 30 chickens for her business and to increase her sales.

Zulay is a hard-working woman always doing well to be able to raise her son and to offer him everything that she never had.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Zulay pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Brisas, ubicado en el Jr. Serafín Filomeno 242, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 27 años, es madre de 1 hijo, es separada. Zulay con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en negocio de venta de pollos.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de pollos, para ello se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de su hijo y de su esposo, de allí se dirige a su puesto de venta en el mercado para vendes sus pollos hasta las 3 pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 30 pollos para implementar su negocio e incrementar sus ventas.

Zulay es una mujer muy trabajadora siempre saliendo adelante para poder criar a su hija y brindarle todo lo que ella algún día no lo pudo tener.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Tronfodji

texts.fr:
Tronfodji L. is a 60-year-old farmer who was born in Avétsèdomé. He is the father of seven children. His main business is agriculture. To increase his yield next season, he envisions buying some fertilizer. But due to a lack of financial means, he is applying for financial support in order to achieve good results. The granted request would be his greatest happiness, the reason the family will thrive.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Tronfodji L. est un cultivateur de 60 ans né à Avétsèdomé et père de sept (07) enfants. Son activité principale est l’agriculture. Pour augmenter son rendement à la prochaine saison, il envisage acheter des engrais. Mais par faute de moyens financiers, il sollicite un apport financier pour parvenir à un bon résultat. Cette demande accordée serait son plus grand plaisir, source de l’épanouissement de la famille.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa has been preparing and selling a meal called kenkey in her town for 30 years and many people want to buy her food. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize and eaten with fried fish and it is one of the main dishes that most Ghanians enjoy as breakfast, lunch or dinner. It is popular because it is free from food chemicals and affordable to all.

She has caring husband who helps her cook and sell the food. Theresa and her husband are pictured above.They are blessed with six children, who are all in school.

Theresa wants to use this loan to buy more bags of maize, cartons of fish, firewood, vegetable oil, and vegetables to expand her business. She is a member of the group called Odwanwhefo Pa, meaning "The Good Shepherd." Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize, cartons of frozen fish, vegetables, and other supplies.

loans.name: Rudi

texts.es:
Rudi belongs to the Mujeres con Futuro communal bank located at Jr. Arenal 1210 in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 25 years old and a mother of two children. Her husband is a welder, but his income is not sufficient to support their family so Rudi took out her first loan from Manuela Ramos for 300 soles to invest in a small hardware store. Today she manages the hardware store together with her husband. She runs the store out of her home to be close to her two small children who still need her very much, and to also manage her household chores. With this new loan, which will be repaid within 6 months, Rudi will purchase bolts, light bulbs, motor oil, nails, wire, padlocks, paint, etc. Rudi is very thankful to Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to establish her business and work to educate her children.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

La señora Rudi pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres con Futuro, ubicado en el Jr. Arenal 1210, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 25 años, es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es soldador, pero los ingresos con los que cuenta no alcanzan para mantener a su familia, es así que Rudi con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña ferretería. En la actualidad conjunto con su esposo administran su ferretería, como el negocio es en su casa eso le facilita estar a lado de sus pequeños hijos atenderlo por que aun son pequeños y necesitan mucho de ella, y también realiza sus labores domesticas. Con este préstamo de S/.1,100 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: pernos, focos, aceite para motores, clavos, alambres, candados, pinturas, etc. Rudi le da muchas gracias a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de poder poner su negocio y trabajar para educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for resale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Jamileth Del Rosario

texts.es:
Señora Jamileth del Rosario N. G. has been a client of our institution for three years now, recieving four loans to invest in her business. You can see the improvement in her business and also her quality of life. Jamileth is married with three children. It’s good to mention that this business made it possible to educate her children—one of them graduated with a degree in psychology and two others are in middle school. Her husband helps out in the business and also sells cattle.

In Jamileth’s bar, she sells food like chicken, a daily dish and steak. With the loans they have improved their selection of products as well as the business’s infrastructure. They changed the location of the bar to better premises.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Jamileth del Rosario N. G. es cliente de nuestra institución desde hace tres años donde ha obtenido cuatro prestamos, los que ha utilizado para capital de trabajo, se puede observar mejoras en la calidad del negocio asi como en sus condiciones de vida, la cliente es casada con tres hijos cabe destacar que con este negocio ha logrado prepara a sus hijos ya que una de ellas se graduo de psicologa y dos estan en secundaria el esposo le ayuda en el negocio y ademas se dedica a la comercialización de ganado. En su bar ella vende comidas como Pollo, comida coriente, Churrasco. Con el prestamo han logrado mejorar tanto la oferta de productos asi como la infraestructura del negocio ya que se cambiaron de un local a otro con mejores condiciones.

loans.use: Invest in her bar restaurant: buy chicken, meat, soft drinks, beer and alcohol

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es:
Ms. Yamileth Mejia is a 35-year-old married mother of 4 children ages 4, 16, 16, and 18. They live in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. Her husband is an industrial electrician who helps with the household expenses.

Ms. Mejia has been selling clothing and cosmetics for a living for 4 years. She started the business with her own money. She needs this loan for home improvement; she wants to build a kitchen in order to be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Yamileth tiene 35 años de edad, es casada, y habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, y tiene 4 hijos de 4, 16, 16, 18 años de edad, su esposo es electricista industrial y ayuda en los gastos del hogar.

Doña Yamileth su negocio es la venta de cosmético y ropa, lleva cuatro años de experiencia y comenzó con la venta de cosmético con dinero propio. El préstamo lo quiere para hacer mejoras a su vivienda construyendo una cocina para estar más cómoda.

loans.use: Finish building a kitchen in her home

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is married with three children, who are all in school. She is 32 years old and sells plastic bags in the local market.

She wants to use this loan to increase her inventory by adding plastic bags for nursing seedlings, carrier bags, and water bags. She is a member of the group called Stewards. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy plastic bags to sell in the market.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
Ms. Rafaela Solis is a 50-year-old married mother of 7 children, who are all independent and have their own jobs. She and her husband live in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. Her husband, who helps with the household expenses, is a security guard at a company. Ms. Solis is a dressmaker with 20 years of experience. She started out by making dresses for her family and neighbors. With this loan, she wants to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Rafaela habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casada y tiene 50 años de edad, con 7 hijos, son independientes y todos trabajan, su esposo es Guarda de Seguridad en una empresa y ayuda a los gastos del hogar. Doña Rafaela es costurera en corte y confección, tiene veinte años de experiencia, ella inicio haciéndoles costuras a su familia y vecinas. Con este préstamo que le presten quiere terminar de construir su casa de habitación.

loans.use: Finish construction of house

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
Señor Juan Alberto P. D. has been our client for ten years now, and it’s worth noting that he started in a credit group but later switched to individual loans, receiving 11 since. Juan has four sons, all in elementary school, and his wife works to help pay the bills.

His business is a bicycle shop, which he first started in his father’s house and it was really small. He has reinvested in his business, built his own house, moved the business into his house and now even sells bicycles. He has improved conditions for his family and now has two employees. With the current loan he plans to improve his inventory of bicycle parts.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

Elseñor Juan Alberto P. D. es cliente de nuetra institución desde hace unos diez años cabe destacar que el inicio con nosotros en credito de grupo solidario y luego se individualizo donde lleva once creditos hasta el momento, el es acompañado con cuatro hijos todos menores de edad y en educacion primaria, su compañera de vida trabaja y conribuye con los gastos familiares. Su negocio es un taller de bisicleta el que empezo en casa de su papa en este momento era bien pequeño, ha logrado capitalizar el negocio, construyo su casa propia, traslado el negocio a su casa y ahora hasta vende bisicletas ha mejorado las condiciones de vida de su familia con el credito actual mejorar su inventario de repuestos actualmente trabajan dos personas en su negocio.

loans.use: To invest in spare parts, tires and frames for his bicycle shop

loans.name: Khelcom 2 B Group

texts.fr:
We are the second GIE Khelcom group and we would like to request a loan from Kiva that will be used to construct a building to house a cybercafe in our village. Our ecovillage is located in an area frequented by tourists who all go to a town very far from our ecovillage to connect to the internet. The same thing happens with the young people in our village who also go to the town looking for internet connections. Since there is great demand for the internet, we would like to ask for your help in creating a cybercafé in the village which would fill our current gap in information technology. Ever since our village got connected to the telephone network and wired for electricity, we have been looking to open a cybercafé, not only in order to create jobs, but to help our locality develop by allowing the populace access to information via modern communication technology.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Nous sommes le deuxième groupe du GIE Khelcom et nous venons solliciter un Prêt auprès de Kiva pour la constructiond'un bâtiment qui doit faire usage de cybercafé dans notre village. Notre écovillage se trouve dans une zone touristique qui voit toutes les personnes qui y viennent se rendre dans une ville très éloignée de notre écovillage pour se connecter à Internet. c'est la même situation qui se répète pour les jeunes du village qui empruntent la même voie pour avoir accès à une connection. La demande étant très forte à ce sujet, nous venons solliciter votre appui afin que nous puissions créer un cybercafé dans le village et permettant ainsi de combler le gap numérique qui existait dans les environs. Depuis que notre village est connecté aux réseaux électrique et téléphonique, nous oeuvrons dans le sens de créer un cybercafé pour non seulement créer des emplois, mais participer aussi au développement de notre localité en aidant les populations à avoir accès à l'information avec les nouvelles technologies de comunication modernes.

loans.use:
Construction of a building in which to create a cybercafe

Construction d'un bâtiment pour création de cybercafé

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 32 years old and a mother of two children, who are both in school. She is pictured above with one of her children.She has been selling plastic food and storage bowls, cups, and tissues in the local market for about three years now.

She wants to use this loan to increase her inventory and sales to help her husband provide for the family. She is a member of the group called Stewards. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more plastic bowls, cups, and tissues to sell.

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel belongs to the Las Brisas Communal Bank, located at Jr. Serafin Filomeno 242 in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 25 years old and single, but her income is not sufficient to support herself so Ysabel borrowed her first loan from Manuela Ramos for 300 soles and invested in a small business selling chickens. Currently she is running her smally business selling chickens getting up at 3am to put her chickens out for sale from her home up to 12pm. Later she rests to prepare to work the next day. With this loan, which will be repaid within 4 months, she will purchase 70 new chickens to expand her business, increase her sales and profits. With every new day Isabel is becoming a woman who knows how to move ahead with a lot of hard work and dedication for her own well being.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

La señorita Ysabel pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Brisas, ubicado en el Jr. Serafín Filomeno 242, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 25 años, es soltera, pero los ingresos con los que cuenta no son los suficientes para mantenerse, es así que Ysabel con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en el negocio de venta de pollos. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de pollos, para ello se levanta a las 3 am para poner en venta sus pollos en su casa hasta las 12 pm. luego descansa para prepararse para la faena del siguiente día. Con este préstamo de S/. 2000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 70 pollos para implementar su negocio e incrementar sus ventas y sus ganancias. Ysabel día a día se convierte en una mujer que sabe salir adelante en base a mucho trabajo y dedicación para su propio bienestar.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Rosa Alvina

texts.es:
Rosa belongs to the Communal Bank Mujeres Talentosas, located at Jr. Piura 189, in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 68 years old and has 7 children. Her husband is retired. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos for 300 soles, Rosa invested in a small business selling juices. Very early every morning Rosa is ready to sell delicious juices prepared from local fruit. She has a large customer base because of the good service she provides and they are always satisfied. With help from her children she is making a better life for her family. With this new loan, which will be repaid within 4 months, she will purchase additional local fruit such as papaya, oranges, mandarines, bananas, milk, eggs, carob, etc. Rosa is very happy because she has become independent and is managing her own business and income.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en el Jr. Piura 189, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 68 años, es madre D. 7 hijos, su esposo es jubilado, es así que Rosa con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña venta D. jugos. En la actualidad todas las mañanas muy temprano esta lista para vender los ricos jugos preparados a base D. frutas regionales, cuenta con mucha clientela por el muy buen trato que da a sus clientes y siempre les da aumento y quedan muy satisfechos, con la ayuda D. sus hijos salen adelante por el bien D. la familia. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará frutas regionales, como: papaya, naranja, mandarina, plátanos, leche, huevos, algarrobita, veterraga, etc. Rosa se siente muy feliz por que se ha independizado y administra su propio negocio e ingresos.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies to make juices

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba is 70 years old and a baker. She has been baking for thirty years now. Araba is married and she lives with the husband, who assists her in baking bread. Her last born child has also come to help due to her old age and doctor’s advice to stay away from fire. Araba’s daughter in the photo as she was ill.

Araba wants to use the loan to buy flour, margarine, sugar, and firewood to expand her operation. She is a member of the group called Stewards. Members agree to support and guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more flour, margarine, sugar, and firewood for her bakery.

loans.name: Dassou

texts.fr:
Dassou G. is a good and honest woman, 65 years old but very active. Born in Aviahonou, her principal business is commerce in pearls and in cosmetics. This business brings in a lot here, providing an income that helps her to support her family.

She is therefore applying for a loan for a supply of pearls and cosmetic products in order to meet her customer expectations better.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Dassou G. est une brave femme de 65 ans mais très active. Née à Aviahonou, elle s’est mariée à un cultivateur dans la même localité. Mère de quatre (04) enfants, son activité principale est le commerce des perles et de produits cosmétiques. Cette activité très génératrice de revenu dans nos milieux, lui procure une source de revenu qui l’aide dans les charges de sa famille. Elle sollicite ainsi un crédit pour s’approvisionner en perles et en produits cosmétiques afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Inventory of pearls and cosmetics

loans.name: Sozandji

texts.fr:
Sozandji L. is a good and honest farmer in his area. In addition to agriculture, he raises pigs to stabilize his income better. The care he gives his pigs has made him a famous livestock farmer, renown locally for the size of his pigs. To do better and to have the greatest number of pigs, he would like financing to buy more piglets. Thus, he will be able to provide for his eleven children despite being 57 years of age.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Sozandji L. est un brave cultivateur de sa localité. En plus de l’agriculture, il élève aussi des porcs pour mieux stabiliser son revenu. Le soin qu’il apporte à ses porcs a fait de lui un éleveur célèbre et très reconnu dans sa localité de part la grosseur de ses porcs. Pour mieux faire et avoir un nombre maximum de porcs il voulait avoir un financement qui servira à acheter d’autres petits porcs. Ainsi donc il pourra subvenir aux besoins des onze (11) enfants malgré qu’il soit dans sa cinquante septième année d’âge

loans.use: To buy piglets

loans.name: Bayistan

texts.en:
Bayistan H. is a 46-year-old woman who has been maintaining a herd of sheep since 1992. She lives in a small village in the Sabirabad region with her family. She is divorced and thus has to raise her only one son by herself, though she lives with her parents. Her herd or sheep generates the only source of income for her family, and she works extremely hard to support her family and to ensure that they live in decent conditions.

However, to improve her family's standard of living, she needs more sheep. And, because summer is the high season for weddings, it is the opportune time to purchase lambs, raise the lambs, and sell the lambs in the mid- to late-summer. Accordingly, Bayistan is requesting a loan in the amount of $800 to purchase 10 sheep at an estimated cost of $60 each (i.e.,$600 total) and fodder with the remaining $200 to facilitate the breeding process.

loans.use: To capitalize on the summer wedding season by purchasing additional sheep and fodder

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a partner of the Comunal Bank Arco Iris

She is 35 years old, married with 2 children. Margarita travels to the different fairs in the area 2 times a week where she buys small animals, cheese, and grains in order to sell them door to door to a list of clients she has built up over time. She also sells fire wood from her home.

Margarita needs a loan of 3000 soles to invest in the purchase of livestock and fire wood.

Her dream is to build a home, have a big store, and to have her kids receive a good education.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.

Margarita es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Margarita viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región 2 veces por semana, de donde compra animales menores, queso, cereales, que vende caminando de casa en casa a clientes que ya tiene. Además Margarita vende leña en su casa.

Margarita necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerdo, carnero y leña.

Los sueños de Margarita son construir su casa, tener una tienda grande y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Margarita needs a loan of 3000 soles to invest in the purchase of livestock and fire wood

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is a partner of the Comunal Bank Arco Iris

Felicitas is 55 years old and married with 6 children. She travels to different fairs in the area 2 times a week to buy grains, cheese, and livestock. She then returns home and sells her products door to door. On top of that Felicitas farms her land and raises her livestock.

She needs a loan of 3000 soles to invest in the purchase of more livestock.

Her hope is that her kids have as many opportunities as possible, and to offer them and her business all the comforts necessary to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.

Felicitas es casada, tiene 55 años y 6 hijos, Felicitas viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región 2 veces por semana, donD. compra cereales, queso, animales menores que ella beneficia, sus ventas lo realiza caminando D. casa en casa. Además Felicitas se dedica a la agricultura en sus tierras D. Rancha y también se dedica al engorD. D. ganado vacuno y caprino.

Felicitas necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. Cerdos y ganado vacuno.

Los sueños D. Felicitas son que sus hijos sean profesionales, brindar todas las comodidades a sus hijos y su negocio crezca.

loans.use: Felicitas needs a loan of 3000 soles to invest in the purchase of more livestock

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard H. is thirty year old businessman. He is married with two children, who are both in school. He is a small scale manufacturer of tin pepper near the community market. He buys fresh and dry pepper, mills and processes them into canned pepper, and then supplies them to food vendors and restaurant operators. His operation is on a limited scale due to inadequate capital to buy machines for the processing.

Bernard wants to take advantage of the loan opportunity to buy more raw materials and equipment to increase his efficiency and produce in larger quantities. He believes this can help expand his business to produce a larger income to help finance his children’s education.

He belongs to the community group called Nyame Boafo ("The helping God") Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and act as peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials and equipment to manufacture tin pepper.

loans.name: Yalchin

texts.en:
Yalchin H. is a 35-year-old man who has owned and operated a small farm since 1989. He is married and he has two children. On his farm, he raises calves, and he later sells the calves to the local bazaar traders.

Breeding and selling calves is the only source of income for his family, so he is now requesting a loan in the amount of $700 to expand his business operation and to thereby generate additional income for his family. With the loan proceeds, he will purchase two calves ($300 each) and fodder with the remaining $100.

loans.use: To expand his business and to generate additional income for his family by purchasing two calves and fodder

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara A. is thirty one year old businesswoman. She is married and the mother of two children, who are both in school. Barbara is very industrious and helps her husband provide for their family. She is a small scale manufacturer of canned pepper. She buys both fresh and dry pepper from local farmers, mills and processes them into cans, and then supplies them to food vendors and restaurant operators.

Her production is on very limited scale because of low working capital. She therefore wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials and minor equipment to raise her production efficiency. She believes this will help her increase her income and also to support her family.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials and minor equipment to manufacture canned pepper.

loans.name: Mekhbali

texts.en:
Mekhbali B. is a 47-year-old man who has been selling dairy products since 1980. He is married and he has three children, and they all live in the small village of Sabirabad in Azerbaijan. He works as a teacher in the local school, yet his salary as a schoolteacher is not sufficient to support his family. In any event, dairy sales constitute the main source of income for his family.

Supporting and caring for three children is very difficult, and relying on output from just two cows makes it impossible to cover all of his family members’ needs. Therefore, to improve his family's situation and standard of living, he is requesting a loan in the amount of $800 to purchase another dairy cow for $700 and to purchase fodder with the remaining $100.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing an additional dairy cow and fodder

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret A. is a fifty two year old widow and mother of five children. She believes in hard work and dedication and that is the secret of her success. She owns and operates a local restaurant and sells local foods like fufu, banku, ampesi, and rice balls.

Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain and eaten with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and eaten with hot pepper or soup. Ampesi is a boiled plantain or yam and is eaten with any stew.

She wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She belongs to the community group called Nyame Boafo Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and act as peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for her restaurant and food shop, like bags of maize and baskets of cassava.

loans.name: Alyunus

texts.en:
Alyunus F. is a 48-year-old man who has been selling milk and yogurt to the local people in a small village of the Sabirabad region since 1988. He is married and he has three children. In addition to his dairy business, he works as a driver to supplement his family's income, though he is quick to point out that dairy sales represent his primary source of income.

Living in his village has been getting harder and harder in recent months, especially since food prices have increased five-fold. Consequently, Alyunus is seeking to improve his financial status by purchasing one dairy cow for $800.

loans.use: To improve his family's standard of living by purchasing a dairy cow

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. is a sixty five year old widow and mother of five children. Since she became a single parent, she has been very supportive of her children. She has sold used clothing at a local market for the past fifteen years. From her business, she has been able to pay for two children to complete teacher training school.

She has insufficient capital to buy larger quantities of used clothing to sell. With this loan, she would buy more bales of used clothing to increase her stock and the variety of clothing. She hopes to raise enough income to pay for two children to finish senior school this year.

She belongs to the community called Nso Nyame ye ("It is possible with God") Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing to increase and diversify her inventory.

loans.name: Anar

texts.en:
Anar M. is a 30-year-old farmer who sells dairy products to the local people and the local milk factory. In fact, he has more than twenty years of experience in this particular field. He lives with his family in the small village of Saatli, and he has been an internally-displaced person since 1993.

Selling milk and yogurt is the only source of income for his family, a fact that Anar is mindful of as he seeks to generate additional income from his business. Accordingly, he is requesting a loan in the amount of $700 to purchase one dairy cow which will enable Anar to earn more money and to thereby stabilize his family's financial situation.

loans.use: To expand his business and to generate additional income for his family by purchasing a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials for hairdressing services

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk to increase her sales

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret A. O. is fifty four year old divorced mother of three children. She is very industrious, motivated by supporting her children’s education and wanting to provide them with better future opportunities in life. One of her children is in university.

Margaret is a food vendor selling cooked rice with stew. She also sells groundnut, beans, and yams in the community market. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, beans, and yams to increase her stock of goods. She belongs to the community group called Nso Nyame ye Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each another as social collateral and act as peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, beans, and yams.

loans.name: Elman

texts.en:
Elman Q. is a 50-year-old man who started his business in 1982 of selling dairy products and breeding calves in the small village of Saatli. Elman is married and he has four children, and their family lives together in a settlement with other displaced families.

The main source of the business' income is dairy sales, so Elman is hoping to expand his business with that key fact in mind. Indeed, times are tough for Elman and his family, so he is looking to generate additional income from his business. Therefore, he is requesting a loan in the amount of $800 to purchase one dairy cow for $700 and fodder with the remaining $100.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing one dairy cow as well as some fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase raw materials to produce fried dishes

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence A. is thirty two years old. He is married with two kids, age one and four. He is a chemical seller of various kinds of drugs. like blood tonic, pain killers, and malaria drugs, in his neighborhood. Many local people patronize his drugs as first aid and as cures when they are sick.

Lawrence wants to use this loan to increase his supply of drugs and add stock of other drugs that his customers frequently request. He hopes to raise his income in order to take care of his family.

He is a member of the community called Nso Nyame ye Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and act as peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To increase his supply of drugs.

loans.name: Gulkhar

texts.en:
Gulkhar H. is a 46-year-old woman who breeds and thereafter sells sheep to the local bazaar traders in the small village of Sabirabad in Azerbaijan. She is proud to say that she has more than 20 years of experience in this field.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $800 to purchase 10 sheep (for $60 each) and fodder with the remaining $200 in order to speed up her business' sheep-raising process.

loans.use: To expand business operations by purchasing 10 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials for her small beauty parlor

loans.name: Jose Dario

texts.es:
Mr. Jose Dario is requesting a loan so that it can be invested in improvements to his home. He is a responsible gentleman -- he is a partner of the CASCEPADE corporation. His line of production is well diversified. The property where he works is totally pastured. It has a continuing irrigation system plus it offers good basic conditions for grazing and livestock raising. His wife helps out by running a convenience store that covers some of the family's expenses. This client is a man of few financial resources and his dream is to improve his home and his quality of life. 

 Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Don José Dario está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda.  Es un hombre responsable, es socio de la cooperativa CASCEPADE,  su área de producción está diversificada, para el manejo del ganado, esta propiedad está  empastada, aguaje de todo tiempo, pasto en buenas condiciones básicas, para la explotación de ganado, también su esposa tiene una pulperia y le ayuda a solventar algunos gastos del hogar, este cliente es un hombre de pocos recursos economicos, sus mejores sueños es de mejorar su vivienda y obtener una vida mejor.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to make home improvements.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina A. is thirty two years old. She is married with three children, who are all in school. She is a petty trader selling gari, groundnuts, and maize in her neighborhood. Gari is produced from milled cassava, dried and fried and eaten with cooked beans and palm oil. It is one the local foods that is enjoyed by many Ghanaians.

From the profit of her business, she takes care of her three children. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of gari, beans, groundnut, and maize to increase her stock of goods for sale. She hopes to raise her income in order to pay her children’s school fees.

She is a member of the trust group called Nso Nyame ye ("It is possible with God"). In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and act as peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of gari, beans, groundnut, and maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase women's clothing to sell in her community

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
Gulnara H. is a 32-year-old woman who breeds sheep in a small settlement within the Saatli region of Azerbaijan. She is married and she has two children. She has more than 15 years of experience in this business yet she struggles to pay for her family's basic needs.

Accordingly, Gulnara is requesting a loan in the amount of $800 to purchase 12 sheep ($60 each) and fodder with the remaining $80. The summer season is the high period for wedding parties in Azerbaijan, where all meals are made from meat and especially from mutton. Therefore, Gulnara feels that the time is right to expand her herd of sheep in order to allow her to earn more money in July and August.

loans.use: To capitalize on the upcoming summer wedding season by expanding her business' herd of sheep with an additional 12 sheep (plus some fodder)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk to keep satisfying her customers' needs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in raw materials to produce her delicious arepas and mabí.

loans.name: Natiq

texts.en:
Natiq R. is a 42-year-old trader who has his own shop in the Saatli region of Azerbaijan where he sells food. Natiq is married and has three children.

Natiq has worked in this particular field for more than 20 years but, until recently, he rented the shop in which he sold his goods. However, he is proud to say that he finally purchased land not long ago and proceeded to build his own shop. Nevertheless, the shop is quite new and is in need of repairs and other improvements. He is requesting a loan in the amount of $800 in order to purchase more equipment to sell and to make repairs to his shop.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to make much-needed repairs and improvements to his business' shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase candies to sell in her community

loans.name: Mujeres En Desarrollo Group

texts.en:
Gervasia P. has been the leader of this group for six months now, and they are currently applying for their second loan with Esperanza International. Her plans for the future are to continue expanding her sewing business and to buy a new sewing machine.
