Gervasia's parents passed away when she was four years old and she has had a very hard life, but she thanks God that she is still alive and now can provide a better life for her children. When she is not working she enjoys reading and watching television, and her favorite foods are beans and meat.

Thank you for supporting this group!

loans.use: To buy more material and to save for a new sewing machine.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Esperanza International, a partner of HOPE International - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Manuela Rosna

texts.es:
Rosana belongs to the Communal Bank of Las Flores del Paraiso, located at Jr. Apurimac 535 in the District of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 36 years old and has one child. Her husband is a lumberman, but his income is not sufficient to cover their family expenses. With her first loan received from Manuela Ramos for 300 soles, Rosana decided to invest in a business buying and re-selling second hand clothing. Currently she has a good business buying and selling both new and used clothing. She gets up at 7am to prepare breakfast for her son and husband and later she works collecting and distributing the clothing up through 5pm. With this new loan, which will be repaid within 4 months, she will purchase different types of clothing for women, men and children. Rosanda has known how to overcome the barriers that destiny put before her. Now she can support her family thorugh her own efforts which day by day she sees reflected in her work and she is very grateful for the support from Manuela Ramos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

La señora Rosana pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Flores del Paraíso, ubicado en el Jr Apurimac 535, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 36 años y es madre de 1 hijo, su esposo es maderero, pero los ingresos con los que cuenta no le alcanzan para mantener a su familia. Rosana con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de compra y venta de ropas de segunda. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de compra y venta de ropas de primera y de segunda calidad, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de su hijo y de su esposo y luego se dedica al reparto y cobranza de sus prendas, hasta las 5 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: diversos tipos de ropas de segunda para damas caballeros, niños y niñas. Rosana ha sabido superar las barreras que le puso el destino ahora puede apoyar a su familia a través de su propio esfuerzo que día a día se ve reflejado en su trabajo y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Mrs. Justina belongs to the Communal Bank of Virgen de la Natividad, located at Jr. Gonzales Prada 155 in the District of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 57 years old, separated, and a mother of 4 children. With the first loan received from Manuela Ramos for 300 soles, she decided to invest in a small tailoring shop. Currently she divides her time between her household duties and her work sewing clothing ordered by her customers. Given the quality of her work, she enjoys much appreciation from her clients. With this new loan, which will be paid within 4 months, she will purchase a variety of fabrics, wood and other materials to fix up her shop. Justina feels very satisfied working every day to improve her standard of living. Her children support her in everything and are very proud that their mother has decided to create her own business and work hard to progress forward in her life.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

La señora Justina pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen de la Natividad, ubicado en el Jr. Gonzáles Prada 155, D. Distrito de Calleria D. Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 57 años y es madre de 4 hijos, es separada. Justina con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un pequeño taller de costura. En la actualidad comparte sus tareas domesticas con la confección de sus prendas que le solicitan sus clientes, por el buen trazo y acabado de sus prendas, goza de mucha aceptación. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: telas de diferentes colores, clavos, madera para el arreglo de su taller. Justina se siente muy tranquila trabajando todos los días para salir adelante, sus hijos la apoyan en todo, y se sienten muy orgullosos de su madre que decidió poner su negocio y trabajar para progresar.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and other goods for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Laura Enith

texts.es:
Mrs. Laura Enith belongs to the Communal Virgen de la Natividad Bank located at Jr. Amazonas 398 in the District of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 40 years old and is a mother of four children. Her husband is a merchant. With her first loan for 300 soles received from Manuela Ramos, Laura decided to invest in a business selling food products. Currently her food sales and profits are growing and she plans to remodel her house to accommodate a future restaurant where she can offer more services to her customers as a place to have fun and eat delicious food. With the help of her children, she'll be open every day. With this loan, which will be repaid within 4 months, she will set up her home with tables, chairs, fresh paint and new lighting. She will also purchase meats and products she needs for her dishes. Laura is grateful to Manuela Ramos for lending support to many women through loans that help their families.

Translated by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

La señora Laura Enith pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen de la Natividad, ubicado en el Jr. Amazonas 398, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Laura con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de comidas. En la actualidad con su venta de comida esta incrementando sus ganancias y remodelando su casa para que mas adelante poder tener un restaurante y ofrecer mas servicios a sus clientes puedan divertirse y comer muy rico, con la ayuda de sus hijos atiende todo los días. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,300 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, estará acondicionando su casa con mesas, sillas, pintado, luces, y también comprará carnes y víveres que necesita para sus comidas. Laura se siente agradecida con Manuela Ramos por brindar apoyo a todas la mujeres con los prestamos para surgir pro el bien de la familia.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for the preparation of her products

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es:
Señora Lupe, 57 years old, mother of two and separated, belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Almendras,” located in the district of Calleria and the Departamento of Ucayali. With her first loan from our institution, Manuela Ramos, Lupe decided to invest in a small mechanic’s shop. She now works alongside her two sons in the workshop. They rise and eat early to start their day of work. Working makes Lupe feel more active, to converse with clients, putting great care into the service she provides, and in her free moments talking with her sons to plan the improvements and growth of the business.

With this US$450 5-month loan, she will buy patches, wrenches, oil, a compressor, and a machine for plaiting. Lupe is very happy with all the support; with the loans her workshop is doing well and she can improve her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lupe pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Almendras, ubicado en el, Jr Francisco Pizarro 147, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 57 años y es madre de 2 hijos, es separada. Lupe con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un pequeño taller de mecánica. En la actualidad trabaja junto con sus hijos en su taller, muy temprano desayunan para luego empezar con la jornada del día, trabajar la hace sentirse mas activa, estar conversando con sus clientes, atenderlos con esmero, en los tiempos libres conversa con sus hijos para mejorar y seguir haciendo crecer sus negocio. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: parchador, llaves, aceite, compresora, trenzadora. Lupe esta muy contenta por todo el apoyo recibido, con los prestamos recibidos esta surgiendo con su taller, y así puede mejorar sus economía.

loans.use: Invest in equipment and tools for her family's workshop

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Señora Inés, 53 years old and mother of four, belongs to the Communal Bank "Virgen de la Natividad," located in the district of Manantay and the state of Ucayali. Her husband runs a business but his income is not enough to raise the family. With her first loan from our institution, Manuela Ramos, Inés decided to invest in a stand selling cold drinks. She now has a small soda fountain made from her profits. She sells cold drinks, snacks and her clients enjoy good service and good music from early in the morning until 10 at night. With the intense heat in our region [of Peru], her business has a lot of demand.

With her US$275 4-month loan, she will buy a large variety of soft drinks, sparkling water and snacks. Inés feels good; the loans are a help to her and her business. She enjoys the time spent during the meetings and talks with her community bank because she learns a lot and is responsible in her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Inés pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen de la Natividad, ubicado en el Jr. Bolognesi S/N, del Distrito de Manantay del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 53 años y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es comernciante, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuanta no le alcanza para mantener a su familia. Inés con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña venta de bebidas heladas. En la actualidad con las ganancias obtenidas construyo una fuente de soda, donde vende sus bebidas heladas, golosinas, a sus clientes que gozan de una buena atención y excelente música, atiende todos los días desde muy tempranas horas hasta las 10 pm., con el calor fuerte de nuestra región sus bebidas tiene mucha demanda. Con este préstamo de S/. 700 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará gaseosa de todos los preciso y tamaños, agua mineral, golosinas en general. Inés se siente muy tranquila, los prestamos son una ayuda para ella y su negocio, le distrae mucho cuando tiene reuniones y charlas con su banco comunal por que aprende mucho y es responsable en sus pagos.

loans.use: Increase the quantity and variety at her soda fountain

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dang Thi H., 35 years old, is a member of TYM Fund for the second year. She has 10 years experience of selling animals. This is an activity that requires a huge starting fund but it also yields very high profit. Besides selling cattles, Mrs. H. also sells their meat for locally people. Her family current average income is 300 USD. She spends this money on sending 2 children to school and furnishing her house. This time, she wants to borrow 625 USD to buy more cattles to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đặng Thị Hương năm nay 35 tuổi, đang là thành viên năm thứ 2 của Quỹ TYM. Chị đã có 10 năm làm nghề buôn bán gia súc. Đây là một nghề cần phải có vốn lớn nhưng lại thu được lợi nhuận cao. Bên cạnh việc mua bán trâu bò, chị Hương cùng chồng còn mổ thịt để cung cấp thực phẩm tươi sống cho nhân dân trong thôn xã. Thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng của gia đình là 300USD. Số tiền này, chị dành một phần nuôi 2 con ăn học, một phần để sắm sửa đồ đạc trong nhà. Vòng vốn này chị làm đơn xin vay 625USD để mua trâu, bò.

loans.use: Buy cattles

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dang Thi N. joined the TYM Fund since 2007. Her husband is a wedding photographer, and she stays at home breeding pigs and chickens. At the age of 49 years old, she fulfilled her responsibility to raise and rear her children. Therefore, she spends her profit in furnishing the house and improving living conditions. After several times of borrowing little money to get to know the Fund’s repaying method, she wants to borrow 450 USD to buy furnitures for wedding rental, making a good connection to her husband’s business. Coming to Mrs.N.’s store, customers can always rent new furnitures with acceptable price. Her family current average income is 150 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đặng Thị N. tham gia Quỹ năm 2007. Chồng làm thợ chụp ảnh, phục vụ đám cưới, chị N. ở nhà chăn nuôi lợn gà. Ở tuổi 49, chị đã hoàn thành nhiệm vụ nuôi con ăn học, thu nhập làm ra được chị N. sắm sửa đồ đạc và cải thiện cuộc sống. Sau vòng đầu vay vốn thấp để làm quen với cơ chế hoàn trả của Quỹ, ở vòng này chị làm đơn xin vay 450USD để mua đồ cho thuê đám cưới kết hợp với công việc của chồng. Đến với nhà chị N., khách hàng luôn thuê được đồ mới, giá cả hợp lý. Thu nhập bình quân hiện nay của gia đình khoảng 150USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy furniture for rental

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dang Thi T., 30 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2007. She is living with her husband and two children. Everyday, she stays at home to brew wine and breed pigs, while her husband sells sedge mats and elastic bands. Her wine is very good, and to many local customers’ tastes. Therefore, there are many people buying her wine. Her family current average income is 200 USD. Last year, she built a house. As a result, she needs to borrow money to continue her business. Since realizing the convenience of the TYM Fund’s repaying method, she wants to borrow 575 USD to buy more rice to brew wine and to buy more sedge mats for her husband to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đặng Thị T., 30 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 2007. Chị sống cùng chồng và 2 con. Hàng ngày, chị ở nhà nấu rượu nuôi lợn, còn anh đi buôn chiếu, dây chun. Rượu của chị nấu rất ngon, nên nhiều người dân trong thôn và các quán lân cận đến lấy. Mỗi tháng gia đình thu nhập 200USD. Năm ngoái chị cũng vừa mới làm nhà xong nên cũng cần thêm vốn buôn bán. Sau một vòng vốn vay, cảm thấy cơ chế hoạt động của Quỹ rất phù hợp với nên vòng này chị làm đơn xin vay tiếp 575USD mua gạo nấu rượu và mua chiếu.

loans.use: Buy rice to make rice wine and buy sedge mats

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi:
At the age of 59 years old, Mrs. D. Thi D. already raised her 4 children to maturity and they all build their own families. Before, her family is locally one of the most difficult families. However, after joining the TYM Fund, her family economy improved significantly. After the first time, she talks to her husband and decides to borrow 375 USD to buy more pigs and sedge to weave and repays weekly. Her mats are very pretty and strong, therefore they are used by many customers. Her current average income is 120 USD. She always wants to stay healthy and continue to be a member of the TYM Fund to improve her family economy.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Ở tuổi 59, chị Đỗ Thị Độ đã nuôi 4 con trưởng thành và có gia đình riêng. Trước đây gia đình chị là hộ nghèo của địa phương nhưng sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị đã thay đổi hẳn. Sau khi hết vòng vốn 1, chị bàn với anh vay 375USD mua lợn chăn nuôi và cói dệt chiếu để hoàn trả hàng tuần. Những đôi chiếu D. chị dệt ra thật chắc chắn và bền đẹp, nên được tiêu thụ ngay và rất được giá. Đồng vốn vay quay vòng nhanh và có hiệu quả. Thu nhập một tháng của chị Độ là 120USD. Chị mong muốn mình luôn khoẻ mạnh để được tham gia vay vốn Quỹ Tình Thương phát triển kinh tế gia đình.

loans.use: Buy pigs and sedge

loans.name: Thuy Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Thuy Thi H. is 35 years old with two school-aged children. She joined TYM Fund in 2007. Her husband is a carpenter and while his income is steady and stable, she wishes to not be so reliant on her husband for financial support. Aside from working in her shop she is also a seamstress. Although enduring a painstaking craft, her skillful hands produce beautiful merchandise, which attracts many customers. Already in her second year of participation with the Fund, she finds that the loan repayment terms are very agreeable and convenient for her family. With the family income increasing and her children allowed greater education, she has noticed that her children are very well-behaved and receives high grades in school. Her monthly family income is around 200USD. This time around, she requests a loan of 575USD to buy more goods for her small convenience store and more carpentry wood for her husband.

Translated from Vietnamese by Trinh Quoc Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị Thúy, 35 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2007. Chồng chị làm thợ mộc, 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Tuy thu nhập từ nghề mộc của anh cũng tương đối ổn định, nhưng chị Thúy cũng không muốn sống dựa vào chồng. Chị xin vay vốn về mua hàng tạp hóa về bán và đầu tư thêm cho anh mua gỗ về làm mộc. Ngoài ra chị cũng làm thêm nghề may. Tham gia Quỹ năm thứ 2, chị cảm thấy cách vay trả của Quỹ rất phù hợp với gia đình. Nhờ chịu khó lại khéo tay nên cửa hàng của chị rất đông khách. Thu nhập gia đình tăng lên, hai con chị có điều kiện được ăn học nên các cháu đều ngoan và học giỏi. Thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình khoảng 200USD. Vòng vốn này chị Thúy là đơn xin vay 575USD để mua hàng bán và gỗ làm mộc.

loans.use: Buy goods for her grocery store and wood

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Lê Thị Sách is 56 years old. Despite the fact that she is receiving a pension, she is still actively working to increase her income. She sells grocery and raises pigs. After a year with TYM, she notices that the investment has yielded good results. Also she likes that fact that she can pay back in installments. On top of her pension, she make about 100 USD a month.On this second year with TYM, she is applying for a loan of 825 USD to buy breeding pigs and grocery stock to sell. Her 2 children are grown up. She hopes that with this loan, she will be able to increase her revenue so she would be able to help her grand children and repair her house.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

56 tuổi, tuy đã có chế độ hưu trí nhưng chị Lê Thị Sách vẫn tích cực chăn nuôi và buôn bán để có thêm thu nhập. Sau một năm vay vốn Quỹ Tình Thương, chị thấy vốn vay đầu tư có hiệu quả, việc hoàn trả lại rất thuận tiện. Ngoài lương hưu trung bình một tháng chị Sách thu khoảng 100USD. Năm thứ 2 chị dự định xin vay 825USD để mua lợn giống và hàng bán. 2 con chị hiện nay đều đã trưởng thành. Với số vốn vay thêm chị mong muốn thu nhập sẽ tăng thêm để có điều kiện để hỗ trợ con cháu về kinh tế và sửa sang thêm nhà cửa.

loans.use: Buy pigs and goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Hồng is 42 years old. She participates in TYM fund since 2007. Her 2 children are grown up. She has a small store selling basic goods. Her business model is to make small profit on each item to keep the price down but to sell a lot of merchandise. Her store is always busy. Her husband is very supportive of her and their 2 children do help her out. Since she just started this business, her inventory is low. This is why she is applying for a loan of 375 USD to buy more merchandise for her store. Her monthly income is around 170 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hồng, 42 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2007. 2 người con của chị đều đã qua tuổi đi học. Công việc chính của chị là bán hàng tạp hóa. Bán được nhiều hàng nhưng ăn lãi ít đó là phương châm của chị Hồng. Vì vậy dù mới mở cửa hàng nhưng nhà chị lúc nào cũng đông khách. Chồng chị luôn giúp chị tích cực trong việc đồng áng, hai con cũng đi làm để hỗ trợ gia đinh. Mới bắt đầu nên số lượng hàng hóa bày bán cũng chưa nhiều. Vì vậy chị Hồng xin vay mức 375USD mua thêm nhiều hàng về bán phục vụ nhiều hơn cho bà con nhân dân và nâng cao mức thu nhập trong gia đình. Thu nhập bình quân của chị hiện nay khoảng 170USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Lan Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lan Thi N. is 39 years old with two school-aged children. She joined the Fund in 2007. Her husband is a busy village official and does not have time to help her with the house chores; she alone takes care of the homestead. Outside of house work, she takes care of the family farm, which has over 100 pigs and 600 ducks. The farm is her main source of income. Every month, she averages around 300USD in income. This time around, she requests a loan of 825USD to buy more feed for her flock of ducks and drove of pigs. Her farming model has been emulated and put into practice by many people in the community.

Translated from Vietnamese by Trinh Quoc N., Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Lan, 39 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2007. Chị có 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Chồng chị là một cán bộ xã có ít thời gian chăm lo việc nhà, một mình chị Lan quán xuyến mọi việc. Ngoài việc chăm sóc trang trại lợn với hơn 100 con chị còn nuôi thêm 600 vịt đẻ lấy thu nhập hàng ngày. Mỗi tháng bình quân chị Lan thu 300USD. Vòng vốn này chị Lan xin vay 825USD để mua thêm thức ăn cho đàn vịt và lợn của mình. Mô hình chăn nuôi của chị đang được nhiều người áp dụng và học tập.

loans.use: Buy food for pigs, ducks

loans.name: Que Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Que Thi N., 48 years old, joined the Fund in 2007. She raises pigs and chickens for sale. Since her last loan of 200USD last year, she was able to raise 4 pigs, each weighing around 154-176lbs and more than 100 chickens. Her husband is a construction worker and has greatly helped her during her participation with the Fund. This time around, she wishes to borrow 375USD to build breeding pens and buy more feed for her pigs. With any money leftover, she plans expand her breeding facilities for her growing number of pigs. Her present monthly income is around 150USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Trinh Quoc N., Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Quế năm nay 48 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2007. Công việc của chị là chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Từ mức vốn vay 200USD năm đầu đến nay chị đã có số vốn là 4 con lợn, mỗi con 70-80kg và hơn 100 con gà. Chồng chị làm thợ xây và hỗ trợ chị rất nhiều trong quá trình tham gia Quỹ. Vòng vốn này chị Quế xin vay mức 375USD để xây dựng chuồng trại, mua thức ăn chăn nuôi, số tiền còn lại cùng với đợt bán lợn này chị sẽ mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập hàng tháng hiện nay của chị Quế là 150USD.

loans.use: Buy food for pigs

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị Hường, 54 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2007. Chồng mất, một mình chị nuôi 2 con ăn học, đến nay một cháu đã học xong phổ thông và có việc làm. Công việc chính của chị hiện nay là bán hàng hoa quả và tạp hóa. Với thái độ phục vụ niềm nở, ân cần, giá cả lại hợp lý nên khách hàng đến mua hàng của chị luôn cảm thấy thoải mái, yên tâm. Gian hàng của chị Hường tuy nhỏ nhưng mặt hàng nào cũng có. Thu nhập mỗi ngày của chị Hường khoảng 5-6USD. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị xin vay 575USD để mua thêm hàng.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Ms. H. Thi Pham, 54 years old, joined the fund in 2007. Widowed, she raises her two children by herself, one of which is now finished with school and has found work. Her main job is currently running a stall selling fruits and other goods. With her warm and friendly attitude and reasonable prices, her customers always feel comfortable shopping there. Even though her stall is small, it has almost all variety of goods. The daily revenue of Ms. Pham's business is about 5-6 USD. In this round of funding she is asking for $575 to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: Buy goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Vy Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Trịnh Thị Vỵ, 52 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 2 của Quỹ. Chị có 5 người con, trong đó 3 người con đầu đã lập gia đình, 2 còn đang đi học. Kinh tế gia đình còn nhiều khó khăn nên chị tham gia Quỹ Tình thương. Sau vòng vốn đầu sử dụng thấy hiệu quả, vòng này chị Vỵ làm đơn xin vay 375USD mua thức ăn cho lợn, đồng thời mua thêm 1 lợn nái (giá lợn con hiện nay đang rất cao). Chồng chị là một cán bộ về mất sức nhưng anh nhận thêm nghề đan lát để hỗ trợ vợ trong việc hoàn trả tiền tuần. Tính cả lương hưu của chồng, thu nhập của gia đình chị Vỵ là 150USD/tháng. Nếu được vay vốn của Quỹ chị không phải lo mua chịu thức ăn gia súc với lãi cao nữa.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Ms. Vy Thi T., 52 years old, is a 2nd-year participant in the fund. She has 5 children, the oldest 3 of which are grown and have their own families, and 2 who are still going to school. The family is still encountering many financial difficulties, so she is participating in the Fund. After the first successful utilization of the fund, in this round Ms. T. is applying for 375 USD to buy feed for the pigs, and also to buy a female pig (currently the price of baby pigs is very high). Her husband is a veteran whose health has declined since returning, but he takes extra work weaving to help support his wife in the weekly bills and payments. Counting her husband’s pension, the family’s income is 150 USD/month. If she receives the requested loan from the fund, she won’t have to worry about buying animal feed on credit with high interest anymore.

loans.use: Buy pigs and food for them

loans.name: Thanh Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Vũ Thị Thanh năm nay 48 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 2 của Quỹ TYM. Chị có 3 người con trong đó một con còn đang đi học. Trước đây ngoài một năm cấy 2 vụ lúa hầu như chị không có nguồn thu nhập nào khác. Sau khi được vay vốn từ Quỹ chị Thanh đầu tư mua cói về dệt chiếu. Những đôi chiếu do chị dệt vừa dầy, vừa đẹp nên đông người đặt mua. Thu nhập hàng tháng từ việc dệt chiếu khoảng 120USD. Vòng vốn này chị Thanh đề nghị vay mức 450USD để mua cói dệt chiếu, ngoài ra chị còn mua thêm lợn nuôi.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Ms. Thanh Thi V., 58 years old this year, is a 2nd-year participant in the TYM Fund. She has 3 children, one of which is still in school. Before, besides working 2 harvest seasons of wheat each year, she had virtually no other income. After getting a loan from the fund, Ms. V. invested in buying sedge to weave mats. The mats she weaves are thick and pretty, so a lot of people place orders to buy them. Her income from the mat weaving business is about 120 USD. In this round of funding Ms. V. requests to borrow 450 USD to buy sedge; she also wants to buy more pigs to raise.

loans.use: Buy sedge and pigs

loans.name: Trang Thị

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Trang, 42 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2002. Cả 4 người con của chị đều đang trong độ tuổi đến trường. Vốn vay của Quỹ được chị đầu tư chủ yếu vào chăn nuôi gia súc. Số lượng gia súc chăn nuôi tăng theo cùng mức vốn vay qua các năm. Tiền lãi thu được bình quân mỗi tháng từ chăn nuôi khoảng 200USD. Bên cạnh đó, anh Chuyên chồng chị làm thợ xây có thu nhập hàng ngày nên luôn hỗ trợ vợ trong việc hoàn trả. Từ mức vốn vay ban đầu 50USD, vòng vốn này chị Trang đã mạnh dạn vay 625USD để mua trâu bò về chăn nuôi.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva Volunteer.

Ms. Trang Thi N., 42 years old, joined the fund in 2002. All four of her children are school-aged. The loan she obtained from the fund was used to invest mainly in raising cattle. The increase in the amount of cattle she raises each year varies with the loan amount she is able to obtain. The average revenue from the business is about 200 USD a month. In addition, her husband Chuyen works as a construction worker with a daily salary so he always assists her with the loan repayment. In contrast to the first loan of 50 USD, Ms. Trang is boldly requesting a loan of 625 USD in this funding round to buy cattle.

loans.use: Buy cattle

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Đào, 26 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2006. Chị có một con trai 2 tuổi. Mức vốn ban đầu 200USD được chị đầu tư buôn bán thịt lợn. Hiệu quả đồng vốn mang lại đã khuyến khích chị Đào vay các vòng tiếp theo. Vòng vốn thứ 3 chị đã kinh doanh thêm thịt gà và vịt. Bên cạnh đó chị cũng xây dựng hệ thống bếp bioga để tận dụng phân thải từ chuồng lợn. Cho đến nay chị Đào đã có cơ sở kinh doanh với số vốn là 2000USD. Với mức thu nhập là 200USD/tháng dự định trong thời gian tới chị sẽ vay số tiền 875USD để mua thêm lợn, gà.
Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva volunteer.
Ms. Dao Thi N., twenty-six years old, joined the fund in 2006.  She has only one son who is 2 years old.  She invested the first loan of 200 USD in a pork business.  The success that the loan brought encouraged Ms. N. to take more loans in subsequent funding rounds.  In the third round of funding she expanded her business into chicken and duck meat.  In addition, she also had a biogas stove system built to utilize the waste from the pig’s pen.  Until now Ms. N. has developed a business with a principal value of 2000 USD.  With a projected revenue of 200 USD/month in the near future, she will use the loan of $875 to buy more pigs and chicken.

loans.use: Buy pigs and chickens

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phan Thi Huong, 53 years old, joined the Fund since 2006. She is living with her husband and 3 grown-up children. At first, she used her borrowed money in retailing. Her profit, together with convenient repaying method of the Fund, motivate her to borrow more money. Since price for food has been going up, Mrs. H. wants to borrow 575 USD to buy cows and sell beef. She always wishes to be able to borrow large amount of money to expand her business. Her average income is 200 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Phan Thị Hồng, 53 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2006. Chị sống cùng chồng và 3 người con đều đã trưởng thành. Số vốn vay ban đầu của Quỹ được chị đầu tư buôn bán nhỏ. Lợi nhuận thu được cộng với sự thuận lợi trong cách hoàn trả khiến chị Hồng tiếp tục xin vay những vòng tiếp theo. Hiện nay giá thực phẩm ngày càng tăng cao, chị Hồng làm đơn xin vay 575USD để mua bò về làm thịt bán. Mong muốn của chị là được vay những mức vốn lớn để mở rộng kinh doanh. Thu nhập hàng tháng của chị Hồng là 200USD.

loans.use: Buy cows

loans.name: Chu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Chu Thi P., 60 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2006. She has 2 grown-up children. Her main activity is taking care of her general store. Her saving money, together with the first borrowed money of 200 USD, allowed Mrs. P. to buy goods for her store. Every month, she earns a profit of 130 USD. In addition to the profit from the store, her husband also receives pension. As a result, she can spend the money on improving living conditions and furnishing the house. This time, she wants to borrow 575 USD to buy more goods for her general store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Chu Thị Phúc, 60 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2006. Chị có hai người con đều đã trưởng thành. Công việc hiện nay của chị Phúc là bán hàng tạp hóa. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị Phúc xin vay 200USD cộng với vốn tự có mua hàng bán. Bình quân mỗi tháng chị lãi 130USD. Công việc tiến triển thuận lợi, ngoài lương hưu của chồng, gia đình cũng có thêm thu nhập cải thiện cuộc sống, mua sắm đồ đạc. Vòng vốn này chị làm đơn xin vay 575USD mua thêm hàng bán.

loans.use: Buy goods for her general store

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi M., 44 years old, joined the Fund since 2006. She has 3 children, 2 of which are still going to school. At first, she borrowed 200 USD and invested in buying tractor for rental to assist local people in practising agriculture. After buying the tractor, her work on the rice field was much less tiring. Her family also earned some profit from renting the tractor. Mrs. M. uses her profit from selling fruits in the market to repay. This time, she wants to borrow 575 USD to directly invest in selling fruits. She hopes to earn more income since she has more products to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị M., 44 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2006. 2 trong số 3 người con của chị còn đang trong độ tuổi đến trường. Số vốn vay 200USD ban đầu được chị M. đầu tư mua máy cày phục vụ sản xuất nông nghiệp cho gia đình và cho người dân trong vùng thuê. Sau khi có máy công việc đồng áng của chị M. trở nên thuận lợi hơn rất nhiều. Gia đình cũng có thêm được một khoản thu nhập khi có người thuê máy. Số tiền hoàn trả tuần được chị M. lấy từ số tiền lãi buôn bán hoa quả ngoài chợ. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 575USD đầu tư trực tiếp cho công việc buôn bán hoa quả. Với số lượng hàng bán tăng thêm chị hy vọng thu nhập sẽ được nâng lên.

loans.use: Buy fruits

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoang Thi D., 36 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2004. She has 2 children, one of which is 15 years old, the other is 18 years old. Her main activities are working on the rice field and breeding animals. At first, she used her borrowed money of 125 USD to breed pigs. She got a very good profit. Therefore, she continued to borrow 450 USD to buy buffalos to assist in practising agriculture. Her family economy improves gradually. She can send her children to good school and furnish her house. This time she wants to borrow 575 USD to buy pigs and chickens to breed. Her wish is to be a life-long member of the TYM Fund.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị Diện, 36 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2004. Chị có 2 con: 15 và 18 tuổi, cả hai đều đang đi học. Công việc chính của chị là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Năm đầu tiên tham gia Quỹ chị xin vay số tiền 125USD đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Kết quả sau vòng vốn đầu rất khả quan, chị tiếp tục xin vay 450USD mua trâu phục vụ sản xuất nông nghiệp. Kinh tế gia đình ngày càng phát triển, các con được ăn học tử tế, đồ đạc trong nhà chị Diện cũng được sắm sửa thêm nhiều. Vòng vốn này chị tiếp tục xin vay 575USD để mua lợn gà chăn nuôi. Mong muốn của chị Diện là được tham gia Quỹ lâu dài và mãi mãi.

loans.use: Buy pigs, chickens

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dang Thi P., 38 years old, is living with her husband and 4 children with their ages ranging from 3 to 13 years old. She joined the Fund since 1998. At first, she used her borrowed money of 50 USD to breed animals. Although the activity went well, she did not earn profit regularly. Therefore, she switched to rice-milling. She saved her profits and spent them on buying rice-husking machineto assist local people. Also, she shipped her husked rice into the city for the wholesale stores. Her average income every year is 2000-3000 USD. This time, she wants to borrow 950 USD to buy unhusked rice.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Đặng Thị Phượng, 38 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 4 người con từ 3 đến 13 tuổi. Chị bắt đầu tham gia Quỹ năm 1998. Số vốn vay ban đầu chỉ có 50USD được chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Công việc tuy cũng mang lại lợi nhuận nhưng thu nhập không thường xuyên. Các vòng vốn sau, chị chuyển sang làm hàng xáo. Số tiền lãi tích cóp qua các vòng được chị Phượng mua máy xát lúa phục vụ bà con nông thôn. Ngoài ra chị còn mua lúa xay xát rồi đưa ra thành phố nhập cho các đại lý gạo. Thu nhập bình quân hàng năm của chị lên đến 2000-3000USD. Vòng vốn này chị Phượng đề nghị xin vay 950USD để mua lúa về xay xát.

loans.use: Buy unhusked rice

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi D., 50 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2002. Her family has 5 members: 2 parents and 3 children who are still going to school. At first, she used her borrowed money in breeding pigs and chickens. Then, she realized she needed to do more activities to earn enough money to repay weekly. Therefore, Mrs. D. bought a rice-husking machine to assist local people. She spent the profit in sending her children to school. Currently, her oldest child is attending a university. Her wish is to raise her children to maturity. This time, she wants to borrow 950 USD to buy rice to husk and animal-feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Dũng năm nay 50 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2002. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 3 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Số vốn vay lần đầu được chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn gà. Sau khi kết thúc vòng vốn chị nhận thấy cần có thêm công việc cho thu nhập thường xuyên để hoàn trả tuần. Chị mua một máy xát lúa phục vụ bà con trên địa bàn. Số lãi thu được chị Dũng đầu tư cho các con ăn học. Hiện nay người con đầu của chị đang theo học đại học. Mong ước của chị Dũng là được thấy cả 3 con của mình trưởng thành, có công ăn việc làm tử tế. Mức vốn của chị Dũng đề nghị vòng này là 950USD mua lúa xay xát và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy rice to husk and animal-feed

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi C., 35 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2003. She is living with her husband and 2 children, one of which is 10 years old and the other is 7. At first, she used her borrowed money in breeding pigs and the business went very well. Therefore, she continued to used borrowed money in this projects. Every year, she sold 3-4 farrows of pigs, earning 500-700 USD/farrow. Her family economy improves. She can now furnish her house and send her children to good school. Nowadays, since the price for building materials is going up, she wants to borrow 950 USD to buy brick-making machine to increase her income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Cường, 35 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2003. Chị sống cùng chồng và 2 con: 10 và 7 tuổi. Sau vòng vốn đầu tiên đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn có hiệu quả, các vòng vốn sau chị tiếp tục đầu tư cho dự án này. Một năm chị bán 3-4 lứa lợn, mỗi lứa cho thu nhập từ 500-700USD. Kinh tế gia đình phát triển, chị Cường mua sắm thêm được những vật dụng có giá trị trong gia đình và cho các con ăn học đến nơi đến chốn. Hiện nay khi giá nguyên vật liệu xây dựng đang tăng cao, chị Cường quyết định xin vay 950USD mua máy làm gạch tăng thêm thu nhập.

loans.use: Buy machine to make bricks

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi L., 37 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 1998. Her family has 4 members: 2 parents and 2 children who are still going to school. At first, she usually invested borrowed money in general store. These days, since the price for building materials has gone up and since she is able to borrowed a larger amount of money from the Fund, Mrs. L. switches to doing business in building materials. Besides, she also sells fuel and gas. Her current average income is 250 USD/month. Her wish is to be continually assisted by the TYM Fund to improve her business. This time, she wants to borrow 625 USD to buy more materials.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị L., 37 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1998. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Thời gian đầu chị L. thường vay vốn buôn bán hàng tạp hóa. Công việc này có thu nhập thường xuyên rất thuận lợi cho việc hoàn trả tuần. Trong những năm gần đây khi giá nguyên vật liệu xây dựng đang tăng cộng với được vay những mức vốn lớn từ Quỹ, chị L. chuyển sang kinh doanh vật liệu xây dựng. Bên cạnh đó chị còn bán thêm mặt hàng xăng dầu. Thu nhập hàng tháng hiện nay của chị là 250USD. Mong muốn của chị L. là được Quỹ hỗ trợ vốn lâu dài để phát triển công việc kinh doanh. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị vòng này là 625USD mua vật liệu.

loans.use: Buy building materials

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi M., 49 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 1997. Because her 5 children are all going to school, her life is very difficult. At first, she used her borrowed money in breeding pigs. Later on, she used both her saving money and borrowed money from the TYM Fund to buy 1 rice-husking machine to assist local people. This new activity helps increasing Mrs. M.’s income significantly. Her current average income is 220 USD. Since the cost to send her children to school increases, she wants to borrow 575 USD to buy more rice to husk.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Mỹ, 49 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 1997. Cả 5 người con của chị đều đang đi học nên chị Mỹ rất vất vả. Thời gian đầu được vay mức vốn thấp chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Sau khi tích cóp được một số tiền cộng với vốn vay từ Quỹ, chị mua 1 máy xát lúa để phục vụ bà con trong vùng. Với công việc mới này thu nhập của chị Mỹ tăng lên rõ rệt. Bình quân một tháng chị thu khoảng 220USD. Các con càng học lên cao, chi phí càng tăng nên chị Mỹ quyết định vay thêm 575USD để mua lúa về xay xát tăng thêm thu nhập.

loans.use: Buy rice

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoang Thi T., 51 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 1997. Two among 4 of her chilren are still going to school. At first, Mrs. T. used 100 USD borrowed from the Fund to breed pigs. Then, since her house is now facing the National Road, she decides to invest in opening food shop and general store. Because of good location, she has a lot of customers. Her current average income is 220 USD/ month. This time, she wants to borrow 625 USD to buy more food.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị T., 51 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 1997. 2 trong số 4 người con của chị đang đi học. Số tiền 100USD vay ở vòng đầu tiên được chị T. đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Sau một thời gian, nhà nước mở đường quốc lộ đi qua trước nhà, chị vay vốn lớn đầu tư kinh doanh ăn uống và bán hàng tạp hóa. Nhờ địa thế thuận lợi nên rất đông khách đến với cửa hàng. Thu nhập hàng tháng hiện nay của gia đình là 220USD. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 625USD để mua thực phẩm làm hàng.

loans.use: Buy food

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Ngô Thị Liên is 51, she joined TYM fund in 2006. She lives in Hưng Tây, Hưng Nguyên with her husband and their 2 children. Her first loan was used to buy ducks for laying eggs. But because of the bird flu scare, she has switched to raising cows. The money made from this business enables her to provide good education for her 2 children: they're attending university. Her monthly income is 220 USD. This time she is requesting a loan of 750 USD to buy calves.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Ngô Thị Liên, 51 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2006. Chị sống cùng chồng và 2 người con tại xã Hưng Tây, Hưng Nguyên. Vòng đầu tiên chị vay 200USD từ Quỹ để đầu tư nuôi vịt đẻ. Sau một thời gian khi có dịch cúm gia cầm chị Liên chuyển sang chăn nuôi trâu bò. Lãi thu được chị dùng mua sắm đồ đạc và đầu tư cho hai con đang học đại học. Thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng của chị Liên hiện nay là 220USD. Vòng vốn tới chị tiếp tục xin vay 750USD mua trâu bò.

loans.use: Buy calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase of meat and other goods for a small cafeteria

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase empanada ingredients and bulk clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock of alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her clothing inventory and increase her sales volume

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase meat to produce fried food for a small business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth is asking for this loan to invest in the construction of a bedroom in her house. She lives in Nicaragua in Nueva Guinea of the Región Autónoma del Atlántico Sur (RAAS), and has 3 young children in primary school.

Elizabeth earns a living selling clothing. She is a hard-working woman who struggles daily to provide for her family and by doing so offer a better life to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Elizabeth solicita su crédito para invertirlo en la construción de un dormitorio en su casa de habitación. Habita en Nueva Guinea de la Region Autónoma del Atlántico Sur (RAAS), tiene 3 hijos menores de edad, los cuales se encuentran estudiando la educación primaria.

Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de ropa, es una mujer muy trabajadora que diariamente lucha por el desarrollo de su familia, y de esta forma tener una mejor vida que ofrecerle s sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of Construction Materials to Build a Bedroom

loans.name: Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Auxiliadora is a single woman, and along with her children is struggling to get ahead in life. She lives in the Nicaraguan Department of Nueva Guinea. She works as a baker, and also receives other income from field work, selling dairy products, and fattening swine.

She is a member of the cooperative COASCEMVIDE, is hardworking and entrepreneurial and needs some help in order to improve her living conditions. Auxiliadora is asking for this loan over 24 months to invest in the construction of her kitchen because it is in poor condition and she needs to improve it.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Auxiliadora es una mujer soltera, luchadora para salir adelante con sus hijos. Habita en el departamento de Nueva Guinea. Trabaja realizando hornado, también recibe otros ingreso del trabajo en el campo, vende productos lacteos y engorda cerdo.

Esta señora es miembro de la cooperativa COASCEMVIDE, ella es una mujer trabajadora, emprededora que necesita salir adelante para mejorar su condiciones de vida. Doña Auxiliadora está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en la construción de la cocina, ya que está en malas condiciones y necesita mejorarla, a un plazo de 24 meses.

loans.use: Construction of Kitchen in her Home

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco is looking for a loan to invest in improvements for his house, such as plastering walls and adding a floor. For the past sixteen years, he has worked as a security guard at the Jacinto Hernández Hospital. He also dedicates himself to farming on a small lot, an activity he conducts on the weekends and on his days off. Despite not having the opportunity to attend school, he has been a hardworking and responsible man who has worked in the country to obtain basic food necessities to augment the small income he earns. He has five daughters and one son, all of whom are in school. His wife works at a packing plant and helps with the household expenses. His dreams are to have a dignified dwelling and that his children finish their educations so they can become professionals and find stable employment.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Francisco está solictando el crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, como es repellar y poner piso a su casa de habitación. Trabaja para el hospital Jacinto Hernández como guarda de seguridad desde hace 16 años, tambien se dedica a cultivar diversos cultivos en una pequeña parcela los fines de semana y los dias libres que tiene. A pesar que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ha sido un hombre trabajador y responsable que ha trabajado en el campo para así obtener los alimentos básicos como apoyo a los ingresos que él obtiene, tiene 5 hijas mujeres y 1 hijo varón, actualmente todos están estudiando. Su esposa trabaja en una empresa empacadora de quequisque y aporta con los gastos del hogar. Su sueño es tener una vivienda digna que la familia amerita, y que sus hijos estudien para que en el futuro lleguen a ser profesionales de bien y tengan estabilidad laboral.

loans.use: Plaster the walls and install a floor in his house.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Cenelia Maria

texts.es:
Cenelia María is seeking her third loan, with which she hopes to build a bedroom. For the past five years, this young woman has worked in the Ministry of Education in the colony of La Fonseca, at the Rafaela Herrera School. Currently, she is in her second year of studies at the URACCAN University. She has a two year old baby. Each day, Cenelia has to travel for two hours on foot because she teaches classes to children in another region. She is asking for a loan to be able to build another room in her house and that way improve the living conditions of her family. Despite the fact that she is a single mother, she is very responsible and enterprising and struggles so that her daughter does not go without. Her dreams are to have work stability, a dignified home and, most of all, good health.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Cenelia María está solicitando su tercer refinanciamiento, con el cual pretende construir una habitación, esta joven trabaja para el Ministerio de Educación en la colonia la Fonseca en la Escuela Rafaela Herrera desde hace 5 años, actualmente esta estudiando 2do año en la Universidad URACCAN, tiene una bebita de 2 años, Cenelia todos los días tiene que viajar a 2 horas de camino a pie ya que da clase a niños de una comarca. Está solicitando este prestamo para así construir una habitación y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, a pesar que es una madre soltera es muy responsable y emprendedora que lucha para que a su hija no le falte nada, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral, una vivienda digna y salud sobre todo.

loans.use: Construction of a bedroom.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Creativity and determination best define Jorge, a young 23-year-old entrepreneur who, thanks to his talents, has become the owner of a small carpentry workshop. This industrious young man makes office, kitchen and bedroom furniture according to the preferences and requirements of his demanding clients. But this hard-working young man feels he still has a lot to learn so that he is able to apply his knowledge to the furniture he makes. This is why he needs to set up his workshop and have more raw materials so that he can offer his clients a greater range of high-quality products. With this goal in mind, Jorge is asking for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La creatividad y empeño son las principales características de Jorge, joven emprendedor de 23 años que gracias a su habilidad se ha convertido en propietario de un pequeño taller de carpintería. Este diligente joven elabora muebles para oficina, cocina y dormitorios de acuerdo al gusto y requerimiento de sus exigentes clientes. Pero este laborioso joven siente que aún tiene mucho que aprender para al mismo tiempo plasmar sus conocimientos en cada mueble que elabora, para ello necesita implementar su taller y contar con mayor materia prima, para ofrecerles una inmensa gama de productos de óptima calidad a sus clientes. Con esa intención Jorge desea obtener tu apoyo.

loans.use: To set up his small workshop and buy more raw materials.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria has always been a hard-working woman who has wants to send her three dear children to college. Since beginning her family, she has always thought about getting ahead and helping her family prosper. This is why she began selling food and opened a small stand to sell candy and soft drinks. Every day she sells her goods until late at night so that she can sell the most that she can. Gregoria has her small candy stand in a strategic location of which she wants to take full advantage. This is why she wants to increase the variety and stock of her goods.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Gregoria, siempre fue una mujer emprendedora con el gran deseo de ofrecerle estudios superiores a sus 3 queridos hijos. Desde que formó su familia tuvo en mente salir adelante y prosperar junto a su familia, es por ello que se dedica a la venta de comida y al mismo tiempo posee un puestito de venta de golosinas y bebidas gaseosas en el que también se desempeña diariamente para ofrecer sus productos hasta altas horas de la noche con el fin de vender la mayor cantidad de mercadería posible.El puestito de venta de golosinas de doña Gregoria es muy estratégico, es por ello que desea sacarle mayor provecho, para ello tiene pensado aumentar la variedad y el stock de mercadería.

loans.use: A loan to be able to offer more goods.

loans.name: Inés

texts.es:
Ines is an upbeat and hard-working woman, characteristics she had even as a teenager. After she began her own family, she became the bread-winner in the household. She has four small children, who are the reason she works so hard and why, after separating from her husband, she had to become both mother and father. She is dedicated and gives the best of herself to get the best out of her work. More than 15 years ago she began buying and selling candles and cardboard. Thanks to her noble work, she is able to give her little ones all they need.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Inés, es una dama muy alegre y emprendedora, desde joven demostró tener un gran espíritu laborioso, es por ello que una vez que formó su familia se convirtió en el sostén económico más importante de su hogar.Inés es madre de 4 menores hijos, quienes son la razón de su perseverancia y diligencia y desde que se separó de su esposo se convirtió en padre y madre de sus hijos, por quienes se esfuerza y pone lo mejor de sí para salir siempre airosa en las labores a las que está consagrada, hace más de 15 años viene dedicándose a la compra y venta de velas y cartones, gracias a estas nobles labores puede mantener sin privaciones a sus queridos retoños.

loans.use: A loan to be able to offer more goods.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
Herminia comes from a humble family. Her economic independence when she was young made her into a self-assured woman ready to achieve what she sets out to do out of love for her five small children. She works buying and selling bread and candles and above all recycling cardboard, which she then sells to a plant that makes liquor and crackers. Herminia wants a loan so that she can increase her revenue. She feels that this investment will improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Herminia, proviene de una familia muy humilde, su independencia económica desde niña la convirtió en una mujer segura de sí mismo dispuesta a alcanzar lo que se propone por amor a sus 5 menores hijos.Está dedicada a la compra y venta de pan, velas y sobre todo a reciclar cartones, mercadería que luego de reunir una buena cantidad los ofrece a una fábrica de licores y galletas.El deseo de Herminia es obtener un préstamo para aumentar el monto de su capital, considera que haciendo esta inversión mejorará sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: An injection of funds to increase stock.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
Nicolasa is a warm-hearted woman. After her beloved husband passed away, she took over her household and had to take care of the upbringing and wellbeing of her children, who are the main driving force behind her desire to keep living. This hard-working mother sells candy, soft drinks and fruit from a cart, but recently there hasn’t been much demand for her goods, which is why she has decided to support her son in his auto shop while her sales pick up. In the meantime, she wants to add more variety to her merchandise. Nicolsa feels that an investment will improve her quality of life and that of the family she so loves.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Nicolasa, es una mujer muy amorosa. Desde que falleció su querido esposo tomó las riendas de su hogar y se hizo cargo de la educación y bienestar de sus hijos, quienes son el principal motor que la impulsa a seguir adelante perseverando en la vida.Esta diligente madre se dedica a la venta de golosinas, bebidas gaseosas y frutas en forma ambulatoria, pero por estos meses su negocio no tiene mucha demanda es por ello que decidió apoyar a su hijo en su taller mecánico mientras mejoren las ventas de su negocio, pero para entonces desea aumentar la variedad de su mercadería, Nicolasa considera que haciendo esta inversión mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su amada familia.

loans.use: An injection of funds to boost business.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
The years of experience in this business have served Mrs. Eulalia by enabling her to make herself a prosperous merchant of groceries, thanks to this trade she has been able to take care of her 2 children (whom she has been in charge of since her dear husband passed away) without economic deprivation and has allowed them to learn their studies. She is a diligent mother who has a small shop in the Cerro Colorado market in the city of Juliaca and she desires to increase the variety and quantity of her merchandise to please the demanding regular customers.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Los años de experiencia en este negocio, le ha servido a doña Eulalia de experiencia para convertirse en una próspera comerciante de abarrotes, gracias a este oficio logró mantener sin privaciones económicas y brindarles estudios superiores a sus 2 hijos quienes quedaron a su cargo desde que su querido esposo falleció.Esta diligente madre tiene un pequeño puesto de ventas en el mercado Cerro Colorado de su ciudad natal Juliaca y desea aumentar la variedad y tener en stock sus insumos de primera necesidad para complacer a sus exigentes y asiduos clientes.

loans.use: To increase her capital to offer a better quantity of articles of necessity.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
Amanda, is a loving and responsible mother of four little children, a few months ago she separated from her husband. Her desire is to keep her children united and without deprivation, nowadays they are suffering because of the absence of their father. She is straining and is ready to give more of herself so that her family can grow, it is because of this and with a lot of diligence that she dedicates herself to the selling things, additionally a few months ago she began the purchase and sale of cardboard, thanks to her desire to prosper her efforts are becoming worthwhile.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Amanda, es una amorosa y responsable madre de cuatro menores niños, hace algunos meses se separó de su esposo. Su deseo es mantener unidos y sin privaciones a sus hijos quienes actualmente vienen sufriendo por la ausencia de su padre.Ella viene esforzándose y está dispuesta a dar lo mejor de sí para que su familia siga adelante, es por ello que con mucha diligencia se dedica al comercio de artículos por campañas, adicionalmente a esta labor hace algunos meses inició la compra y venta de cartones, gracias a su entusiasmo por prosperar afortunadamente las cosas le van resultando rentable

loans.use: To increase her capital to strengthen her activities.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda is 34 years old, ever since starting her family she has been dedicated to the sale of quinua juices, delicious and nutritional nectars that she offers from 5 to 8:30 AM, seeing that the expenses of her family were increasing, she decided to prepare a space in her home to open a small grocery store, thanks to the income that she obtained with her business she is able to cover the expenses of her home and the education of her children. Mrs. Hilda has big plans to better her little store, but she doesn’t have sufficient funds to make that happen, she hopes she will receive your help. Be an important part of the progress of this business and this family.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Hilda de 34 años de edad, desde que formó su familia estuvo dedicada a la venta de jugo de quinua, delicioso y nutritivo néctar que ofrece desde las 5.00 hasta las 8.30 de la mañana, al ver que se fue incrementando sus gastos familiares decidió acondicionar un espacio de vivienda para abrir e implementar su tiendita de abarrotes, gracias a los ingresos que obtiene con este negocio está logrando cubrir los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos.Doña Hilda tiene grandes planes para mejorar su bodeguita, pero no cuenta con suficiente presupuesto para concretarlo, ella espera recibir tu colaboración. Sé parte importante del progreso de este negocio y esta familia.

loans.use: An injection of capital to convert her small grocery store into one of the best.

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es:
Yeny, is a young mother who is very hardworking and dedicated, she comes from a family of livestock producers, her parents love the countryside and their work in it, additionally from this work they would make delicious cheese that they would sell in the different markets in the city of Puno. When Yeny decided to move to the city of Juliaca with her husband and brother she didn’t want to lose this custom, with this idea she put into action her project to open a small cheese plant where she could make about 25 cheeses a day, and later they will market them and send them to the cities of Arequipa and Cuzco, Yeny’s desire is to implement her factory.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Yeny, es una joven madre muy trabajadora y dedicada, proveniente de una familia de productores de ganado, sus padres aman el campo y el trabajo en ella, adicionalmente a esta labor elaboraban deliciosos quesos que ofertaban en los distintos mercados del departamento de Puno.Una vez que Yeny decidió radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca junto a su esposo y hermano no quiso perder esta costumbre, con ese fin pusieron en marcha su proyecto de abrir su pequeña planta quesera en donde elaboran diariamente alrededor de 25 quesos, que luego los despachan para comercializarlos a las ciudades de Arequipa y Cuzco, el deseo de Yeny es implementar aun más su fábrica.

loans.use: Enlargement and Implementation of her small workspace.

loans.name: Liza

texts.es:
Liza, is a young, happy and very entrepreneurial woman of 20 years, native of the city of Puno, nowadays she lives in the city of Juliaca together with her dear cousins with whom she decided to start a business selling cereals, additionally she works part time as a secretary in a military academy. The desire she has is to obtain a loan so that she can increase the capital of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Liza, es una joven alegre y muy emprendedora de 20 años de edad, natural de la ciudad de Puno, actualmente vive en la ciudad de Juliaca junto a sus queridos primos con quienes decidió emprender el negocio de venta de cereales, adicionalmente a este negocio trabaja medio tiempo como secretaria en una academia militar. El deseo que tiene es obtener un préstamo para aumentar el capital de su negocio.

loans.use: To increase her capital so that she can offer a better quantity of cereals.

loans.name: Faavae

texts.en:
Faavae F., 58, is married with 5 children. Her husband is one of the chief council members of her village. She has 5 years of experience in the taro and bananas business. She sells to the village community at the Fugalei market 3 days per week.

She has 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD). SPBD loans are Faavae’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase replacement equipment for her business. Part of the loan will also be used to support her children's school expenses.

loans.name: Águeda

texts.es:
From the time she gave her daughters the gift of life, Mrs. Agueda made an effort to succeed with her business of selling hats that she makes herself with a lot of diligence and with the help of her younger daughters whom are her reason for being. Agueda is a native of the province of Melgar, but for the last 6 years she has been in the city of Juliaca, she left her native town with a lot of expectations of prospering and offering a better quality of life to her young children whom are her motivation to keep on going, thanks to her enthusiasm and good will that she demonstrates in her activities, the diligent mother is succeeding in meeting her goal of a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde que les otorgó el don de la vida a sus hijas doña Águeda se esfuerza y persevera aún más en su negocio de venta de golosinas y gorras que ella misma con mucha diligencia confecciona con apoyo de sus menores hijas quienes se convirtieron en su razón de ser. Águeda es natural de la provincia de Melgar, pero hace 6 años radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, salió de su pueblo natal con muchas expectativas de prosperar y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus menores hijas quienes son el motor que la impulsa a seguir adelante, gracias al entusiasmo y buena voluntad que pone en sus actividades esta diligente madre está logrando concretar su anhelo de mejorar su condición de vida.

loans.use: To increase her capital to make a better quantity of hats.

loans.name: Karoline

texts.en:
Karoline G., 42, is married with 4 children. Her husband works night security at the Faleolo Airport. She has 3 years of experience in the taro and bananas business. She sells to village members at the Fugalei market (main market of Apia) 3 days per week.

She has 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD). SPBD loans are Karoline’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase shovel, wheel barrow, bushknife, chemicals and weed killer.

loans.name: Fidela

texts.es:
Keeping her family together and without deprivation is the aim of Fidelia and her dear husband Melquíades, who works diligently as a master of construction while Fidelia works making beautiful and colorful ponchos, sweaters, caps and gloves that are sold at the San José y Laguna Temporal market in the city of Juliaca, in which they live. In order to perform her work, she currently has 2 weaving machines but right now she needs to acquire a larger quantity of raw material (wool) to continue making her beautiful garments so that she can fulfill the all of her clients' orders, which makes her feel very satisfied with her work.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Mantener a su familia unida y sin privaciones es el fin de Fidela y su querido esposo Melquíades, quien labora diligentemente como maestro de construcción.En tanto doña Fidela se dedica a confeccionar hermosos y coloridos ponchos, chompas, chullos y guantes que son vendidos en el mercado San José y Laguna Temporal de la ciudad donde radica, Juliaca.Para realizar su trabajo actualmente cuenta con 2 máquinas de tejer, pero en estos momentos requiere adquirir mayor materia prima (lana) para seguir confeccionando sus hermosas prendas y así cumplir con la gama de solicitudes de sus clientes, que para su satisfacción se sienten complacidos con su trabajo.

loans.use: Increasing capital in order to buy a larger quantity of raw material

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en:
Makerita P., 56, is married with 7 children. Her husband is a very experienced fisherman. She has 5 years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to village members at the Fugalei market (main market in Apia) 3 days per week.

She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). SPBD loans are Makerita’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Cover business overhead costs.

loans.name: Elba

texts.es:
Elba is a constant example of dedication and devotion. Ever since living in Juliaca she has worked hard so that her two daughters don't suffer from economic deprivation and can continue their university studies without worry. Currently, Elba has a candy kiosk located insiD. an education center located in Juliaca. In addition to this business, she, along with her dear niece, make delicious chocolates and picocas of quinoa that they distribute to be sold in various grocery stores in her town. Elba's wish is to have more capital to invest into her business and that's precisely why she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Elba, es un ejemplo constante D. dedicación y entrega, desD. que radica en la ciudad D. Juliaca trabaja arduamente con el fin D. que sus 2 hijas no pasen privaciones económicas y puedan seguir sin preocupaciones sus estudios superiores.Actualmente Elba tiene un quiosco D. golosinas ubicado al interior D. un centro educativo D. dicha ciudad, adicionalmente a este negocio en sociedad con su querida sobrina se dedica a elaborar deliciosos chocolates y picocas D. quinua que distribuyen para ser vendidas en las diferentes bodeguitas D. su localidad.El deseo D. Elba es contar con mayor capital e invertirlo en su negocio, precisamente a esta razón atienD. su solicitud D. préstamo.

loans.use: Injection of capital to increase her production

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina has always been a very responsible woman in her household. In her noble profession as an artisan she makes beautiful and elegant ponchos for women and bedspreads for babies. Thanks to her agile and talented hands she is managing to fulfill the weekly requests from her customers. In addition to this work, on Sundays and Mondays he works selling American-style clothing though which she earns extra income that allows her to live peacefully with her dear youngest son Enrique, who is 9 years old. Agustina's wish is to buy more raw material (wool) in order to increase the volume of production of her beautiful, intricate hand-woven garments.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Agustina, siempre demostró ser una mujer muy responsable en su hogar, con sus hijos y en su noble oficio como artesana, elabora manualmente hermosos y elegantes ponchos para damas y colchas para bebés, gracias a sus ágiles y talentosas manos está logrando cumplir satisfactoriamente con las solicitudes que semanalmente le hacen sus clientes, Adicionalmente a esta labor los días domingos y lunes se dedica a la venta de ropa americana, negocio mediante el cual también obtiene ingresos extras que le permite vivir en tranquilidad a lado de su querido y menor hijo Enrique de 9 añitos de edad.El deseo de Agustina es contar con mayor materia prima ( lana) para aumentar el volumen de producción de sus hermosas prendas tejidas manualmente con finísimos detalles.

loans.use: Increasing capital in order to buy more raw material

loans.name: Ana Magdaly

texts.es:
Mrs. Magdaly O. is a marvelous example for many: she has shown that with great effort, one can get ahead to better provide for her home. Barely two years ago, she launched a small general store out of her home in the Condega neighborhood in the city of Esteli. Since then, she has expanded her business and improved her own economic conditions. She now sells a number of different products, including food, personal and household items.

Ceprodel has played a very important role in the development of her business. It has provided Magdaly with loans to purchase products to sell in her store. Magdaly is currently seeking such a loan in order to buy these products and sell them in her general store.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

La señora Magdaly O. es un gran ejemplo para muchas personas debido a que apenas dos años inicio con un pequeño negocio de pulpería en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí y hoy en día ha logrado mejorar su condición económica habiendo hecho que el negocio se expandiera por lo que ahora comercializa todo tipo de productos tales como comestibles, personales y productos de casa. De esta manera ha logrado demostrar que con muchos esfuerzos se puede llegar a mejorar la situación económica para el mantenimiento del hogar.

Ceprodel ha sido un factor muy importante para el desarrollo de su negocio por lo que le ha beneficiado con créditos que los ha invertido para la compra de los productos para el negocio. Actualmente solicita un crédito para adquirir sus productos y así comercializarlos en su negocio de pulpería en el municipio de Condega.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
Ángela is a very hard-working woman. Her 8 children were and are the reason for her effort. Since she formed her family she has been in the business of selling clothing for children, men and women in the fairs in the various towns around the city of Juliaca while her dear husband has a business selling books. In her free time Ángela, like all mothers concerned about their children, tries to look for ways to bring in extra income whether it be helping in food preparation in restaurants or cleaning. Both parents strive and put forward their best effort to give their dear children the necessary wellbeing, education and other tools to be able to achieve success in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Ángela es una mujer muy trabajadora, sus 8 hijos fueron y son la razón de su esfuerzo, desde que formó su familia se dedica a la venta de ropas para niños, caballeros y damas, en las ferias de los distintos pueblitos de la ciudad donde radica Juliaca, en tanto su querido esposo hace lo propio con su negocio de venta de libros.En sus horas libres doña Ángela como toda madre preocupada por los suyos trata de buscar la manera de llevar al hogar ingresos extras, ya sea apoyando en la preparación de alimentos en los restaurantes o haciendo la limpieza.Ambos padres se esfuerzan y ponen lo mejor de sí con el fin de otorgarles bienestar, educación y las herramientas necesarias a sus queridos hijos, para que más adelante puedan alcanzar el éxito.

loans.use: Increasing her capital to offer a larger quantity of clothing

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
The business of selling candies has become the main source of income for the family of Filomena, who has been doing this for 9 years. Her kiosk is located at the Santa Catalina elementary school in Juliaca. In addition to this business, on the weekend she sells second-hand clothing. Thanks to these two businesses Filomena is managing to take care of the most urgent necessities in her household, but she is sure that by making some investments in her candy business she will increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de venta de golosinas se ha convertido en el ingreso económico más importante de la familia de doña Filomena, quien desde hace 9 años viene dedicándose a esta actividad, su puestito está ubicado en las instalaciones del centro educativo primario “Santa Catalina” de la ciudad de Juliaca; adicionalmente a este negocio los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de ropa de segundo uso, gracias a estas dos actividades doña Filomena está logrando cubrir las necesidades más urgentes de su hogar, pero está segura que haciendo algunas inversiones en su negocio de golosinas mejorarán sus ingresos.

loans.use: Increase in capital in order to offer a larger quantiy of candy

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es:
In the Condega neighborhood in the city of Estelí, you can find Luis G. working his hardest in an effort to improve his family's living conditions. Luis has been able to get ahead thanks to his hard work.

Today, in an effort to provide his children with a better quality of life, Luis has decided to rebuild his house, which has been in need of repairs for some time now. He has already rebuilt part of the house, but lacks the economic resources to complete reconstruction on the other part of the house.

Luis is requesting this loan from Ceprodel in order to buy the construction materials he needs to complete his home repairs. It should be noted that Luis has been a reliable client for Ceprodel, having repaid all of his previous loans in the agreed-upon form and time frame.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

En el municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí, el caballero Luis G. se dedica arduamente a su negocio con el objetivo de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia el cual necesita de él para subsistir. Es de suma necesidad que este señor ha logrado salir adelante gracias a sus grandes esfuerzos. Hoy en día al estar consciente del deber de brindarle a sus hijos un mejor nivel de vida ha decidido iniciar con la reconstrucción de su casa de habitación el cual ha estado en mal estado por mucho tiempo. Al haber iniciado esta labor ha logrado reparar parte de su vivienda sin embargo la otra parte aun no la ha iniciado por el hecho de la ausencia del recurso económico.

Hoy en día ha buscado el apoyo crediticio en Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con el crédito necesario que le permita la compra de los materiales de construcción para continuar con su reparación de su casa de habitación. Es necesario destacar que ella es una fiel cliente de Cerprodel habiendo cancelado todos sus créditos en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Peata

texts.en: Peata S., 35, is married with 4 children.  Her husband does much of the farming. She has 4 years of experience in the taro & bananas business. She sells to the village community at the Fugalei market 3 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Peata’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Loan will be used mostly to pay for labor, and also to replace all the equipment for her project.

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
Juana Isabel is 56 years old and is single with 4 children; one of them is still dependent on her. She receives support for the schooling of one of her children from the father. She works as a general cashier in the Juigalpa City Hall, and has worked there for 8 years. She will use this loan to complete the construction of a floor at her house before winter starts, because her house gets flooded from the rains. By doing this, she wants to prevent contamination and sickness in her children, especially for her 5 year-old.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Juana Isabel tiene 56 años de edad, es soltera, con 4 hijos, uno de ellos ya es independiente a ella. Recibe apoyo para el estudio de uno de sus hijos por parte del padre. Ella trabaja como cajera general en la Alcaldia de Juigalpa, tiene 8 años de laborar para esta institución. Este crédito lo utilizará para finalizar la construcción de una cera en su casa antes de que empiece el invierno porque su casa se le llena de agua por las corrientes, de esta manera quiere evitar contaminacion y enfermedad para sus hijos, sobre todo para el niño de 5 años.

loans.use: Complete construction of the floor in her home

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca is a humble and self-assured woman. For as long as she can remember, she has seen the necessity of working and earning her own income. Currently, with diligence and dedication, she is engaged in two activities, the weaving of gorgeous caps and scarves that she sells in the Sunday market in Juliaca and the selling of American-style clothing and stuffed animals. With these two business she is managing to get ahead and provide an education for her little daughter, Cristina, for whom she has the dream of some day building a house in order to live in the security and warmth of her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.
