Francisca, es una mujer humilde y segura de sí misma, desde que tuvo uso de razón se vio en la necesidad de trabajar y generar sus propios ingresos económicos, actualmente con diligencia y disciplina viene dedicándose a dos actividades, al tejido de hermosas gorras, chullos y chalinas que comercializa en el mercado dominical de la ciudad de Juliaca; al mismo tiempo al negocio de venta de ropas y peluches americanos.Con estos dos negocios está logrando salir adelante y ofrecerle educación a su pequeña niña, Cristina, con quien sueña algún día construir su morada y vivir bajo la seguridad y el calor de su propio hogar.

loans.use: Increasing her business capital in order to offer more products

loans.name: Santos Estela

texts.es:
Mrs. Santos Estela Q., or "Estelita," runs a tortilla making and selling business out of her home in the Condega neighborhood of the city of Esteli. She is married and has a young son; she says that her desire to take care of him is the driving force behind her hard work.

Estelita will soon need to invest in more raw materials for her tortilla making business. She hopes to obtain this loan from Ceprodel in order to buy firewood and corn for her business. She has been a reliable client to Ceprodel in the past; all of her previous loans have been repaid in full.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

La señora Santos Estela Q. conocida comúnmente como Estelita labora en su negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí. Es una madre casada y con un pequeño hijo que mantener el cual según comenta él es el motivo de sus grandes esfuerzos en el negocio.

La necesidad que hoy en día atraviesa el negocio de venta de tortillas de la señora Estelita es la pronta inversión en materia prima para la elaboración de dichas tortillas por esta razón es que espera que Ceprodel le apruebe la solicitud de crédito el cual según comenta lo utilizara para la compra del maíz y leña para el negocio. Actualmente ella es fiel cliente de Ceprodel habiendo cancelado todos sus créditos anteriores satisfactoriamente.

loans.use: Buy corn and firewood to make tortillas

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Mrs. Sabina is from the province of Melgar. About 12 years ago she decided to leave her town with her infant child in search of a better life. Since then she has resided in the city of Juliaca where she makes beautiful underskirts and sweaters using the knowledge she acquired as a child from her mother. She sells these products at fairs around the city. Upon realizing that she could not cover the school costs for her beloved son, she was forced out of necessity to foray into another business in order to obtain additional income. With the help of family and friends she now sells clothing in neighboring towns. Sabina’s wish is to continue to get ahead and to expand her market which is why she is calling upon you gracious people for support.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Sabina, es natural de la provincia de Melgar, hace más de 12 años decidió partir de su pueblo con su pequeño niño en brazos en busca de un mejor porvenir, desde entonces radica en la ciudad de Juliaca plasmando los conocimientos que de niña adquirió de su querida madre quien con diligencia al igual que ella elabora hermosas enaguas y chompas para damas para comercializarlas en las ferias de su localidad.Al ver que ya no podía cubrir los gastos de educación de su querido hijo se vio en la necesidad de incursionar en otros negocios que le permitieran obtener ingreso extras, es así que con el apoyo de algunos familiares y amistades viene dedicándose a la venta de ropa en los pueblitos aledaños a la ciudad donde radica, el deseo de Sabina es seguir progresando y ampliando su mercado, es por ello que recurre a tu gentil persona para solicitar tu apoyo.

loans.use: Increase in capital to increase products offered.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Ms. Maria has a lot of love for the land where she was born so she gives her thanks by acting for its benefit through a variety of organizations. For a long time she has dedicated herself to farming and raising livestock in order to support the members of her family. A recent initiative by a group of mothers to establish a guinea pig farm for export has motivated her to request a loan to retrofit a space to raise guinea pigs herself.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maria siente mucho amor por la tierra que la vio nacer y en agradecimiento actúa en beneficio de ella a través de diversas organizaciones. Durante mucho tiempo se ha dedicado a las labore agrícolas y ganaderas para sostener con satisfacción a los miembros de su hogar. La reciente iniciativa de un grupo de madres por establecer una granja de exportación de cuyes la ha motivado a integrarse y solicitar un préstamo para el acondicionamiento de un espacio de crianza.

loans.use: Establishing a space for breeding guinea pigs.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Ms. Zoila is a loving mother who has assumed the task of leading the members of her family through the path of success. With the help of her older children, she dedicates herself to farming. Because of their wish to build a family business they have the obligation to work hard to obtain this.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Zoila, es una amorosa madre que asumió el reto D. conducir a los miembros D. su familia por el camino del éxito. Se dedica con ayuda D. sus hijos mayores a la agricultura y gracias al emprendimiento y a las ganas D. constituir una empresa familiar tienen el compromiso D. esforzarse más para llegar a cumplir su deseo.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds, compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila works every day to cultivate the best pasture in her fertile lands in order to provide her cattle the best nourishment as well as to sell to neighboring areas. She would like to increase the amount of pasture as it is necessary for the animals that are raised in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Domitila, se esfuerza diariamente por cultivar los mejores pastos en sus fértiles tierras a fin de proveer a las vaquitas de su establo del mejor alimento, y también para comercializarlo por las zonas aledañas a su domicilio.Tiene el proyecto de incrementar la siembra de este alimento tan necesario para los animalitos que crían en su comunidad.

loans.use: Increase in capital to optimize the sowing of roughage.

loans.name: Martín

texts.es:
Martin Zeledon is single and has four children, two that work and two that are still in school. The youngest is fifteen years old. Martin owns his own house, which he managed to purchase with many sacrifices. He works at El Ayota as a municipal coordinator of adult literacy and education. He supervises and organizes the study groups in the urban and rural zones. He has spent seventeen years in the educational sector, always maintaining excellent relations with the students, both young and adult, as well as with the teachers who attend the groups. He gets support from his two oldest children who are now working. His dwelling does not have enough space, and he wants to provide his older children privacy and comfort. For these reasons, with this loan he will start building two bedrooms.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Martin Zeledon es soltero, tiene 4 hijos, dos ya trabajan y dos estudian, la menor tiene 15 años. Don Martin posee casa propia, la que compro con muchos sacrificios. Trabaja en EL Ayote como coordinador municipal de alfabetizacion y educacion de adultos, supervisa y organiza los nucleos de estudio en la zona rural y urbana. Tiene 17 años de laborar para el sector educativo, siempre ha mantenido excelentes relaciones con los educandos que son jovenes y adultos, al igual que con los maestros que atienden los grupos. Recibe el apoyo de sus 2 hijos mayores que ya trabajan. Su vivienda vivienda no tiene espacio suficiente y quiere brindarles a sus hijos mejores comodidades y privacidad, por eso con este crédito empezará a construir 2 cuartos de habitación.

loans.use: Construction of two bedrooms.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja is a very hard working woman who dedicates a large part of her time to embroidering in her humble home in order to contribute to the economic growth of her home. She also farms with the help of her children. Her biggest wish is to increase the quantity of her embroidered goods as this activity provides her with substantial income.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Maruja, es una mujer muy trabajadora que dedica gran parte de su tiempo al bordado de fustanes en su humilde domicilio, para contribuir con el desarrollo de su hogar.También se dedica a la agricultura con ayuda de sus hijos, y su más grande deseo es incrementar la cantidad de sus bordados ya que a través de esta actividad puedo obtener ingresos económicos sustanciales.

loans.use: Infusion of  capital to acquire a greater amount of prime material.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela, since she has enjoyed the company of her loved son, is very diligent in her farming and livestock related labors. Thanks to her hard work, she has been able to improve her quality of life. She now desires to start breeding animals such as guinea pigs for export. She has prepared a room in her home for this end.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Adela, desde que goza de la compañía de su amado hijo, se desempeña con mucha diligencia en sus labores agrícolas y ganaderas, gracias a esto ha podido mejorar su calidad de vida y desea incursionar ahora en la crianza de animales de exportación como los cuyes en un espacio que ya acondicionó en su hogar para este fin.

loans.use: Infusion of capital to optimize the breeding of guinea pigs.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina G. is a teacher in the urban zone of Acoyapa. She is 53 years old, and is married with two children who are professionals. She has worked in education for 27 years. She has used her previous loans to improve her house, and she will now make her dream of having a dignified dwelling a reality and get some rest once she retires. With this loan, she will put the final touches on her house, such as changing the floor to tile which will improve her status in the society. The teacher Ernestina has stood out in her municipality as a person who is responsible, honest, and dependable, and for these reasons she is much loved by her colleagues.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ernestina G. es maestra de la zona urbana de Acoyapa, tiene 53 años de edad, es casada, con 2 hijos profesionales. Tiene 27 años de trabajo en el sector educativo, los créditos anteriores los ha utilizado para mejorar su vivienda, y ya logrará cumplir sus sueños de tener una vivienda digna para sus nietos y descansar una vez que se haya jubilado. Con este credito dará un toque final a su vivienda, como es cambiar el piso a ceramica , para asi alcanzar un mejor estatus en esta sociedad. La profesora Ernestina se ha destacado en su municipio como una persona responsable, honesta y cumplidora, es por esta razon que es muy querida por sus colegas.

loans.use: Install a tile floor in her house.

loans.name: Faatagi

texts.en:
Faatagi P., 57, is a widower with 8 children. Her husband has passed away, but her kids support her with her business. She is the Centre Chief for her Centre. This is a position of great responsibility. She is required to monitor the payments of all other members and ensure compliance with all guidelines.

She has 3 years of experience in the Canteen business. She sells at the village bingo night 5 nights per week and also sells to some relatives. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). SPBD loans are Faatagi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase bag of flour, rice, snacks, cordials, sugar etc.

loans.name: Blanca Ninoska

texts.es:
Blanca is seeking a loan to invest into home improvements, specifically for the construction of a bedroom. She works as a primary school teacher at the Salomón Ibarra Mayorga School. She has a 5-year old child, who is in pre-school. Despite that she is single and can’t count on assistance from her child’s father, she is a very responsible mother. She also has assumed the responsibility of caring for her grandmother. It’s important to explain that she has improved her house little by little with previous loans. She is a hardworking woman who gets up at 4 a.m. each morning to make breakfast for her child and grandmother, given that by 6 a.m. she has to travel to the town of Los Angeles to teach the rural children of that area.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Blanca está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda para la construcción de una habitación, trabaja como docente de Educación Primaria en la Escuela Salomón Ibarra Mayorga, tiene un niño de 5 años de edad el cual esta estudiando en pre escolar; a pesar que es una mujer soltera que no cuenta con la ayuda del papá del niño, es una madre muy responsable con su hijo, ademas asume la responsabilidad del cuido de su abuelita, es importante explicar que está clienta con los créditos anteriores ha ido poco a poco mejorando su vivienda, es una mujer trabajadora que todos los dias tiene que levantarse a las cuatro de la mañana para así dejarle hecho el desayuno a su abuelita y a su hijo ya que a las seis de la mañana tiene que viajar a la colonia los Angeles a impartir el pan de la enseñanza a los niños campesinos de esa colonia.

loans.use: Construction of a bedroom.

loans.name: Chun

texts.en: Chun Y., a farmer who grows watermelon crops, earns an average income of $1.33 per day. Her husband, Mr. Thoeurn Nheb, 47, sells forest wood in their home village of Boeung Ngort in Siem Reap Province. They have five children, none of whom attend school due to the family’s economic circumstances.  They are seeking $500 to purchase a cow and buy fertilizers for their watermelon crops. The loan will help to sustain and expand their business, and improve family income. (The photo is Y.'s husband.)

loans.use: To purchase a cow and to buy fertilizers for their watermelon crops.

loans.name: Tek

texts.en: Tek S. is 28 years old, working in Kampong Cham’s Toul Tom Pong Market. She is a chef specializing in weddings that require certain Khmer delicacies. She is rather new to the job, only having worked in the market since 2007. She is earning low wages at the time of $1.50 (US) per day. Her husband is the primary breadwinner, earning $3 (US) per day as a taxi driver within the city of Kampong Cham. Business has been tough for all taxi drivers in recent days as the cost of gasoline is approaching $6 (US) per gallon. He has been a taxi driver since 1990 and knows his trade well. They have one child together but also care for two of Tek's younger sisters, one of whom works with her as a chef. As her meager earnings from her current job are not sufficient to support her family, she wants to take out a loan to buy fish to raise in ponds by her house. She wants to continue to expand this business to include other types of livestock until she feels like she can safely quit her current job.

loans.use: To raise fish and other animals.

loans.name: Tek

texts.en: Tek P. is a 41-year-old widow living in Kampong Cham province. She has earned her living selling fruits since she was but a girl in 1979 when the Khmer Rouge regime first lost power in Cambodia. She earns $11 (US) per day total, although much of this revenue goes back into purchasing fruit. She has two children still living in her home she cares for. Her elderly mother takes care of the children while she goes to work each day. She wants a loan to put her ahead in the fruit business. She will buy more expensive fruits in higher demand like mangos. She hopes to someday be able to afford a hand cart, which she could use to transport her fruit in greater quantities every day to the market. She is pictured here with her elderly mother.

loans.use: To buy mangos and other fruits.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok S. is 47 years of age, working in Kampong Cham province. He and his wife, Bea Rai, have carved out a living there for themselves and their two children. He drives a horse-drawn cart for transporting both people and goods around their district. She is a local banana seller. Both of their children are able to attend school despite their parents' meager revenue. Sok S. wants to take out a small business loan to help his wife progress with her banana-selling business. She will use this loan to buy more bananas to sell. If their savings can increase, he hopes to someday purchase a better cart for himself.

loans.use: Buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Thi Nguyet

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Nguyệt i s39 years old. She has a store selling bicycles. She needs a loan of 2.478.000 VND to buy bicycle parts. She also sells snacks at the market (grilled sweet potato) to gain some more money. Her family income is 130.000 VND/ day. She has 4 children who are still going to school. This is her second group loan, th efirst loan was successfully paid off. She volunteers to be the group leader because she believes in her group. She would be able to help othe rgroup members. She likes SEDA program very much because it is effective and fast.
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Chút is 52 years old. She sells basic goods. She needs 2.242.000 VND.
- Mrs Phan Thị Lý is 57 years old. She sells CDs. She is requesting 2.242.000 VND.
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Vinh is 45 years old. She runs an internet cafe. She is requesting 2.242.000 VND to expand her cafe.
- Mrs Đặng Thị Thạnh is 35 years old. She needs 2.242.000 VND to buy wood to make furniture.
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Tĩnh is 20 years old. She needs 2.242.000 VND to open a hair salon.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cô Nguyễn Thị Nguyệt (MS: 030012), năm nay 39 tuổi. Cô vay 2.478.000 VND để bổ xung vốn mua bán xe đạp. Bản thân cô còn làm thêm để có thêm thu nhập cho gia đình, cô đi chợ bán khoai nướng. Mức thu nhập của gia đình 130.000 VND/ ngày. Cô có bốn con đang đi học. Cô cùng nhóm đã hoàn trả tốt một chu kỳ vay vốn của chương trình. Nhóm côlàm việc rất tôt nên cô tiếp tục nhân làm nhóm trưởng để giúp đỡ nhóm. Cô rất thích tham gia vào chương trình vì thủ tục nhanh gọn và thuận tiện. Cô Nguyễn Thị Chút (MS: 030013), năm nay 52 tuổi. Cô vay 2.242.000 VND để đi chợ mua hàng bán. Cô Phan Thị Lý (MS: 030014), năm nay 57 tuổi. Cô vay 2.242.000 VND để mua bán băng đĩa. Cô Nguyễn Thị Vinh (MS: 030015), năm nay 45 tuổi. Cô vay 2.242.000 VND bổ xung vốn mở rộng quán Internet. Chị Đặng Thị Thạnh (MS: 030016), năm nay 35 tuổi. Chị vay 2.242.000 VND để bổ xung vốn mua gỗ đóng bàn ghế bán. Chị Nguyễn Thị Tĩnh (MS: 030028), năm nay 20 tuổi. Chị vay 2.242.000 VND để mua đồ mở của hàng làm tóc.

loans.use: bicycle store

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Soy S. is a young 35-year-old widow living in Kampong Cham. She just opened her own grocery store and hopes it will become an adequate source of income for her only child. Right now she is doing relatively well, earning $5.30 (US) per day. She knows the secret to market success is specialization, making sure she has more of a certain product people want. She wants to specialize in drinks. With her loan she will buy many assorted brands of beer and soft drinks. In the future she wants to buy more goods to expand other parts of her store inventory.

loans.use: To buy beer and soft drinks.

loans.name: Thi Quy

texts.vi:
Mrs Đinh Thị Quý is 35 years old. She has 2 young children who go to school. She works on her rice paddy and sells bananas and other fruits. Her husband is a carpenter. Her family income is 200.000-300.000/ week.. She never had a loan before. She likes SEDA program because she would have to save money to make the weekly payment. She is requesting 2.006.000 VND to have more capital to buy fruits to resell.
- Mrs Tô Thị Canh needs 2.006.000 VND to buy feed for her pigs .
- Mrs Trần Thị Đường needs 2.006.000 VND to buy bamboo. She makes bamboo baskets.
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Bằng needs 2.006.000 VND to buy rice to make rice noodles.
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Thái needs 2.006.000 VND. She sells grocery.
- Mrs Đặng Thị Thuý needs 2.006.000 VND to buy feed for her pigs.
- Mrs Chu Thị Hường needs 2.006.000 VND to have capital to buy basic goods to sell.
- Mrs Trần Thị Đức needs 2.006.000 VND to have capital to start a business selling rice.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đinh Thị Quý (MS: 13020001),năm nay 35 tuổi. Chị làm cán bộ phụ nữ thôn. Chị không chỉ tích cực tham gia công tác xã hội của thôn mà chị còn rất đảm đang việc nhà. Chị có hai con nhỏ còn đang đi học. Ngoài làm ruộng chị còn đi chợ buôn chuối và các hoa quả khác. Chồng chị làm nghề mộc. Thu nhập của gia đình chị khoảng 200.000-300.000/ tuần. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu. Vì thích được tiết kiệm để trả góp nên chị tham gia chương trình. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để thêm vốn đi chợ mua bán hoa quả. Chị Tô Thị Canh (MS: 13020002), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám lợn. Chị Trần Thị Đường (MS: 1302003), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua tre, nứa đan đồ bán. Chị Nguyễn Thị Bằng (MS: 13020004), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua gạo làm mỳ bán. Chị Nguyễn Thị Thái (MS:13020005), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua hàng tạp hoá bán. Chị Đặng Thị Thuý (MS: 13020006),vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám lợn. Chị Chu Thị Hường (MS: 13020007), vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn đi chợ buôn bán. Chị Trần Thị Đức (MS: 13020008), vay 2.006.000 ND để lấy vốn mua bán gạo.

loans.use: sell fruits

loans.name: Thi Quy

texts.vi:
Mrs Dương Thị Quý is 34 years old. She and her husband work on their rice paddy. They are hard working people. They also raise pigs and husk rice. Their family income is 300.000/day. She is seeking a loan of 2.006.000 VND to buy rice to make noodles.
- Mrs Trần Thị Sự needs 2.006.000 VND to buy feed for her pigs .
- Mrs Trần Thị Lan needs 2.006.000 VND> She sells tomatoes.
- Mrs Nghiêm Thị Lan needs 2.006.000 VND to buy beans to make chop suy.
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Loan needs 2.006.000 VNDto buy feed for her pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Dương Thị Quý (MS: 13020009), năm nay 34 tuổi. Chị là người đảm đang tháo vát, chị cùng chồng không chỉ làm ruộng, chăn nuôi nhiều lợn mà hàng ngày anh chị còn say xát hang tạ gạo. Thu nhập của gia đình chị khoảng 300.000/ ngày. Chị tham gia chương trình với mức vốn vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn mua gạo làm mỳ. Chị Trần Thị Sự (MS: 13020010), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám cho lợn. Chị Trần Thị Lan (MS: 13020011), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua bán cà chua. Chị Nghiêm Thị Lan (MS: 13020012), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua đỗ làm rau giá. Chị Nguyễn Thị Loan (MS: 13020013), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám lợn.

loans.use: buy rice to make noodles

loans.name: Chem

texts.en: Chem K. is 35 years old and makes her living selling mangos, earning $1.30 (US) per day. Her husband, Luy Chea, is able to earn a little bit more collecting recyclable items from house to house and then reselling these to local factories that use them in production. He earns about $4 (US) per day. They have a somewhat large family to support, having five children living in the family home. One of the older children is already done with school and is a garment factory worker earning $30 (US) per month. The other four children are students and will, one by one, enter the working world as they complete their basic education. Chem K. wants to take out a small business loan to buy a greater amount of mangos while they are in season so she can turn a large profit.

loans.use: To buy Mangos.

loans.name: Thi Thuy Ha

texts.vi:
N. thi Thuy Ha (MS: 070030) is twenty six year old. She requests a loan of $VN 2.478.000 to start a poultry business. She is an elementary school teacher, her husband works for the local government but he also helps her in the farm. They have a small child. She likes to participate in the loan program since she can repay slowly and the paper work is fast and simple. She already participated once and repaid her loan completely. Her family income is about $VN 150.000/day.

Translated from Vietnamese by a Kiva volunteer

Chị Nguyễn Thị Thuý Hà (MS:070030), năm nay 26 tuổi. Chị vay 2.478.000 VND để mua gà nuôi. Bản thân chị làm giáo viên, chồng chị làm ở uỷ ban xã nhưng cũng giúp chị trong chăn nuôi. Chị có một con còn nhỏ. Chị rất thích tham gia chương trình trả dần và thủ tục nhanh gọn. Chị đã tham gia được một chu kỳ và đã hoàn trả rất tốt. Mức thu nhập của gia đình là 150.000 VND/ngày.

loans.use: Agriculture

loans.name: Sit

texts.en: Sit S. L. is 28 years of age, living as a housewife in Kampong Cham province. He husband, Bun Thol, is also 28 years old and is a head construction worker ranked directly beneath the group’s foreman. He aspires to be foreman himself someday and earn a better salary. Right now he earns $7 (US) per day which is a fair wage in his line of work. They only have one child right now to support. This small business loan will mostly go towards purchasing her husband construction tools to enable him to perform better as a construction worker and hopefully someday lead to his advancement.

loans.use: To buy construction tools.

loans.name: Theong

texts.en: Theong L. is a rice farmer in Kampong Cham. She carries on the traditional subsistence farming existence that her people have lived in for thousands of years. She herself has farmed since 1979, the year the Khmer Rouge regime lost power. She earns 1 US$ per day, sometimes less. Her husband earns similar wages as a yam farmer and part time fisherman. He is much newer to farming than she is, only having been involved since the year 2000. The two of them have had six children together and seen four of these children grow up and be married! Two of their children moved to Phnom Penh where they knew they could earn better wages than in Kampong Cham. One is working construction while the other is in a local garment factory. Both send some funds home to help support the family. Theong L.’s loan funds will go towards expanding her husband’s yam farming operation. They will buy an additional plot of farmland as well as yam seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy farmland and yam seed.

loans.name: Theong

texts.en: Theong L. is a rice farmer in Kampong Cham. She carries on the traditional subsistence farming existence that her people have lived in for thousands of years. She herself has farmed since 1979, the year the Khmer Rouge regime lost power. She earns $1 per day, sometimes less. Her husband earns similar wages as a yam farmer and part-time fisherman. He is much newer to farming than she is, only having been involved since the year 2000. The two of them have had six children together and have seen four of these children grow up and be married! Two of their children moved to Phnom Penh where they knew they could earn better wages than in Kampong Cham. One is working construction while the other is in a local garment factory. Both send some funds home to help support the family. Theong L.’s loan funds will go towards expanding her husband’s yam farming operation in their home province. They will buy an additional plot of farmland as well as yam seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy farmland and yam seeds.

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en: Chhoeun A. earns $3 a day through her grocery store, which she has operated since 2000. Her husband, Oun Teav, is involved in several different trades, which is common with poor, rural Khmers who must find multiple sources of income in order to make ends meet. He raises pigs and also makes traditional rice wine. These two businesses actually go quite well together as the leftover rice mash from the rice wine can be used as feed for the pigs. He also earns about $3 per day. The couple has three children as well. They hope to use their loan to expand both of their businesses. They will purchase more grocery products for her store as well as better pig feed for his pigs. They hope to focus on pig raising in the future as this has proved to be profitable.

loans.use: To buy pig food and grocery store products.

loans.name: Thi Duyen

texts.vi:
Ms. L. thi Duyen (MS: 03001) is forty eight year old. She requests a loan of $VN 2.006.000 to buy bamboo to make trails for her gourd garden. Her husband is also involved in a farming business. They have four school-age children. Her family income is about $VN 70,000/day. She really likes to participate in the loan program as she can repay gradually.

Ms. Nguyen thi Thanh (MS: 030005) is twenty one year old. She requests a loan of $VN 2.006.000 to start a fruit and vegetable stand at the local market.

Translated from Vietnamese by Hien, a Kiva volunteer

Cô Lưu Thị Duyên (MS: 030001), năm nay 48 tuổi. Cô vay 2.006.000 VND để mua nứa về làm giàn trồng bí. Bản thân cô đi đánh giấy giáp để có thêm thu nhập hàng ngày. Chông cô chăn nuôi thêm. Cô có 4 con còn đang đi học. Mức thu nhập của gia đinh khoảng 70.000 VND/ ngày. Cô rất thích tham gia chương trình vì được trả dần. Chị Nguyêm Thị Thanh (MS: 030005), năm nay 21 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để đi chợ mua bán hoa quả.

loans.use: Business and agriculture

loans.name: Thi Tien

texts.vi:
Ms. T. thi Tien is forty year old. She requests a loan of $VN 2.006.000 to buy feed to increase her revenues. Her husband helps her in this business. Her son is a carpenter. Her family income is about $VN 80,000/day.

Translated from Vietnamese by Hien, a Kiva volunteer

Cô Trần Thị Tiến (MS: 030004), năm nay 40 tuổi. Cô vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám cho lợn. Bản thân cô làm thêm để có thêm thu nhập. Chồng cô giúp đỡ cô trong việc chăn nuôi, còn con cô làm thợ mộc. Mức thu nhập của gia đinh khoảng 80.000 VND /ngày.

loans.use: Breeding

loans.name: Thi Meo

texts.vi:
Ms. N. thi Meo is forty three year old. She requests a loan of $VN 2.006.000 to buy fertilizer for her garden. Her vegetable business helps increase her family revenues. Her son is a carpenter. Her family income is about $VN 100.000/day.

Translated from Vietnamese by Hien, a Kiva volunteer

Cô Nguyễn Thị Mẹo (MS: 030003), năm nay 43 tuổi. Cô vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy tiền mua lân đạm bón cây trồng. Cô làm rau mày bán để có thêm thu nhập hàng ngày. Con cô làm thợ mộc. Mức thu nhập của gia đinh cô khoảng 100.000 VDN/ ngày.

loans.use: Agriculture

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong B. T. is a 54-year-old widow. She raises pigs from her home in Kampong Cham and sells them off to be bred or butchered. She earns $2 (US) per day. Her six children are all faithful to their mother and use their own salaries to provide her with additional support. One of her kids is a blacksmith and another is a construction worker in Phnom Penh where they do well. Another daughter works as a hairdresser and another two are English translators. Only one of her children still lives with her in Kampong Cham and is still attending school. She is quite thankful for her children but also wants to continue to develop her own business. She will purchase more pigs to raise as well as high quality feed to prepare them for sale. She is pictured here with one of her older pigs.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Phnov

texts.en: Phnov T. is 30 years old and working as a rice farmer in Kampong Cham province. She says her farm has been in her family since 1970, and she herself continues to work the same plot of land. Uch Srong, her husband, is a taxi driver bringing additional income to the family. They care for their two children through these businesses. One of her younger sisters also resides in their family home and helps support the family through working at a garment factory at $90 (US) per month. Her husband would like to have a business at home to run when he is not working his taxi. Specifically, they would like to purchase pigs to raise as another source of income. If he can make some extra money, he may someday be able to afford his own car and make more money as a taxi driver.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Thi Tinh

texts.vi:
Ms V. thi Tinh (MS13050013) is thirty four year old. She has two children, one is still in school and the other already is working. They laboriously work in the fields, raise hogs, and sell pork to the villagers. They also support her sister-in-law (her husband’s older sister) who is single and who lives with them. The latter, due to weak vision cannot support herself. She requests a loan of $ $VN2.006.000 to buy feeds. Ms. Nghiem thi Hanh (MS 13050014) is twenty seven years old. She requests a loan of $VN.2.600.000 to buy and sell scraps. Ms. To thi Xinh (MS 13050015) is thirty-two year old. She requests a loan of $VN.2.006.000 to start a business in straw mats. Ms. Bui thi.Lam (MS 13050016) is forty-year old. She requests a loan of $VN.2.006.000 to buy rice to start a business in rice paper. Ms. V. thi Hien (MS 13050017) is thirty-four year old. She requests a loan of $VN.2.006.000 to buy rice to start of business in rice noodle. Ms. Bui thi Thanh (MS) is twenty-five year old. She requests a loan of $VN.2.006.000 to buy breed hogs. Ms. To thi Lan (MS) is thirty-three year old. She requests a loan of $VN.2.006.000 to start a fruit and vegetable stand in the local market.

Translated from Vietnamese by a Kiva volunteer Chị Vũ Thị Tình (MS:13050013), năm nay 34 tuổi. Chị có hai con, một con chị đã đi làm, còn một con chị hiện còn đang đi học. Gia đình chị rất chăm chỉ : làm ruộng, nuôi lợn. và bán thịt lợn cho dân trong thôn. Ngoài việc chăm sóc các con, anh chị còn chăm sóc người chị của chồng không lập gia đình, mắt kém không có khả năng tự nuôi sống bản thân. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để thêm vốn mua thịt lợn bán, và mua cám lợn Chị Nghiêm Thị Hạnh (MS: 13050014), năm nay 27 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn đi buôn bán phế liệu. Chị Tô Thị Xinh (MS: 13050015), năm nay 32 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để đi mua chiếu về bán. Chị Bùi Thị Lam (MS: 13050016), năm nay 40 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND mua gạo làm bánh đa nem. Chị Vũ Thị Hiền (MS: 13050017), năm nay 34 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua gạo làm mì. Chị Bùi Thị Thành (MS: ), năm nay 25 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua lợn giống. Chị Tô Thị Lan (MS: ), năm nay 33 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để buôn bán hoa quả ở chợ.

loans.use: Chăn nuôi và buôn bán

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam A. is 55 years of age. She runs her own stand selling vegetables at a roadside market in Kampong Cham. She enjoys her work and earns $2.50 (US) per day. Her husband’s name is Phat Ron. He is also 55 years of age and makes his living as a fishermA. in several local lakes. He has been fishing the same area since 1980. He earns $2 (US) per day. The couple has seven children, two of whom are married and live separately from the family. The married children still help support the family through the grocery store and photocopy shop they own. Of their children that live at home, one is a garment worker and another is a professional translator. The youngest three children are all students. Her youngest daughter is pictured here helping Sam A. run her stand.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell and a photocopy machine.

loans.name: Huy

texts.en: Huy T. is 43 years old, living in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are involved in a number of activities but rely on a grinding mill business as their primary source of income. These mills are used for processing freshly harvested rice for sale as well as other cereal crops. The business works by them loaning out these mills for use by nearby villagers for their crops. They earn a little more than $3 (US) per day through this business. They have three children together, all of whom are students. The family also raises cows, which the children are responsible for caring for when they come home from school each day. Their business loan will go towards supporting both of these sources of income for the family. Half the loan will be used to buy two females cows for breeding purposes. The other half will be used to buy the materials needed to build another mill to increase the amount of rice that can be ground at once. They have high hopes for the future as they look for other ways to invest.

loans.use: To buy cows to raise, and stones for the mill.

loans.name: Eao

texts.en: Eao K. is an elderly Khmer woman who lives with her widowed daughter, Chen Mei. At 76 years old, Eao K., is still laboring as a rice farmer in her home province of Kampong Cham. She has been farming rice since she was young in 1960, 15 years before the Khmer Rouge would come to power. She earns 1.50 US$ per day. Her daughter grows cucumbers. Eao K. has six children, some of whom help care for her by sending money each month. As she is very old she can no longer carry water from the well to her fields when not enough rain has come. She wants to buy a simple pump to use as an irrigation system for her fields.

loans.use: To buy a water pump.

loans.name: Eao

texts.en: Eao K. is an elderly Khmer woman who lives with her widowed daughter, Chen Mei. At 76 years old, Eao K. is still laboring as a rice farmer in her home province of Kampong Cham. She has been farming rice since she was young in 1960, 15 years before the Khmer Rouge would come to power. She earns $1.50 (US) per day. Her daughter grows cucumbers. Eao K. has six children, some of whom help care for her by sending money each month. As she is very old, she can no longer carry water from the well to her fields when not enough rain has come. She wants to buy a simple pump to use as an irrigation system for her fields. This will greatly benefit her family, she hopes, even after she is gone.

loans.use: To buy a water pump.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Sor S. is 38 years old. She sells a variety of vegetables in Kampong Cham province, earning a sizable daily revenue of  $20 (US) per day in total sales. Her husband works for the electric company, managing power grids. He earns a decent salary as well. They have three children who are still working their way through school. They are proud to have been able to give their children access to education. They feel comfortable taking out a loan at this time in their lives to start a new business that their children can help run during their time home from school. They will rent a large plot of farmland on which they will grow yams. The rest of the loan will be used to buy yam seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To rent farmland and buy inputs.

loans.name: Mahsuda

texts.en: A. Mahsuda is 56 years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband is currently unemployed and her business is the main source of income for her family. Mahsuda has been running her business for twelve years. She is selling fabrics for the national dresses. Her daughter helps her with the business. The national dresses in Tajikistan are a very popular and important item of the dowry of any girl. Mahsuda has her trading place in the central local market of Gafurov city. Being very polite with her clients and having good taste, Mahsuda has many customers. All the fabrics are supplied from the neighboring city, Istaravshan. Mahsuda is trying to have wide range of goods in order to able to meet the requirements of her customers. Mahsuda requests a loan of $800 dollars for the purpose of purchasing a new stock of fabrics for the summer season. She promises to repay the loan within 6 months. Your support will really help her. Be an important part of the growth of Mahsuda’s business.

loans.use: Purchasing of new fabrics

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en: Kosar lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single. He supports his family with a retail shop.  He started his business one year ago.  The location of his shop is good; day by day he attracts more clients.  He needs to complete his stock so he wants to take an individual loan.  This will help him to improve his business, help his family and make a better future for himself.  He is happy about this loan process.

loans.use: To improve his business

loans.name: Boo

texts.en: Boo P. is 46 years old and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a good housewife. Every day she stays at home looking after the children and cooking for the family members. Her husband has been a soldier since 1989 and earns a salary of $30 per month. They have four children, one of whom is married and lives away from home. One of her daughters operates a hair salon, earning about $11 in revenue a day, and also there are students. The busiest time that her daughter has is from January to May because these months are the harvest season. People already have collected their pay and also get married during that time. So to enlarge the hair salon business, the family needs to purchase more tools. This will allow the business to grow very quickly.

loans.use: To purchase more hairdressing tools.

loans.name: Pa

texts.en:
Pa L. is 39 years old and has resided in Kampong Cham province over ten years. She has a small business selling fishes and a variety of vegetables in a busy market to earn approximately $1.50 of profit each day. She started doing this business in 2000. Her husband is a construction worker ,building houses in the village, but sometimes he needs to go out of his village to do the construction, wherever he was hired. On average, he makes $5 of profit a day. This couple has four children, one of whom works collecting rubber in the village and resells it to the brokers. Normally the child makes around one dollar each day.

This couple would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase wood to repair the leaking roof. This will provide the family with a stable house in the future.

loans.use: To purchase wood to repair the leaking roof.

loans.name: Sak

texts.en:
Sak S., age 40, is a mother of four children and lives with her husband in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Before she had a small business in Prey Veng, but because of the difficulty and because it made less income she decided to move to Phnom Penh to create another business. Recently, she has become a vendor in a busy market selling eggs, and normally she receives three dollars of profit a day. Her husband is a wedding chef and earns around $2 per day. This couple has four children, one of whom is selling eggs with Ska S., two are students, and the other one is too young to attend school.

She would like to get a loan from Kiva to purchase more eggs to sell in order to expand her business, moreover, to receive more income to support the family.

loans.use: She hopes to use this loan to purchase more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Dem

texts.en: Dem S. is 28 years old and a housewife in Kampong Cham province. Her husband earns the household money by managing a small taxi business. He organizes the transport of people and goods between Phnom Penh and Kampong Cham through a number of drivers with their own vehicles. He earn 15 US$ per day through this job and has no other costs to detract from his income. On this salary he supports his wife and only child. He wants to replace one of his older taxis with a newer one. The family’s loan will go towards hiring out this car.

loans.use: To buy a new car.

loans.name: Dem

texts.en: Dem S. is 28 years old and a housewife in Kampong Cham province. Her husband earns the household money by managing a small taxi business. He organizes the transport of people and goods between Phnom Penh and Kampong Cham through a number of drivers with their own vehicles. He earn $15 (U.S.)  per day through this job and has no other costs to detract from his income. On this salary he supports his wife and only child. He wants to replace one of his older taxis with a newer one. The family’s loan will go towards hiring out this car, which he hopes will increase their income.

loans.use: To buy a new car for a taxi

loans.name: Teum

texts.en:
Mr. Teum N. is a widower and lives with his children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. He fishes for a living. After catching fish, he sells his catch in the market; moreover, he works as a villager officer in his village. He earns around $4 of profit each day. He has seven children, three of whom are married and live away from home. One child is a construction worker building houses, normally making about $2 a day.
To catch more fish he needs to purchase more fishing tools, so now he would like to request a loan from Kiva to buy nets and so on to catch more fish. With the remainder he'll purchase wood to install his house (for repairs). Mr. Teum N. is pictured with his daughter.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools and repair the house.

loans.name: Vorng

texts.en:
Vorng A., 56, lives with her husband and children in Kampong Cham province. They have five children; two are married and live outside the home; two children are construction workers; one is employed by a garment factory. Vorng A. and her husband are farmers and earn a combined income of approximately one dollar per day.

This couple would like to request a loA. to purchase cow. This cow will help them plow the farmland.

loans.use: To purchase cow.

loans.name: Lok

texts.en:
Lok E. has two businesses to support his family. He goes around his village, door- to-door, purchasing recycle items and then sells them to the recycling plant. He also collects palm juice and refines it to palm sugar to sell in the market. He earns approximately three dollars a day.

His wife, Chheun Ean, raises a cow and owns a plot of farmland where she grows a variety of vegetables. On average, she earns around one dollar a day. They have five children; one is employed at a garment factory earning two dollars each day; three are construction workers and also make two dollars per day; the fifth is married and lives outside the family home.

Mr. Lok E. is looking for a loan to purchase a motorbike to transfer the recycle items to the plant.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transfer recycle items to the recycling plant.

loans.name: Theong

texts.en:
Theong N. is 38-years-old and a traditional subsistence rice farmer in Kampong Cham. Her husband labors in the fields along side her day-by-day. Their combined income is around three dollars per day on what rice does not go towards feeding their family. They have four children, only one of who is married. One of their children works collecting recyclable items earning four dollars per day. Two of the daughters help their parents work crops and their work counts for an additional two dollars per day.

They want to take out a loan to first of all provide one of their children with a motorbike which he can use as a taxi. Besides using this as a taxi, their son who collects recyclable items will hook the motorbike to his cart to transport his daily stock up to the factory which will buy the items.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for business use

loans.name: Seam

texts.en:
Seam P. is 41-years-old and has four children. She started a business in Kampong Cham province three years ago selling a popular Cambodian snack, fried bananas. She earns two dollars per day. Her husband, Chu Poeun, is also 41-years-old and does logging. His line of work pays well--he can earn up to ten dollars per day.

They want to take out a loan to buy a plot of farmland. They will grow yams (a popular crop in Kampong Cham) as an additional source of income which can be handed over to their children in the future.

loans.use: To buy farmland.

loans.name: Phea

texts.en:
Phea T. makes Khmer cakes and sells them at the market. He uses a machine to mix the cake ingredients. The majority of his cakes are made from rice and flour, which are normally favorable for his customers. Recently, his machine broke and he now has to manually mix his cakes.

His wife, Seang Ath, is the mother of their four children. She stays at home looking after the children and cooking food for her family. After the house work, she plants a variety of vegetables which she sells, earning less than one dollar per day of profit. One child works digging a well in the village and makes about $100 a month.

Mr. Phea T. would like a loan to fix the cake-making machine which recently broke. The machine is very important for his family because if the machine cannot operate, there is minimal income for his family.

loans.use: To repair a cake-making  machine.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Yan S. collects rubber from rubber trees at a local rubber plantation in Kampong Cham. Rubber is made from the stretchy sap that leaks out of these unique and useful plants. She is paid three dollars per day. Her husband shares in this business and adds another three dollars per day to the family income. They have three children. One child is fortunate enough to be able to attend school, however the other two help their parents collect rubber adding $ .75 per day ro rhw family's income.

Yan S. would like to use her loan to open up a grocery store that will hopefully produce more income for the family. If she can earn more money she wants to pay for her other children to attend school.

loans.use: To open a grocery store.

loans.name: Kun

texts.en:
Kun S. is 47-years-old. She has been a rice farmer in Kampong Cham since 1988. She does not earn much despite the current high rice prices throughout the developing world. She only earns $1.50 per day. Her husband rents out grinding mills to local farmers for processing their crops. He also climbs palm trees to collect valuable juice at the top of the Khmer Sugar Palm which is used in making Khmer wine and other unique food products. He has been doing this since 1995 but only earns around four dollars per day.

They have six children, five who are single. Besides their own children, they are also responsible for three nieces who reside with them.

They want to invest in a strong healthy cow for plowing their farmland. Right now they must rent a cow every time they need to plow. If their income and thus savings go up, Kun S. hopes to purchase another plot of land to increase their rice production and care for their large family.

loans.use: To buy a cow for plowing fields or rice.

loans.name: Gam D 2028-5 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Martha C.. She is in the business of selling charcaol. Martha is 45 years old and is a widow. She has two children, 20 and 27.

Each week, Martha makes approximately 90 Sudanese pounds in profit; with the extra profits from her loan she hopes to be able to expand the business.

Martha is joined in her group by Cilran S., Paulina J., Dina E. and Louis M.. Cilran sells breads; Paulina operates a business selling vegetables; Dina also sells vegetables. All three wish to expand their businesses. Louis sells goods at a shop; she is requesting a loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: For business expansion.

loans.name: Song

texts.en: Song O. is a fisherman who lives in Taream Village, Siem Reap Province. He has been fishing for four years in Tonle Sap Lake and earns about $2.66 per day. His wife, Mrs. ChO. Nun, 32, is a farmer and purchases rice to stock for resale. Nun can earn about $3 per day. They have one small child. Now O. is seeking a loan of $700 to purchase fishing tools to expand their fishing business. They hope this loan will help to improve their family’s income and living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools to expand their fishing business.

loans.name: Soe

texts.en:
Soe R. is 29-years-old. She runs a popular Khmer business selling sugar cane juice. Sellers typically have a small cart with a crank operated grinder which grinds the juice out of stalks of sugar cane. They then serve the juice often over ice in bags tied at the end with straws stuck in them. Her earnings are rather meager at only one dollar per day.

Her husband’s business has not been very successful either, earning only $1.50 per day as a motor-taxi driver. On these small wages they support three children. She hopes to take out a loan to buy more sugar cane as well as a supply of grocery products she can sell from her cart to attract more business. (Her husband is pictured here as she was unavailable to be photographed.)

loans.use: To buy grocery products and sugar cane.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan H. builds round concrete tables and chairs made with cement. On average, he can earn around $70 a day.Most of the customers who come to purchase his furniture are from wealthy families. People purchase a round concrete table and chair to put in front of their house with a small shelter to protect them from sunshine and rain. It is a good pleasure place when they welcome guests or friends.

He lives in the outskirts of town with his family. All of his family members are involved in the business, including his wife.

His business has the potential to make more income for the family, so he would like to request a loan to purchase more sand, cement and other tools to increase his inventory and thus sell more furniture. (His wife is pictured because Mr. Phan H. was not available)

loans.use: To purchase more sand, cement and other tools to build more round tables.

loans.name: Vey

texts.en: Vey M. is a 28-year-old farmer who also operates a battery-recharging service from her house. She earns about $3.50 per day and her husband earns about $4 per day driving a motor-taxi. They live in Stong District in Kampong Thom Province. Because of their growing business, M. is seeking a loan of $1100 to purchase a new battery recharging  machine and a trailer to transport their customers’ batteries. This loan will help to increase the family’s income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a new battery recharging machine and a trailer to transport their customers' batteries.

loans.name: Meng

texts.en:
Meng Y. is 56-years-old. Since 1990, she has run a small business making and selling small Khmer cakes. These cakes are made from a mix of mashed rice and coconut, injected with varied flavors. These are extremely popular country-wide. She earns three dollars per day selling her baked goods.

Her husband, Pen Yap, helps support the family as a motor-taxi driver earning $1.50 per day. They have seven children. Five of these children are already married and have started their own households. However, two remain single and live with their parents.

Since she is still raising children, Meng Y. would like to take out a loan to add onto her house. She also uses the kitchen in the house as her bakery for her business. The balance of her loan will go towards buying good wood to burn, creating the heat for baking her cakes.

loans.use: To enlarge the house and buy wood to use for baking.

loans.name: Gam D 2028-6 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Zerpha M.. She is currently in the business of selling charcaol and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Zerpha is 47 years old and is married with a husband who is a teacher. She has three children ranging in age from 1 to 10 and her children go to school.

Each week, Zerpha makes approximately 60 Sudanese pounds in profit; with the extra profits from her loan she hopes to be able to expand her business.

Zerpha is joined in her small group by Ermina I., Anita A., Ludia Y., and Joice E.. Ermina has a business selling charcoal; Anita currently operates a business selling vegetables, as does Ludia. Each of these businesswomen hopes to use her loan to expand her business. The final member of the group, Joice E., sells goods in a shop; she is requesting a loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: For business expansion.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly S. is a rice farmer in Kampong Cham province. She has been working the same land since 1980 and knows her homeland well. She is very smart when it comes to her time and the seasons; during the rainy season she keeps tools for fishing to supplement her income. Between fishing and farming she earns about $4.50 per day. Her husband farms even while she is fishing and earns an additional two dollars per day.

They have six children (a normal amount for a farming family) and one is married. Two of the older children help support the family working in a garment factory. They each make $40 per month.

Ly S. wants to develop both her farm and fishing businesses. She will apply her loan towards buying a small wooden boat with a small outboard motor. She will also buy gas for the boat and good fertilizer for her fields.

loans.use: To purchase a wooden boat, fertilizer and gas.

loans.name: Yus

texts.en:
Yus B. is 70-years-old and has resided in the outskirts of the city for many years. Four children are married and live outside the home but two nieces live with her. After her husband passed away, she works very hard to support the family. Yus is a tailor and earns approximately $1.50 per day.

To increase the family income, she would like a loan to purchase more cloth and another sewing machine so her niece can operate a small business at home with her.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and another sewing machine.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en: Ernestina A. owns a provision store. She is married and has 2 children. Business is going very well, so Ernestina wishes to increase sales and improve her income. However, she is running out of stock. So she is asking for a loan to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Begimo

texts.ru:
Begimo D. lives in the town of Vahdat, Tajikistan. She is 43 years old and married with 6 children. She has been involved in retail trading for 12 years. She owns a grocery store. Her business is the main source of income for the whole family. She wishes to increase her revenue and the assortment of the groceries that she sells. To achieve these goals and to make her business more profitable she is requesting a loan from MLF HUMO.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer

Дулоева Бегимо проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 43 года, замужем и имеет 6 детей. Уже 12 лет занимается торговлей. Имеет магазин , где торгует продуктами питания. У нее очень большая семья , а ее бизнес является основным источником дохода ее семьи . Теперь она хочет увеличить товарооборот и приобрести новый ассортимент товара. Для этого она хочет получить кредит , который поможет ей достичь своих целей и увеличить прибыльность своего бизнеса.

loans.use: to increase the revenue

loans.name: Srun

texts.en:
Mrs. Srun P. and her family have resided in Phnom Penh for many years. She sells fish in a busy market earning approximately $2.50 a day. Her husband, Mr. Prak Moeun, catches fish and provides his catch to his wife to sell in the market.

Their wooden boat used for catching fish has broken and they are requesting a loan to purchase wood to fix it.

loans.use: To repair the family's wooden boat used for catching fish

loans.name: Mamadou Mamour

texts.fr:
Mr. D. is a merchant based in the time-honored district of MEDINA FALL. He recently joined the mutual society and is applying for a loan. His commerce is essentially composed of cosmetics. Winter time constitutes a period of high customer demand for goods, which justifies his request with the mutual society. His target customers are composed of women in his district.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

MONSIEUR D. est un très commerçant basé dans le quartier traditionnel de MEDINA FALL ,il a récemment adhéré à la mutuelle et sollicite un pret .son commerce est composé essentiellement de produits cosmétiques .l'hivernage constitue une période de forte demande des produits c'est ce qui justifie sa requete auprès de la mutuelle .sa clientèle cible est composée des femmes de son quartier.

loans.use: Cosmetics

loans.name: Halima.

texts.ru:
Halima N. lives in the town of Vahdat, Tajikistan. She is a housewife, 46, and is married with 6 children. She has a high school education and raises livestock at home. Halima wants to buy a cow and start a small milk farm. She plans to use some milk from this farm to feed her own children. She is requesting a loan of $1025 which she plans to pay back in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer

Носирова Халима проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 46 лет, замужем , имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Домохозяйка , но занимается животноводством. Хочет купить корову для того , чтобы получить потомство и развести небольшое хозяйство. Кроме того, приобретя корову она сможет получать молоко , которое сможет использовать для своей семьи. Для этого она хочет получить кредит , который сможет погасить в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en: Aziz lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with two sons.  He is uneducated; he works in agriculture and has good experience in the business. He has plenty of land for cultivation. He has requested an individual loan to complete his stock so he can increase his benefit from his land and help his family.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao S., 44, is a true entrepreneur and lives with his family in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He is one of hundreds of taxi drivers in the Phnom Penh Svay Reng province. He averages $20 in revenue a day.

His wife stays at home looking after the three children and taking care of the home and meals. She also makes paper necklaces and sells them at the market, earning approximately three dollars a day.

Mr. S. would like a loan to replace an old, unreliable motor that uses a lot of gas. Skyrocketing gas prices have forced many taxi drivers out of business, but he is being patient and trying very hard to continue his business. ( His wife is pictured because Mr. Sao S. was not available.)

loans.use: To replace an old motor for his taxi.

loans.name: Sabrinisso

texts.ru:
Sabrinisso S. lives in the town of Vahdat. She lives with her large family. She is married and has 5 children. She has secondary education and has worked in farming (government owned) since graduation. She also has her own livestock. She has 2 bulls, and she would like to increase that number. To do that, she needs to purchase a cow of good breed. That is the reason why she came to MLF HUMO. A loan will give her an opportunity to increase her livestock and obtain milk for the children. She plans to pay off the loan within the next 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Шарипова Сабриниссо жительница города Вахдат. Живет со своей большой семьей. Она замужем и имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее . Всю жизнь работает в колхозе . Так же имеет свое частное хозяйство. Имеет 2 бычков и хочет увеличить поголовье скота. Для этого необходимо купить корову отличной породы. Поэтому она обратилась к нам за кредитом. Это даст возможность увеличить хозяйство, получать молоко для детей. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 8 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the livestock

loans.name: Sithat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sithat M., 43, and her husband, Mr. Yat Choen, were married in 2000 and have two sons, one of whom is in school. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Yat is a silk weaver, a skill he learned from his wife.

Mrs. Sithat, who learned from her mother, has been a silk weaver for 21 years. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then sells them in Phnom Penh. Mrs. Sithat is requesting a loan of $150 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Mrs. Bun N., 66 years old, earns about $2.25 per day by selling beverages from her home in the Kasekam Village, Siem Reap Province. N. lives with her husband Chhit Nhem, 66 years old, and her seven children, four single and three married. Nhem is a fisherman earning around $2.25 per day and his children Kim and Sambath are bricklayers earning around $3 per day. With a stable business and the desire to upgrade in the future, N. now requests a loan of $300 to help her husband business. This will ensure Nhem and N.’s financial stability as well as help their children to go to school.

loans.use: To help her husband's business

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru:
Saida Q. lives in the town of Vahdat. She is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children. She stays at home and takes care of their family animals - she breeds cattle. Now, she decided to purchase couple of bull calfs, feed them to prepare them for the season, and sell them in Fall for a better price. This will give her an opportunity to earn additional income and contribute to development of farming sector in her region. If calfs will be well fed, then the buyer will be able to purchase quality product. To achieve all that, she needs to obtain a credit. She plans to pay off the loan within the next 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Курбонова Саида житвет в городе Вахдат. Ей 37 лет, замужем и имеет 5 детей. Домохозяйка , которая занимается разведением крупно-рогатого скота. На данный момент решила купить пару молодых бычков , откормить их в сезон , осенью продать по более выгодной цене. Это даст возможность ей заработать , а так же помочь развитию животноводческого сектора. Если телята будут хорошо откормлены , то покупатель сможет купить хороший товар. Чтобы всего этого достичь ей необходимо получить кредит. А погасить его она сможет в течении 8 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the amount of livestock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Sam-Oeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-Oeun S., 51, and her husband, Mr. Sokha Neang, were married in 1980. They have seven children, two sons and five daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. Two others are garment factory workers, while another is a construction worker; the last one is learning beauty skills. The family lives about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sokha used to be a mason but now stays at home due to health problems. Mrs. Sam-Oeun has been a fish seller for twenty years. She buys them from a district market for resale in the village market. Now she is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.use: To purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Pith

texts.en:
Pith S. is a mother of three children and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Two of her children are students and the third is too young to attend school. She supports her family by selling groceries out of her home, earning around $ 7.50 per day. Her husband, Mr. Nuth Saroeun, is a blacksmith and works for a company in Phnom Penh earning eight dollars a day.

Pith S. is requesting a loan to purchase more groceries to meet her customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Javharsho

texts.ru:
Javharsho A. lives in the town of Vahdat. He is married and has 3 children. He has secondary education and was trained as salesman. He started his own business by opening a grocery store close to his home. He imports his inventory. However, he would like to offer not only food, but also a number of other products needed in households. To increase the assortment of his goods and purchase additional inventory he needs funds. Expansion of his store will also help local residents purchase all of the necessities in their town without leaving it. For this reason, he decided to apply for a loan, which will help him achieve his goals. He plans to pay off the credit within the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Амробеков Джавхаршо житель города Вахдат. Женат , имеет 3 детей. Имеет средне-специальное образование . По профессии продавец. Так и сейчас окрыл небольшой продуктовый магазин рядом с домом. Привозит товар первой необходимости. Но хочет из магазина сделать универмаг. Для этого нужны средства , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Завести новый товар. Это поможет привлечь новых клиентов и помочь населению делать покупки прямо у себя в кишлаке,не выезжая за его приделы.Поэтому он решил получить кредит , который поможет ему достичь поставленных целей. Погасить кредит он планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana A. is a seamstress who specializes in sewing women’s clothing. She is married and has 5 dependants. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family so Juana is working very hard to help with the family’s expenses.

She wishes to improve her conditions of service to attract more customers so she is asking for a loan to buy modern sewing tools and materials to make her work easier.

loans.use: To buy modern sewing tools and materials to make her work easier

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en:
Nhem K. is a farmer in Phnom Penh where she grows rice and some vegetables to support her family. Normally she makes less than one dollar per day. Her husband, Mr. Kart Son, 55, grows mushrooms. Mushrooms are one of the favorite vegetables of the region. Mushrooms sell for good prices at the market. Everyday he brings a new crop and sells it at the market earning approximately $1.30 a day.

To get his crops to grow faster, Mr. Son would like a loan to purchase rice husks, straw and fertilizers. (Pictured: Mrs. Nhem K. is picture because her husband is not available)

loans.use: To purchase rice husks, straw and fertilizers.

loans.name: Inoyat

texts.ru:
Inoyat Qurbonoba lives in the town of Vahdat. She is 51 year old widow with 4 children. She is the sole person responsible for maintaining and supporting her household. But she is not giving up. Currently, she works as an elementary school teacher. She would like to obtain a loan to purchase an additional cow for her children. She plans to pay off the loan within the next 15 months.

While her children will be looking after the cow, she will be able to obtain milk and use it in for her family and sell the extras.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Курбонова Иноят живет в городе Вахдат. Возраст 51 год , вдова и имеет 4 детей. Весь груз по обеспечению и воспитанию ее детей лежит только на ней. Но она не унывает . Сейчас работает учителем начальных классов в средней школе. Хочет получит кредит , чтобы купить еще одну корову для своих детей. Погашать кредит сможет в течении 15 месяцев . А смотрет за коровой будут ее дети. Получаемое молоко сможет продавать и использовать в хозяйстве.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Sun A. lives in Chy Kreng District, Siem Reap Province.  As a fishermA. in Tonle Sap Lake, A. earns about $5.83 per day while his wife, Mrs. Dol Chhun, a farmer, earns about $1.67 per day. They have three children, all of whom are young and live in the family’s home. Two of their children fish with their father  and earn around $2.83 per day.  In order to expand business and improve the family’s living conditions, A. is now seeking a $1000 loA. to purchase a fishing boat and fishing tools. (The photo shows one of A.’s children because A. and Chhun  were not available.)

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat and fishing tools.

loans.name: Sokhun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhun C., 29, and her husband, Mr. Phon Phorn, were married in 2001 and have two sons, one of whom is in school. The family lives about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.
Phon has been a truck driver for five years, working for a company in his village. 
Mrs. Sokhun began a hairdressing business earlier this year; previously she sold groceries. Now she is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorcycle to use in the family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use in the family.

loans.name: Vanra

texts.en:
Mr. Vanra N. and his wife, Mrs. Saret Sem, were married in 1991 and have three children, one son and two daughters. All of their children are in school. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Saret has been a lottery agent for two years, while Mr. Vanra has been a motor taxi driver for the same amount of time. Besides operating the taxi, he is also a wooden house constructor. He is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one. (The photo shows the new bike and his wife.)

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy K. is 30-years-old and lives with her family in the outskirts of town. Her two children are students. Besides taking care of the house and the children, she also works part time.

Thy was hired by the local villager to harvest crops such as radish on a huge farm. When she has money she purchases an amount of radishes and resells them at the Deumkor market. Deumkor market is where most of the crop vendors go to buy the vegetables and resell in local markets. She earns approximately $2.50. Her husband is a gas truck conductor and earns approximately three dollars per day.

Thy would like to use her loan to purchase a motorbike for transportation to the Deumkor market. The rest of the money would be used to purchase radishes for pickling.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for transportation to the farm and market

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru:
Mastura Zubayadova lives in the town of Vahdat. She is married and has 7 children. She is 44 years old. She generally stays at home and takes care of their animals. She breeds cattle and sells it on a market or to her neighbors. She would like to increase the number of animals she has by purchasing more cattle. This is only possible if she can obtain a loan. She plans to pay off the loan within the next 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Зубайдова Мастура жительница города Вахдат. Замужем и имеет 7 детей. Ей 44 года. Она домохозяйка , но уже 7 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит бычков и продает на базаре или соседям. Хочет увеличить поголовье скота , путем покупки дополнительных бычков. Это возможно лишь после того , как она получит кредит. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Mohammad Anif

texts.en: Mohammad Anif is the father of three children: two sons and one daughter.  He lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan.  He is a doctor with many patients and loves his work.  He owns a successful drugstore.  He has requested an individual loan to improve his business by importing more medicine.  He is happy about this loan and would like to thank Kiva lenders for helping people around the world.

loans.use: To import more medicine

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida O. is a hairdresser who owns a beauty salon. She is married and has 2 children. Business is good and Vida wishes to improve her conditions of service to attract more customers.

She is asking for a loan to buy modern hairdressing tools and materials which she needs to make her work easier.

loans.use: To buy modern hairdressing tools and materials to make her work easier

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Kem

texts.en:
Kem O. is 39-years-old and is a weaver in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She weaves Khmer traditional dresses made from silk. One dress takes 10-15 days to complete and costs at least $100. Hand woven dresses are preferred over machine-made.

Her husband, Mr. Kong Sombo, 44, builds houses, earning about $5 a day. They have four children, one is married and lives away from home. Two daughters are also weavers and the youngest child is student.

Kem would use her loan to purchase beads, silk and other tools to expand the weaving business,

loans.use: To purchase beads, silk and other tools to expand the business

loans.name: Idigul

texts.ru:
Idigul A. lives in the city of Vahdat. She's not married and has 6 children. She has a high school education. She doesn't work anywhere but supports her family working with livestock by buying small animals, raising them, and later selling them at the market. The loan she wants to obtain will be used to increase the amount of animals she can buy and increase profitability. She plans on repaying the loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva volunteer.

Аминова Идигуль жительница города Вахдат. Не замужем , имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Нигде не работает ,но обеспечивает свою семью , занимаясь животноводством.Покупает молодых животных , откармливает и продает на рынках. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Это поможет увеличить товарооборот и увеличить прибыльность ее бизнеса. Погасить кредит она планирует в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Buy a cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. travels to a distant town to buy food supplies like maize in large quantities, which she then sells to her customers in smaller quantities. She is divorced and has 2 children. Business is going very well but the cost of transportation is a major problem.

Esther is asking for a loan to reduce the burden of transportation cost on her limited capital, allowing her to buy more food supplies per trip.

loans.use: To reduce the burden of transportation cost on her limited capital

loans.name: Kamal Din

texts.en: Kamal Din lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He works in agriculture. He is able to support his entire family with his income from agriculture. He would like to improve and develop his business, so he wants to take an individual loan to complete his stock.  He will buy more seeds for his land and prepare the land for cultivation.  This will allow him to increase his benefit from his land and help his family in the future.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru:
Gavhar G. lives in one of the villages of the city of Vahdat. She is a widow and lives with her 5 children. She is 46 years old and all her children are still young. She needs to work a lot to be able to feed her family. Close by her home, she owns a very small grocery store, but her income is insufficient. which is why she also works with livestock. She owns a dairy cow and sells milk products at the bazaar. She now wants to buy another cow with the loan she receives. This will increase the amount of milk she can collect and increase her profit. She expects to pay off the loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva volunteer.

Гирдакова Гавхар проживает в одном из кишлаков города Вахдат. Она вдова и живет со своими 5 детьми. Ей 46 лет и все дети еще маленькие. Ей приходится много работать , чтобы прокормить семью. Рядом с домом имеет небольшой магазинчик , где продает продукты питания. Но этих доходов ей не хватает , поэтому она еще занимается животноводством. Имеет корову , котороая дает молоко . Получаемую продукцию продает на базаре. Сейчас хочет купить еще одну корову , путем получения кредита. Это поможет увеличить объем получаемого молока и увеличит доход. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa N. sells bowls, towels, and plastics. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a fisherman and his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. Business is going very well, so Adjoa wishes to increase sales and improve her income. But she is running out of stock.

She is asking for a loan to buy more goods for sale

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
