Eng C., is one of the farmers who grows a variety of crops and sell his produce to the market to earn approximately five dollars a day of profit. His wife, Tep Pao, is one of many grocery vendors in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She received one loan to expand her grocery inventory and her business improved because she has more inventory to meet her customers' demand. Right now she makes about $13 in revenue a day. Tep Pao is expecting a baby soon. She has paid off the first loan.

The couple would like a loan to purchase grocery items in bulk to save money and to rent another plot of farmland to plant more crops for resale.

loans.use: To rent another plot of farmland to plan more crops.and purchase additional grocery items

loans.name: Mamadou Cisse

texts.fr:
Currently a merchant, Mr. N. was an employee of the Senegalese administration, which he left six years ago to devote himself to private business. He sells hardware in one of his stores where his lives. He is married and the father of five children, whom he feeds with the gains from his commerce.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Commerçant de son état actuel ,mr N. fut un employé de l'administration sénégalaise qu'il a quitté depuis 6 années pour se consacrer à ses propres affaires .il fait de la quincaillerie dans un ses magasins chez lui.il est marié et père de cinq enfants qu'il nourrit avec les produits de son commerce .

loans.use: achat et vente de matériaux de construction

loans.name: Bahrinisso.

texts.ru:
Bahrinisso K. lives in the town of Vahdat. She is 42 years old, married, and has 6 children. Her husband went to work in Russia while she stayed at home with her children. She works with livestock and sells milk and newly born calves. She now wants to take out a loan and buy a cow. This will increase the number of her livestock and she will be able to obtain more milk. She plans on repaying the loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva volunteer.

Косимова Бахриниссо проживает в городе Вахдат. Ей 42 года , она замужем и имеет 6 детей. Муж уехал на заработки в Россию. А она со своими детьми осталась у себя дома. Занимается разведением крупно-рогатого скота. Продает молоко и вновь родившихся телят. Сейча хочет получить кредит и купить корову. Это поможет ей увеличить поголовье скота и получать больше молока. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Buy a cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret M. is a seamstress who specializes in sewing women’s clothing. She is married and has 5 dependants. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family so Margaret is working very hard to help with the family’s expenses. She wishes to improve her conditions of service to attract more customers, so she is asking for a loan to buy modern sewing tools and materials to make her work easier.

loans.use: To buy modern sewing tools and materials to make her work easier

loans.name: Simorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Simorn M. and her husband, Mr. Srun Mao, have been married for three years and have no children. The family lives on an Island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.  Srun is a silk weaver, a skill he learned from his wife. 

Mrs. Simorn has been a silk weaver since she was 14 years old, having acquired the skill from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Now she is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase more silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Thearith

texts.en:
Mrs. Thearith K. and her husband, Mr. Pov Meas, have been married over 10 years and have two sons and one daughter. Two of their children are in school. The family lives on an Island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Pov is a security guard at a restaurant in Phnom Penh. Mrs. Thearith has been a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her mother, since she was 11 years old. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. She is now requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy four sacks of maize.

loans.name: Maty

texts.fr:
Mrs. F. is a well-known used clothing merchant in the central market of the town of Thiès. This business is quite remunerative but necessitates sufficient capital to renew her stock of bales of used clothing. She is responsible for a family and uses the income from this business primarily to cover family living expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

MADAME F. est une commerçante de fripperie très connue dans le marché central de la ville de Thiès. c'est une activité assez rentable mais qui nécessite un fonds de roulement pour renouveler ses stocks de ballots d'habillements. elle est mère de famille et tire principalement ses revenus de cette activité pour prendre en charge ses dépenses familiales.

loans.use: purchasing bales of used clothing for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for UIMCEC, a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his herd of livestock.

loans.name: Davlatoy

texts.ru: Гулова Давлатой Каримовна жительница района Рудаки. Возраст  50 лет, замужем, имеет 8 детей.Образование средние. Клиентка имеет небольшой участок земли,который  засеивает  картофелем. Имеет опыт в сельском хозяйстве более 15 лет.  Сельское хозяйство  является единственым источником дохода ее семьи. Собрав урожай Давлатой  использует для собственных нужд,а остатки продает на местном рынке .В данный момент ей нужны деньги для покупки минеральных удобрений. Поэтому она решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: покупка мин.удобрений.

loans.name: Balla

texts.fr:
Mr. D. has been in the business of metal-working for 22 years. He has his workshop located right on the street in a good area of the local market. He is requesting this loan to use to buy necessary raw materials, etc. He is married and the father of 7 children. This business is his main source of income.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

MR D. est menuisier métallique depuis 22 ans , il a son atelier situé pignon sur rue et occupe une bonne part du marché local .il sollicite un pret pour acheter de la matière première et des matériaux de fabrication .il est marié et père de sept enfants ;ses principaux revenus sont tirés de cette activité .

loans.use: purchasing materials for his metal-working shop

loans.name: Kurbonmahmad

texts.ru:
Kurbonmahmad S. lives in Rudaki. He is 48 years old, married, and has 5 children. He has a technical education with a focus on accounting. In his spare time, he works with livestock. He doesn't have a large enough income to support his large family. He buys young bulls at the local market, feeds and cares for them until they grow, and sells them back for a small profit. The reason he needs the money is because of his present plans to buy another young bull to raise. He therefore decided to take a 12 month loan. >Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva volunteer.

Шодиев Курбонмахмад житель района Рудаки. Возраст 48 лет, женат ,имеет 5 детей.Образование средне-техническое.По специальности бухгалтер. В свободное от работы время клиент занимается животноводством. Так как заработная плата у него небольшая,содержать большую семью он не может. Курбонмахмад покупает на местном рынке молодых бычков,откармливает их и продает на рынке по более выгодной ему цене. Сейчас клиент планирует купить очередного бычка для откормки,ддля чего ему нужны деньги. Поэтому он решил взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев

loans.use: To buy another young bull

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akossiwa A. was born in 1978 in Abidjan. Coming from a poor family, she has faced every type of hardship in the world during her life. Due to a lack of means, she has neither schooling nor professional training. She is married to a taxi driver, with whom she has three (3) children. Her main occupation is the sale of foodstuffs (rice, beans, spaghetti). Despite these difficulties, she has come to manage her business with rigor and was able to repay her previous loans. The current loan she is asking for will serve to buy bags of rice, beans, and other goods to strengthen her business and increase profits in order to be able to meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Akossiwa est née en 1978 à Abidjan. Issue d’une famille pauvre, elle a rencontré toutes les difficultés du monde dans sa vie. Par manque de moyens, elle n’a ni fréquenté, ni suivi une formation professionnelle. Elle s’est mariée à un conducteur de taxi avec qui elle a trois (3) enfants. Elle a comme activité principale la vente des denrées alimentaires (riz, haricot, spaghetti). Malgré les difficultés, elle arrive à bien gérer ses activités avec rigueur et a su rembourser ses crédits antérieurs. Ce présent crédit sollicité, lui servira à acheter des sacs de riz, haricot et autres pour mieux réussir son activité et la rentabiliser afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and beans

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en: D. Nodira is 34 years old. She is not married yet. Nodira is selling women’s clothes in the local market. She has been in the business for six years. Nodira is a friendly and polite woman. She is trying to diversify her range of goods to satisfy the needs of clients with various levels of income. Her business is stable, allowing her to make a considerable contribution to the family budget. Nodira is planning to purchase new clothing in order to increase the stock of summer clothes for women. With this purpose, she requests a loan of $600 dollars for the term of 9 months. Nodira thanks all supporting her and promises to pay the loan in a timely manner as she has done with her previous loans.

loans.use: Purchasing of new clothes for increasing of stock

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. prepares beverages for sale. She is also in the communication business. She makes calls for customers for a fee and also sells air time cards from service providers at the road side. She is married and has 3 children. Business is going very well, so Mary wishes to increase sales. However, she is running out of stock.

She is asking for a loan to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Born in 1958 in Ghana, Mrs. Adjo A. currently lives with her husband and six (6) children in Afoudomé (Prefecture of Zio). Her husband is a farmer and draws very little income from his work. Dynamic and entrepreneurial, Mrs. Adjo A. has developed her small business selling foodstuffs in the village. Thanks to this well-managed business, she takes care of the feeding of her children in one way or another. Honest and rigorous, she managed her previous loan well. She is currently asking for a loan which will serve to buy bags of maize and other goods in order to strengthen her business. Thus, she will be able to increase her income and meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1958 au Ghana, Madame A. Adjo vit actuellement avec son mari et ses six (6) enfants à Afoudomé (P/Zio). Son mari est cultivateur et tire très peu de revenu de son activité. Dynamique et entreprenante, Madame A. Adjo développe sa petite activité de vente de denrée alimentaire dans le village. A partir de cette activité qu’elle maîtrise bien, elle assume tant bien que mal les besoins élémentaires des enfants. Honnête et rigoureuse, elle a su gérer le précédent crédit. Elle sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit qui lui servira à acheter des sacs de maïs, et autres en de renforcer ses activités. Ainsi donc, elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience W. is a biscuit producer and also owns a grinding machine. She is married and has 6 dependants. Her husband is a teacher and his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. So Patience is working very hard to help with the family’s expenses. Business is going very well so she wishes to increase production and sales.

She is asking for a loan to buy more flour and other ingredients for her business.

loans.use: To buy more flour and other ingredients for food production and sale

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua D. prepares food for sale and also sells other food items. She is married and has 2 children. Business is going very well, so she wishes to increase production and sales. Therefore, she is asking for a loan to buy more food items.

loans.use: To buy more food items to produce and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a stock of cereals.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia G. sells footwear and clothing. She is divorced, and has 3 children. Raising 3 children single handed has not been easy for her. Business is going very well, so Ceclia wishes to increase sales. But she is running out of stock.

She is asking for a loan to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Essi A. was born in 1968 in Ghana. Returning to Togo at a very young age, she settled in Adoundomé (Zio Prefecture) where she married and gave birth to six children. She combines palm oil preparation with agriculture. The way she manages her business is astonishing, and she managed her previous loan strictly, repaying it promptly. She is now requesting a loan which will enable her to purchase fertilizer and extend her corn field and obtain palm nuts for the preparation of palm oil.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Essi est née en 1968 au Ghana. Revenue très tôt au Togo, elle s’est installée à Afoudomé (P/Zio) où elle se maria et donna naissance à six (6) enfants. Elle associe la préparation d’huile de palme à l’agriculture. Elle gère de façon étonnante son activité et a su gérer avec rigueur le précédent crédit qu’elle a remboursé promptement. A présent, elle sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter des engrais et étendre son champ de maïs et se procurer de noix de palme pour la préparation de l’huile.

loans.use: Fertilizer purchase and palm oil preparation

loans.name: Noy

texts.en:
Mrs. Noy M., 45, and her husband, Mr. Phun Kheav, 56, were married in 1993 and have eight children, five sons and three daughters. Two of their children are married, one of whom lives outside the family home. Two of their sons are construction workers and the other three children are in school. The youngest son stays at home. Phun has been fishing and growing rice since 1979. The family is about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Noy has been growing rice since 1979. The commodity's increasing price makes this a good time for her to expand her business, so she is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides as well as pay for the plowing of her rice field.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides, and pay for rice field plowing.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en: Gulchehra is running a catering business where she is providing meals of the national cuisine. She is renting the catering room in a caravan which is located in the central local market. This allows Gulchehra to have many clients; The majority of which are those making purchases in the market. Every day, Gulchehra purchases the latest foods and cooks delicious dishes. Her daughter and sister help her with her business. The business has been generating a stable income during the last 7 years. The husband of Gulchehra is unemployed and her business is their only source of income. Now Gulchehra is planning to purchase kitchenware. For this purpose, she requests $600 dollars for the term of 12 months. Gulchehra had been provided with several loans by IMON and had proven herself as a reliable client. Today she thanks all supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: Purchasing of kitchenware

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Mrs. Ra B., 51, and her husband, Mr. Chuy Cheng, 66, who live about 20 kilometres from Phnom Penh, were married in 1981 and have four children, three sons and one daughter. One of their children is married but lives in the family home, while the other three have full time employment.

Mrs. Ra and her husband have been selling fried bananas, a very popular dessert in Cambodia, for two years. They take powder to mix with egg, coconut, and water into which they dip the banana and fry it. Ra is now requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorcycle for her children to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her children to drive to work.

loans.name: Phary

texts.en:
Miss Phary U., 27, is single and lives with her parents on an Island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has two older brothers.

Miss Phary has been a silk weaver for fifteen years, a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. She is now requesting a loan of $200 to purchase additional silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Yavi

texts.fr:
Born in Adokpoe in 1962, Mrs. Yavi A. presently resides in Afoudomé (in Zio County). She is married and the mother of 3 children. Since her parents were not financially able to send her to school, she began working at a young age in agriculture and the processing of manioc into the flour commonly known as "gari". Her husband, who is also a farmer, contributes more or less to supporting the family. In order to help him, Mrs. A. is asking for a loan to expand her manioc-processing business and enlarge her field of corn and manioc.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née en 1962 à Adokpoe, Madame A. Yavi vit actuellement à Afoudomé (P/Zio). Mariée, elle est mère de trois (3) enfants. Ses parents n’ayant pas les moyens pour la scolariser, elle s’est très tôt lancée dans l’agriculture et la transformation du manioc en farine communément appelé « gari ». Son mari cultivateur aussi contribue tant bien que mal à la charge familiale. Pour le soutenir, Madame A. sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son activité de transformation et agrandir son champ de maïs et de manioc.

loans.use:
Processing manioc into flour and enlarging manioc and corn field

Transformation de manioc en farine et agrandisement du champ de manioc et mais

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en: H. Muborak is 60 is years old. She is married and has four children. Two of them are already married and have children of their own. Muborak’s husband is retired on a pension. Her business is the main source of income for her family. Muborak has been running her own small business for eleven years. She has a place in the local market for selling foodstuff such as macaroni, sweets, detergents, soap, washing powder, shampoo, tooth-paste and other items. She works from 8:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m. Her daughter helps her in the store registering the stock and serving clients. Muborak and her daughter are very friendly and polite which allows them to gain clientele. Now she requests a loan for purchasing more goods for selling and increasing the range of goods in her store. Muborak promises to repay her loan within 6 months and thanks everybody who decides to support her.

loans.use: Purchasing goods for selling

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akou A. was born in 1978 in Ghana. The mother of five children, she is married to a farmer and presently resides in Afoudomé (in Zio County). At a young age she began a small grocery business. Very serious and hard-working, she is a natural businesswoman and has shown herself to be a woman who can be trusted. In order to expand her business and make it more profitable, she is requesting a loan to use to stock up on foodstuffs in large quantities so that she can better satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Akou est née en 1978 au Ghana. Mère de cinq (5) enfants elle est mariée à un cultivateur et vit à présent à Afoudomé (P/Zio). Elle s’est lancée très tôt dans le petit commerce d’alimentation générale. Très sérieuse et appliquée, elle a le don des affaires et fait preuve d’une femme de confiance. Pour renforcer son activité et la rentabiliser plus, elle sollicite un financement qui lui servira à s’approvisionner en grande quantité des produits alimentaires afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use:
Stocking up on foodstuffs

Aprovisionnement en produits alimentaires

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en: K. Muhabbat is 55 years old. She is married and has a son. Her son is already married and has children of his own. Her husband helps her with the business. Muhabbat is a market vendor. She is selling foodstuff such as cotton-seed oil, sugar, tea, macaroni, and flour. She has been in this business for twelve years. The business is located in the local market, allowing Muhabbat to serve many clients and to have her clientele. The business is successful at generating the stable income which allows Muhabbat to support her family. Now Muhabbat wants to increase the range of goods that she sells so she is requesting this loan. Muhabbat promises to repay her loan within 6 months promptly and thanks everybody who decides to support her.

loans.use: Purchasing goods for selling

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Born in 1968, Mrs. Akossiwa A. is married and the mother of six children. Besides working in agriculture, she is a specialist in processing palm nuts into palm oil. She has been in this business for several decades. Dynamic and honest, she manages her little business well. In order to expand it, she is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase a supply of palm nuts on the one hand and on the other, to develop her agricultural land.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née en 1968, Madame A. Akossiwa est mariée et mère de six (6) enfants. En plus de l’agriculture, elle est une spécialiste dans la transformation de noix de palme en d’huile de palme. Elle exerce cette activité il y a des décennies. Dynamique et honnête, elle gère bien son activité. Pour la renforcer, elle sollicite un crédit qui lui servira d’une part à se ravitailler en noix de palme et d’autre part à développer son domaine agricole.

loans.use:
Purchasing a supply of palm nuts

Ravitaillement en noix de palme

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en: M. Zarina is 32 years old. She and her husband, who helps her with the business, are raising two wonderful children. Zarina’s children are small now, but already today she is working hard in order to ensure the best future for them. For more than five years Zarina has been repairing furniture. At the same time she purchases old furniture, repairs it and sells it in the furniture store. Zarina and her husband have become real experts in their business. Since Zarina has a lot of clients, the business is very successful and brings them a stable and significant income which allows Zarina to improve the living conditions of her family. Today Zarina requests $1000 dollars for purchasing old furniture in order to repair and sell it. Zarina would like to thank and ensure everyone supporting her that she will repay the loan within 12 months. Your support will really help her. Be an important part of the growth of Zarina’s business.

loans.use: Purchasing of old furniture

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.en: N. Zulfiya is 53 is years old. Zulfiya and her husband, who is a driver, have been married for almost 30 years and have raised three wonderful children. One of them is already married and has children of his own. Zulfiya has been running her own small business for 15 years already. She has a place for selling foodstuff such as macaroni, soft drinks, sweets, potted goods, detergents, soap, toothpaste and other items. She works from the 7:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m. Her daughter helps her in the store, registering the stock and serving clients. Zulfiya and her daughter are very friendly and polite which allows them to have the clientele. She is requesting a loan of $600 dollars. Zulfiya is planning to spend the loan for purchasing more goods for selling, thus increasing the range of products. Zulfiya promises to repay her loan during 6 months and thanks everybody who decides to support her.

loans.use: Increasing the stock

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Mr. Kokou A. was born on December 31, 1964 in Goga and presently resides in Afoudomé (in Zio County). Married and the father of two children, Mr. Kokou A. is a primary school teacher. His meager salary, often late to arrive, is not sufficient to cover expenses for his family which is the reason why he has begun to grow corn, at which he is succeeding well. He is requesting a loan to expand his field and purchase fertilizer. This will allow him to have a good harvest and contribute more toward improving living conditions for the family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur A. Kokou est né le 31 décembre 1964 à Goga et vit actuellement à Afoudomé (P/Zio). Marié et père de deux (2) enfants, Monsieur A. Kokou est un enseignant du cours primaire. Son maigre salaire qui tarde à tomber n’arrive pas à combler les charges familiales c’est pour cela qu’il s’est lancé dans la culture du maïs ce qui lui réussit bien. Il sollicite un financement pour renforcer son champ et acheter des engrais. Ceci lui permettra d’avoir un bon rendement et contribuer plus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use:
purchase of fertilizer and expansion of his corn field

Achat d'engrais et élargissement de champ de mais

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with grown kids. She runs a business selling children’s toys and other items in the central mall of Kahovka. When Tatyana started her business thirty years ago, she couldn’t find a decent job and had to find other ways to support her family. Today she has about $2000 in turnover capital and makes about $400 net profit per month.

Tatyana is hoping to keep her business running successfully and support her family. It is the only source of income for her family, and she is ready to work hard to overcome daily challenges in order to provide a better livelihood for them. We believe that, with her vision and determination to see things through and aim at success, Tatyana will see all her dreams come true.

loans.use: To increase her income

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akossiwa K. was born in 1970 in Lomé. She is married and the mother of 8 children. Her primary business is growing corn and manioc. Her husband is also a farmer. They both do their very best to support their family. She tends to her business with great devotion and was able to reimburse her previous loan with no problem. She is presently requesting a loan to extend her corn and manioc field and also to begin selling vegetables.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame K. Akossiwa est née en 1970 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de huit (8) enfants. Son activité principale est la culture de maïs et du manioc. Son mari comme elle est cultivateur. Tous deux essaient de se surpasser pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Très dévouée, elle gère bien ses activités et a su rembourser le précédent crédit sans incident. A présent, elle sollicite, un financement pour étendre son champ de maïs et de manioc et au même moment initier la vente de légumes.

loans.use:
Expansion of her farm

Extension de son exploitation agricole

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.en: T. Bashorat is 58 is years old. She is married and has two children. Her eldest son is already married and has children of his own who adore their grandparents. Bashorat’s husband is retired on a pension. That is why her business is the main source of income for her family. Her younger son helps her with the business. Bashorat is a market vendor. She is selling foodstuff such as sunflower-seed oil, sugar, tea, macaroni, and cookies. She has been in this business for ten years. The business is located in the center local market of Gafurov city, allowing Bashorat to serve many clients and to have her clientele. The business is successful at generating a stable income, allowing Bashorat to support her family. Today Bashorat requests $300 dollars for the term of 6 months. She is planning to purchase foodstuffs in order to enlarge the range of goods for selling. Bashorat thanks all for support and promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: To purchase goods for selling

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana has been selling groceries in the city market of Kahovka for the last three years. Currently she has about $1000 of turnover capital with $2000 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about $300.

This business provides the sole source of income for Tatyana’s family. A true entrepreneur, she studies the market to determine client needs and preferences. In addition to her marketing skills, Tatyana brings the qualities of efficiency and focused work to her business and seeks to offer affordable, quality merchandise. She is friendly and gracious, always seeking opportunities to meet the needs of her customers. Today Tatyana is requesting a loan of 2000 Grivnas to purchase additional inventory. With the increased profits, she plans to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Milian

texts.fr:
Mrs. Milian T. was born in 1977 in Gapé (Zio County). Presently living with her husband in Lonvo, she is a dynamic woman who is engaged in farming, particularly growing corn. The mother of 4 children, she is competent at her business which brings in the minimum income necessary to support her family. Wishing to increase her sales figures, she is requesting a loan that will allow her to extend her corn field and purchase fertilizer. This will help her to contribute more to the improvement of living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame T. Milian est née en 1977 à Gapé (P/Zio) Installée à Lonvo à côté de son mari, elle est une femme dynamique qui pratique l’agriculture et en particulier la culture de maïs. Mère de quatre (4) enfants, elle maîtrise bien son activité qui lui procure de revenu minimum pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Voulant accroître son chiffre d’affaires, elle sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra d’étendre son champ de maïs et d’acheter des engrais. Ceci pourra l’aider à contribuer plus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: purchase of fertilizer and expansion of her farmed land

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Mrs. Abra G. was born on December 31, 1969 in Lonvo (Zio County). Because she lacked financial resources, she left school at a young age to begin to farm. Married and the mother of 5 children, she manages to support her family thanks to the income from her field. Dynamic and enterprising, she is requesting a loan to expand the area she has planted in manioc so as to increase her income and contribute more to improving living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame G. Abra est née le 31 décembre 1969 à Lonvo (P/Zio). Par manque de support financier elle a abandonné très tôt ses études pour se lancer dans l’activité agricole. Mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants, elle arrive à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille grâce aux revenus que lui procure son champ. Dynamique et entreprenante, elle sollicite un crédit pour agrandir sa surface de manioc afin d’augmenter ses revenus pour contribuer davantage à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use:
expansion of her farm

Extension de son exploitaion agricole

loans.name: Djamshed

texts.ru:
Djamshed H. lives in Dushanbe, capital of Tajikistan. He is 45 years old, married and has 3 children. Djamshed has a college degree in economics and works as an accountant at a dental clinic. He wants to take out this loan in order to purchase a computer which he needs for his work and his children need for school. Djamshed is planning to pay back the loan in the next 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Хакбердыев Джамшед житель города Душанбе. Женат , имеет троих детей. Возраст 45 лет . Имеет высшее образование . По специальности экономист. Работает бухгалтером в стомотологической поликлинике – бухгалтером. Хочет получить кредит , чтобы купить компьютер, который очень ему необходим для его работы , а так же его детям. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 18 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of a computer

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Matluba Ergashevna M. lives in the city of Tursun-Zoda. She is 21 years old and has a high school degree. Matluba has a small bakery at the local market of Tursun-Zoda where she bakes rolls and filled savory pastries (pirozhki). Her parents are old and she is their sole supporter. Currently the prices for flour have been rising steadily and Matluba decided to purchase a large batch of flour from the wholesalers to keep the price of her baked goods low. To purchase a large batch of flour Matluba needs money and that is why she wants to take out this loan. She is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Махмудова Матлуба Эргашевна жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст 21 год, образование среднее. Матлуба имеет небольшой цех на рынке города Турсунзаде. Где производит пирожки и булочки. У Матлубы престарелые родители и ей приходится самой содержать семью. Сейчас идет рост цен на муку и она решила закупить у оптовых поставщиков муку.Для чего ей нужны деньги. Поэтому она решила взять кредит .Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of flour

loans.name: Ablavi  Agbéko

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ablavi Agbéko K. was born in 1983 in Lomé and left primary school because of lack of financial means. She began the business of selling corn and manages to participate in household expenses because of the income from her business. A real go-getter, she managed her first loan without trouble. Now she is requesting a loan that will permit her to strengthen her business by buying in large quantities. This will allow her to satisfy her customers' needs and increase her income.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame K. Ablavi Agbéko est née en 1983 à Lomé et a arrêté ses études primaires par manque de moyens. Elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de la vente de maïs, et arrive à participer aux charges du foyer par les revenus de son activité. Très battante, elle a su bien gérer le premier crédit sans incident. A présent, elle sollicite un crédit qui lui servira à renforcer son activité en achetant en grande quantité. Ceci lui permettra de satisfaire sa clientèle et d’accroître ses revenus.

loans.use:
buying and selling corn

Achat et vente de mais

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Bakh Yaye 1 Group

texts.fr:
The village of Mbam is located in a region that is particularly favorable to the cultivation of fruits and vegetables, and the majority of the villagers keep gardens. The fruit is often made into juice which is sold in the village as an affordable alternative to commercial soft drinks. The Bakh Yaye 1 women's group produces drinks from local products such as oranges, guavas, pineapple, hibiscus flowers, baobab fruit and ginger. The sale of these natural fruit drinks in the village markets creates a source of revenue which the women use to supplement their families' incomes.

Le village de Mbam appartient à la partie continentale de zone qui est favorable à l'exploitation maraichère et fruitière. La plupart des habitants s'adonne à cette activité de maraichage et à la transformation des fruits en jus pour réduire la consommation de la boisson industrielle (sodas) qui est très chère au sein de Mbam. Le Groupement des femmes de Bakh yaye 1 s'est lancée dans la transformation de produits fruitiers (oranges, goyaves, ananas, fruit du baobab, gingembre) pour en faire du jus de fruits (jus de bissap, jus d'oranges, jus d'ananas, jus de gingembre). Ces jus de fruits naturels transformés et embouteillés sont vendus dans les marchés hebdomadaires afin de garantir une source de revenu pour les femmes.

loans.use: Purchase of fruit juice production equipment and packaging

loans.name: Naila

texts.en: Naila was born in 1953 and she is married. She lives together with her husband in the village of Gračanica, near the town Živinice. Her husband works as a self-employed contractor . Najila takes care of the poultry and  she cultivate strawberries. They also earn  additional money by selling milk to the dairy. This is her first loan at MCO. She intends to invest this loan to buy a water-pump which she will use for strawberry watering. Her wish is to expand her strawberry business in order to increase monthly income for her family.

loans.use: To buy water-pump.
